instruction: What is Auto Translation for Comm100 chatbot and how does it work?
output: Comm100 chatbot supports Auto Translation based on Google Translation integration. Auto Translation enables the bot to chat with visitors using any language by detecting the visitor's language and translating messages automatically. The chatbot sends responses in the language used by the visitor in the latest message, and visitors can see both the original and translated messages in the chat window.

instruction: How can you enable Auto Translation for a Comm100 chatbot?
output: To enable Auto Translation for a Comm100 chatbot, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Go to Bot > Chatbot, expand the chatbot list, and click Manage. 3. In the chatbot list, locate the chatbot you want to enable the feature for, and click the Edit button in the Operations column. 4. Expand the Advanced section, and turn on the Auto Translation toggle key. 5. (Optional) To configure words and phrases that do not need translation, click the 'Click here' link in the Auto Translation area and add the words or phrases on the Auto Translation page.

instruction: What is an Outreach Campaign?
output: Comm100 Outreach is a messaging system that allows organizations to reach out to their customers on a mass level. It enables the delivery of emails, SMS, and WhatsApp messages to targeted customer groups in an automated and personalized way, combining the benefits of the Comm100 ticketing system for efficient follow-up.

instruction: How can you create an SMS Outreach Campaign?
output: To create an SMS outreach campaign, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Outreach Management > Outreach Campaigns, click New Outreach Campaign, and choose SMS. Complete the campaign settings, including the campaign name, target recipient filters, message content, and SMS channel account. Optionally, attach the message to a ticket. Save and preview the message, test the campaign if needed, and then schedule or send the campaign.

instruction: How do you set up Skill-Based Routing (SBR) in the Comm100 system?
output: To set up Skill-Based Routing (SBR) in the Comm100 system, you need to create skill types based on your business needs, assign these skills to agents, and then create routing rules to direct visitors to agents with matching skills. This involves logging into the Comm100 control panel, navigating to Global Settings > People > Skills to create skills, and then setting up routing rules under Live Chat > Campaign > Routing Rules.

instruction: How do you create routing rules in the Comm100 system?
output: To create routing rules in the Comm100 system, log in to the Comm100 control panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Routing Rules, and turn on the Enable toggle key. Select the 'Route visitors based on custom rules' option and click 'New Rule' to create a new rule. Enter a unique rule name, enable the rule, add conditions, set the department or agent to route visitors to, set the priority, and click OK. Finally, save the routing rule.

instruction: What are some best practices for naming a chatbot?
output: When creating a chatbot, ensure the bot name is short and simple, easy to pronounce and spell, creative and memorable, without negative connotations, in line with your brand, and culturally and politically acceptable.

instruction: How can you improve the accuracy of a chatbot over time?
output: Comm100 recommends reviewing the chatbot's Learning section regularly, starting with weekly reviews and extending to every two weeks, to improve the accuracy of the chatbot.

instruction: Why do I get the error 'Email or Password Is Wrong' when trying to log into Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The error can occur due to several reasons: an incorrect email or password has been entered, signing into the Control Panel from an incorrect website address, trying to log in to the Agent Console with an incorrect App, or the account no longer exists.

instruction: How can I resolve the 'Email or Password Is Wrong' error when logging into Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To resolve the error, ensure you are using the correct email and password, log in from the correct website address, use the correct Agent Console App, and if your live chat system is hosted on a cloud server, use the provided login links. If the system is deployed on your own server, use the dedicated login link with your specified domain.

instruction: What is the purpose of integrating Comm100 Live Chat with Cisco Finesse?
output: The integration allows Cisco agents to manage chats, emails, SMS, and social messages in the same place they take calls, improving agent efficiency and providing an optimal user experience.

instruction: What are the main steps to integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Cisco Finesse?
output: The main steps include logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, enabling the Cisco Unified Contact Center App, providing server details, mapping Comm100 agents with Cisco agents, downloading and installing the Comm100 Gadget, configuring the Finesse desktop, and managing agent statuses.

instruction: How can chat requests be distributed automatically in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Chat requests can be distributed to agents automatically using Comm100's auto distribution feature. This can be configured in the Comm100 Control Panel under Live Chat > Settings > Auto Distribution.

instruction: What are the key steps to configure Auto Distribution in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To configure Auto Distribution, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Settings > Auto Distribution, turn on the Auto Distribution toggle key, set the distribution rules based on your Live Chat package (Startup, Plus, or Ultra), and click Save.

instruction: Is Arabic/Hebrew supported in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Yes, Comm100 Live Chat fully supports Arabic or Hebrew on the visitor side. You just need to modify the language to enter your interface text in Arabic or Hebrew.

instruction: What are some common error messages you might encounter while using Comm100 Secure Messaging?
output: Some common error messages include 'Feature is not available', 'Request is invalid', 'Channel is disabled', 'Invalid token provided', 'Contact Service is temporarily unavailable', and 'Access token service is temporarily unavailable'.

instruction: What are the potential solutions for the 'Feature is not available' and 'Request is invalid' errors in Comm100 Secure Messaging?
output: For 'Feature is not available', you should contact the Comm100 Support team. For 'Request is invalid', you should check your installation code and ensure that the siteid and messengerid are provided correctly.

instruction: How can you enable SAML SSO for agents to log into Comm100?
output: To enable SAML SSO for agents to log into Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Global Settings > Security > Agent Single Sign-On, turn on the Agent Single Sign-On (SSO) toggle key, switch to SAML SSO, fill in the required information such as Remote Login URL, Remote Logout URL, and the SAML certificate, and then click Save.

instruction: What information is required to enable SAML SSO in Comm100?
output: To enable SAML SSO in Comm100, you need the remote login URL for your SAML, the remote logout URL (optional), and the SAML certificate from your SAML server. X.509 certificates are supported and should be in PEM or DER format.

instruction: What are the metrics included in the Canned Message Usage Dataset?
output: The metrics included in the Canned Message Usage Dataset are 'Used Agents' and 'Used Times'.

instruction: What are the attributes included in the Agent Status Log Dataset?
output: The attributes included in the Agent Status Log Dataset are 'Agent', 'Department', and 'Time'.

instruction: What is the 'Offline Message Submitted' event in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks?
output: The 'Offline Message Submitted' event in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks is triggered when a visitor submits an offline message. The event data is provided in JSON format and includes details about the offline message and the visitor.

instruction: What are some key properties included in the 'Offline Message Submitted' event data?
output: Key properties in the 'Offline Message Submitted' event data include the visitor's information (such as name, email, city, country, browser, and operating system) and the offline message details (such as content, department, and time of submission).

instruction: Can I put multiple chat buttons on the same web page?
output: Yes. You can put multiple chat buttons on the same web page. Comm100 provides a specified code for extra chat buttons. If you want to install an extra chat button on the web page where one or more chat buttons are already being used, you need to get the specified code for the extra chat button.

instruction: How can I get the code for extra chat buttons?
output: To get the code for extra chat buttons, you first need to enable the Multiple Campaigns feature. Then, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign, ensure that the campaign you want to use is selected from the Campaign drop-down list, and then click Installation. Click Advanced, and the code for the extra chat buttons will appear. Copy the code and paste it onto your webpage. If you need any help, please contact our support team.

instruction: How do you set up agent roles in the Comm100 system?
output: To set up agent roles in the Comm100 system, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > People > Roles, turn on the Roles toggle key, click New Role, add a name for the role, assign agents to the role, and click Save.

instruction: What are the default roles in the Comm100 system?
output: The default roles in the Comm100 system are Administrators and Agents. Administrators have all the permissions, while Agents have basic permissions such as accepting chats.

instruction: Why aren't the changes I am making in Comm100 reflected on my website?
output: The possible causes could be: having more than one campaign and not making changes to the right one, not saving the changes, or not refreshing/reloading the webpage after saving the changes. To resolve this, ensure you are customizing the right campaign, save the changes, and refresh your webpage.

instruction: What is required before an agent can start accepting chats with Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Before an agent can start accepting chats, the system admin needs to get the live chat code and paste it onto the website. Once the code is pasted, a chat button appears on the website, allowing agents to chat with visitors in the Agent Console window.

instruction: What are the steps an agent needs to follow to start accepting chats in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To start accepting chats, an agent needs to: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Go to Live Chat > Get Online & Chat from the left navigation menu. 3. In the Visitors tab, view the visitors browsing the website. 4. Click the Details link in the Visitor tab to see detailed information. 5. Open the website with the live chat code and click the chat button to initiate a chat request. 6. Accept the chat request in the Live Chat tab of the Agent Console. 7. Communicate with the visitor by sending and receiving messages. 8. Categorize and add notes to each chat in the Wrap-up panel during or after the chat session.

instruction: How can you integrate Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging System with Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To integrate Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging System with Comm100 Live Chat, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Apps & Integration from the left navigation menu, click Settings of the Ticketing & Messages Integration tile, turn on the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging Integration toggle key, and click Save.

instruction: What can you do after integrating Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging with Comm100 Live Chat?
output: After integrating Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging with Comm100 Live Chat, you can convert offline messages and chat transcripts into tickets directly, allowing you to track and follow up chats and offline messages in the Ticket module of your Agent Console.

instruction: How can an agent transfer an ongoing chat to another online agent using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To transfer the chat to an online agent, follow these steps: 1. On the Agent Console conversation panel, click the 'Transfer the chat to another agent or department' icon. 2. On the 'Transfer the Chat to' popup, select the 'Agent' option. 3. From the drop-down list, select an online agent you want to transfer the chat to. 4. (Optional) If you want to leave the chat after the transfer, select the 'Leave chat after transfer' check box. 5. Click 'Transfer'. The chat is successfully transferred to the online agent.

instruction: How can an agent transfer an ongoing chat to another department using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To transfer the chat to a department, follow these steps: 1. On the Agent Console conversation panel, click the 'Transfer the chat to another agent or department' icon. 2. On the 'Transfer the Chat to' popup, select the 'Department' option. 3. From the department list, select the department you want to transfer the chat to. 4. (Optional) If you want to leave the chat after the transfer, select the 'Leave chat after transfer' check box. 5. Click 'Transfer'. The chat is successfully transferred to one available agent in that department depending on the Auto Distribution Method.

instruction: What are the basic components of a regular expression?
output: The basic components of a regular expression include character classes, special characters, and quantifiers. Character classes match specific sets of characters, special characters expand the use of regex, and quantifiers specify how many instances of a character or group to match.

instruction: Can you provide examples of regular expressions used for searching specific patterns in emails?
output: Yes, examples include: 1) Searching for an order with the pattern 'order id:[0-9]+'; 2) Searching for a report with the pattern 'report id salesforce_[0-9]+'; 3) Searching for an invoice with the pattern 'item_type:|electronics|mobile'.

instruction: How do I disable Auto Invitations on mobile-optimized websites using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To disable Auto Invitations on mobile-optimized websites using Comm100 Live Chat, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Integrations & API > Custom Variables. 3. Click Settings. 4. Click New Custom Variable. 5. Define the Variable Name of your choice (e.g., 'From Mobile'). 6. From the Type drop-down list, select Text. 7. In the Value field, provide: /mobile|android|ipad/.test(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()) ? 'Yes' : 'No'. 8. In the Hyperlink field, add a hyperlink to the value of a custom variable. 9. Click Save. 10. Now, from the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Invitation. 11. From the Auto Invitations tab, select the auto invitation that you wish to disable on mobile-optimized websites. 12. Under the Conditions area, add a condition using the Custom Variable as 'From Mobile is No'. 13. Click Save. The configuration is now complete, and your Live Chat will not send Auto Invitations when visitors access your websites via mobile devices.

instruction: What are the benefits of exporting and importing a chatbot in Comm100?
output: The prime benefits of exporting and importing a chatbot are: 1. Back-Up: You can take a backup of existing chatbots to use later in case of data loss or reuse. 2. Reuse the Chatbot: You can transfer an existing chatbot to another Comm100 account or campaign.

instruction: How can you export a chatbot in Comm100?
output: To export a chatbot, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. In the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. 3. Click the drop-down list and go to the Manage chatbots area. 4. Click Manage. 5. Click Export Bot for the chatbot you want to export. The data is saved in an XML file on your local file system.

instruction: How can I add tags to my social media conversations using Comm100's Social Media Integration?
output: To add tags to your social media conversations using Comm100's Social Media Integration, log in to your Comm100 Agent Console, click the Ticketing & Messaging tab, select a conversation, click the Add link, choose existing tags or create new ones, and click OK to confirm. You can manage tags by clicking the Manage Tags icon.

instruction: What is the purpose of using tags in Comm100's Social Media Integration?
output: The purpose of using tags in Comm100's Social Media Integration is to organize social media queries by assigning keywords or phrases to conversations, making it easier to group and review messages later.

instruction: What is the benefit of integrating Comm100 Live Chat with Facebook for visitors?
output: Visitors can click the Facebook icon in the Pre-Chat window to sign in without filling out the pre-chat form. If a visitor initiates a chat by signing in with a social media account, their information (Avatar, Name, Email, and more) will be automatically displayed in the Visitor monitor.

instruction: How can you set up a login form with Facebook in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up a login form with Facebook, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the drop-down list and go to Pre-Chat. 4. Turn on the Facebook login toggle key. 5. Click Save.

instruction: Why can't I send WhatsApp messages after integrating my account with Comm100?
output: After integrating your WhatsApp account with Comm100, you may be unable to send messages because Twilio doesn't automatically add the required Area Code to the WhatsApp number when shared with Comm100. As a result, the outgoing messages from Comm100 fail to reach the customer.

instruction: How can I solve the issue of not being able to send WhatsApp messages from Comm100?
output: To solve this issue, you need to add an Area Code to the outgoing WhatsApp number. You can do this by logging into your Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > WhatsApp, and editing the phone number to include the Area Code in the Phone number field. Save the changes, and the Area Code will be successfully added to the connected WhatsApp Business account.

instruction: How can I enable JavaScript in my web browser?
output: Enabling JavaScript is required for some of the Comm100 features to work. The instructions vary depending on the browser you are using. For example, in Google Chrome, you need to click the wrench icon, select Settings, scroll down to Show Advanced Settings, click Content Settings under Privacy, and select 'Allow all sites to run JavaScript (recommended)' under JavaScript.

instruction: How do I enable JavaScript in Google Chrome?
output: To enable JavaScript in Google Chrome, click the wrench icon to the right of the address bar, select Settings from the dropdown list, scroll down the page and click Show Advanced Settings, click Content Settings under Privacy, and select 'Allow all sites to run JavaScript (recommended)' under JavaScript.

instruction: How can I install Comm100 Live Chat on my Weebly website?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on your Weebly website, log in to your Weebly account, locate your website and click the Edit button to open its admin panel. Find the EMBED CODE item in the left sidebar, drag it into your website content, paste your live chat code into the custom HTML frame, and publish your website. You should then see the chat button on your website.

instruction: How can you hide the Live Chat button on mobile websites if you use the same site code for both desktop and mobile versions?
output: You can hide the Live Chat button on mobile websites by either adding custom JavaScript code to the Comm100 Live Chat code or by customizing the Mobile View of the Image type of chat button.

instruction: What are the steps to hide the chat button on mobile sites using custom JavaScript code?
output: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window. 3. Expand the Advanced menu. 4. Select the 'Add custom JavaScript to my chat window' option under the Advanced menu and add the provided code. 5. Click Save. The Live Chat button will disappear from your mobile websites after the settings are successfully saved.

instruction: How can I make my chat button show as online after installing Live Chat?
output: To make your chat button show as online, log in to the Agent Console with an online status. You can use the Desktop apps for Windows & Mac, Web app, or mobile apps for iPad, iPhone, and Android devices. Alternatively, you can use the web app from your browser without installing additional files. In your Comm100 account, click 'Get Online & Chat' to open Agent Console in your browser. After that, the chat button on your site will show online, allowing visitors to chat with you instantly.

instruction: How can you add Comm100 Live Chat to an Ansak Stores site?
output: To add Comm100 Live Chat to an Ansak Stores site, log in to the Administration Panel, click Page Management, add a new page, input the Title and Extended Header, click the HTML icon, paste the live chat code into the HTML Source Editor, click Update, and save the newly created page. The Comm100 Live Chat button will then appear on your Ansak Store site.

instruction: What should you not do when pasting the live chat code into the HTML Source Editor?
output: You should not change the live chat code when pasting it into the HTML Source Editor.

instruction: How can I install Comm100 Live Chat on Corecommerce?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on Corecommerce, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Corecommerce Dashboard. 2. Click the Design menu on the left, then select Edit HTML/CSS. 3. Choose footer.html or header.html in the drop-down list under Edit HTML/CSS to install live chat on every page. 4. Get Live Chat Code and paste it before the closing tag. 5. Click Publish All to save the changes.

instruction: What is the purpose of routing rules in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Routing rules dictate which department or agent is assigned a ticket when a customer reaches out and a new ticket is created. These rules ensure that tickets are immediately routed to the person best suited to handle the request.

instruction: How can you configure routing rules in Comm100?
output: To configure routing rules in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Routing Rules, turn ON the toggle key, and follow the steps to assign tickets to specific departments or agents, or create custom rules based on various conditions.

instruction: How can I reset an agent's password in my account?
output: To reset an agent's password, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Global Settings > People > Agents, click the Reset Password icon in the Operations column, enter the new password and confirm it, then click Save.

instruction: How can I install Comm100 Live Chat on my OpenCart website?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on your OpenCart website, follow these steps: 1. Go to the Admin login page and log in. 2. Click the System module and choose Settings. 3. Click Edit in the Action column. 4. Choose Server and scroll down the page to the end. 5. Paste the code in the Google Analytics Code area. 6. Click Save on the top right of your page. Now, you can see the chat button on your website.

instruction: How can I create custom fields for my tickets in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: With the Fields & Mappings feature of Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, you can create additional fields that help give context to a ticket. These fields allow you to capture information and save it to a ticket. You can create custom fields with various types such as Text, Text area, Email, URL, Link, Date, Phone, Integer, Float, Agent, Department, Radio button, Checkbox, Dropdown list, and Checkbox list. To create custom fields, log in to Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Fields & Mappings, click New Field, select a data type, provide field details, and click Save.

instruction: How do I create field mappings in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To create field mappings, log in to Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Fields & Mappings, select the Mappings tab, click the pencil icon under the Operations column, choose the mapping field from the Chat field and/or Offline message field, and click Save. The system obtains the value for the Chat field or Offline message field depending on the channel of the ticket.

instruction: How can you use webhooks in Comm100 Task Bot?
output: Comm100 Task Bot allows you to send and receive data to an external server or third-party services like Salesforce, Zendesk, Zapier, etc., using Webhook. By using the HTTP POST method, Task Bot Webhook can perform RESTful operations as per your business needs.

instruction: What format is supported by Task Bot Webhooks?
output: Task Bot Webhooks do not accept XML format. Only the JSON format is supported.

instruction: Why am I seeing IP addresses instead of visitor names in the Agent Console?
output: You are seeing IP addresses instead of visitor names because the pre-chat window is not enabled, the Name field is either invisible or not set as required, you are using a custom pre-chat field instead of the system default Name field, or the configuration for custom variables to automatically get the name data has not been properly done.

instruction: How can I ensure that visitor names are displayed instead of IP addresses in the Agent Console?
output: To ensure that visitor names are displayed, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select the correct campaign, go to Pre-chat and turn on the toggle key. Select the fields you want your visitors to fill in and mark them visible and required. Make sure to use the system default Name field and configure any custom variables correctly.

instruction: How can I add Comm100 Live Chat to my Shopsite store?
output: To add Comm100 Live Chat to your Shopsite store, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Shopsite account. 2. Hover over Preferences and select Layout Settings. 3. Get the live chat code and paste it at the bottom of the Footer section. 4. Click Save Changes at the bottom of the page. 5. Click Publish Changes to apply the code, and you will see the chat button when you view the store.

instruction: How can you create quick replies for a chatbot?
output: To create quick replies for a chatbot, follow these steps: Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. In the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. Select your Chatbot from the drop-down list. Go to Event Messages. On the Event Messages page, click the Pencil icon beside the Message when a visitor starts a chat. On the Edit Message page, select the channel. From the Actions section, drag the Send quick reply and click the Plus icon to input the option text. Link each option to an Intent from your intent library. Click Save.

instruction: What are the steps to create canned quick replies for a chatbot?
output: To create canned quick replies for a chatbot, follow these steps: Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. In the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. Select your Chatbot from the drop-down list and go to Canned Quick Replies. Click New Canned Quick Replies. Enter a Name and choose between triggering an intent or contacting an agent. Select an intent from your intent library and link the intent. Click OK and then Save.

instruction: How do you configure the operating hours and holidays feature in the ticketing and messaging system?
output: To configure the operating hours and holidays feature, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Operating Hours & Holidays. On the Operating Hours tab, select the checkboxes for the days your customer service team is working and select your working hours. On the Holidays tab, click the New Holiday button to set your holidays. You can also edit or remove an existing holiday from the Operations column. Finally, click Save.

instruction: What are business days and how are they used in the ticketing system?
output: Business days are the days when your team is working, and they are used to count days within trigger rules. Non-selected days will be skipped when rules are calculated.

instruction: What are the requirements for importing chatbot intents?
output: The requirements for importing chatbot intents include supported file formats (XLS, XLSX, CSV), a maximum file size of 1MB, a maximum of 1000 intents, intent names must be less than 50 characters, category definition using a single slash for the root category path, multiple question variations for the same intent separated by a vertical bar, and non-empty responses that can only be text or URL.

instruction: What happens if 'Replace' is enabled during the import of chatbot intents?
output: If 'Replace' is enabled, the importing action will overwrite all existing intents. If not enabled, intents with different names from existing ones will be imported as new ones, and if the intent name is the same but the visitor's questions are different, the questions will be imported into the corresponding intent.

instruction: How can you export a voice bot in Comm100?
output: To export a voice bot in Comm100, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Voice Bot in the left navigation menu, expand the voice bot drop-down list, click Manage in the Manage Voice Bots area, locate the target voice bot, click the more icon in the Operations column, and choose Voice Bot Export. The voice bot data is saved in an XML file on your local file system.

instruction: What is the process to import a voice bot in Comm100?
output: To import a voice bot in Comm100, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Voice Bot in the left navigation menu, expand the voice bot drop-down list, click Manage in the Manage Voice Bots area, locate the target voice bot, click the more icon in the Operations column, and choose Voice Bot Import. Upload the XML file and click Import. All configurations and data excluding Channel settings and call logs are replaced by the new bot after importing succeeds.

instruction: What are some common use cases for triggers in a ticketing system?
output: Triggers are used to send out emails and notifications both internally to a department or agent, and to customers. Common use cases include sending acknowledgment emails to customers, notifying teams of ticket status changes, and handling tickets from VIP customers.

instruction: How do you set up triggers in the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To set up triggers, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Triggers, click New Triggers, fill in the Name and Description, turn on the Enable toggle key, select an event from the Event drop-down menu, define conditions for the trigger, set the action for the trigger, and click Save.

instruction: What are the main benefits of integrating Comm100 with Salesforce?
output: Comm100's integration with Salesforce allows you to access customer information in the Comm100 Agent Console easily and synchronize data conveniently from Comm100 to Salesforce. The integration delivers a consistent customer information management experience and improves your agent efficiency.

instruction: What are the steps to connect Comm100 with Salesforce CRM?
output: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Apps & Integration. 3. Go to the Salesforce card, and click Settings. 4. Click Connect with Salesforce and then provide your Salesforce login credentials in the popup. Note: You need to have particular sets of permissions in your Salesforce account for the integration to work. It is recommended that you use an Admin SF account.

instruction: How can I integrate live chat into my iOS or Android app using native frameworks?
output: To integrate live chat into your iOS app using the native framework, you need to form the chat URL with your site ID and campaign ID, import VisitorClient.framework into your iOS project, and set the response to the chat button touch event. For Android apps, you need to import visitor-client-v1.1.aar into your Android project and call the button’s instance method setOnClickListener to show ChatActivity.

instruction: How can I integrate live chat into my app if it is not using native frameworks?
output: If your app framework is not iOS or Android Native, such as Hybrid and React Native, you can implement the live chat window into the app using the WKWebView (for an iOS app) or WebView (for an Android app) solution. For React Native apps, you need to install the React Native WebView component, import WebView into your component, and load the chat window in your app.

instruction: What are the authentication methods available for accessing Comm100 API?
output: Comm100 allows you to access its APIs via API Key Authentication and OAuth Authentication.

instruction: How can you find your API Key for Comm100 Live Chat API?
output: To find your API Key, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, hover over the avatar and click the agent name at the bottom-left of your navigation menu, expand the More Information section, and check your API Key at the bottom of the My Profile page.

instruction: What are the benefits of displaying agents' title and bio in the chat window?
output: Displaying agents' title and bio in the chat window provides a quick overview of agents' job responsibilities, level of job, experience, or expertise, which helps deliver a better customer experience when they are chatting with your agents.

instruction: How can you enable agent bio and agent title in the Comm100 chat window?
output: To enable agent bio and agent title in the chat window, follow these steps: 1. On the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window. 2. Choose a chat window style with a header. 3. Go to Header and select the Agent title and Agent bio checkboxes under the Agent Info setting. 4. Click Save. After a chat starts, the agent's title and bio info will show to your visitors in the chat window.

instruction: How can I find the Telnyx API Key and Phone Number for SMS integration with Comm100?
output: To find the Telnyx API Key and Phone Number, log in to your Telnyx account, go to 'API Keys' from the left navigation menu, copy the API Key to the clipboard, then go to 'Numbers' from the left navigation menu, locate the Telnyx Phone number in the list, and copy the number to the clipboard.

instruction: What happens if the Telnyx API Key is inactive or deleted after configuring SMS integration?
output: If the Telnyx API Key is inactive or deleted after configuring SMS integration, you will still receive SMS messages but will not be able to send a reply. You will receive a failed authentication message for the API Key.

instruction: How can you configure conditions in a Comm100 chatbot?
output: To configure a Condition in a Comm100 chatbot, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Bot > Chatbot, select a bot, and go to Intents. Choose an existing Intent or create a new one, then drag the Conditions card and link it with the Collect variable data. Click Add Condition to open the New Condition drawer, set up conditions based on your needs, and click Save. Once conditions are configured, link other action cards with the branch in the chatbot workflow and click Save & Leave.

instruction: What are the operator types available for creating conditions in Comm100?
output: The operator types available for creating conditions in Comm100 are: is, is not, contains, does not contain, is greater than, is less than, meets regular expression, is more than, is less than, before, and after.

instruction: How can you install Comm100 Live Chat onto a website built on the Webs platform?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat onto a website built on the Webs platform, sign in to your account at www.webs.com, go to the Builder option, click the Other option in the bottom bar, drag the Custom HTML frame into your website content, paste your live chat code into the HTML content section, and save the changes. Finally, publish your website to check out the chat button.

instruction: How do you add the live chat code to your Webs website?
output: To add the live chat code to your Webs website, click the Other option in the bottom bar, drag the Custom HTML frame into your website content, double click on the HTML frame to edit it, paste your live chat code into the HTML content section, and click Save Changes to save.

instruction: What are the main datasets included in the Bot metrics and attributes?
output: The main datasets included in the Bot metrics and attributes are Chatbot Intent Detection Record and Task Bot Trigger Record.

instruction: What are some of the key metrics for the Chatbot Intent Detection Record dataset?
output: Some of the key metrics for the Chatbot Intent Detection Record dataset include Answers, Helpful Rate, High Confidence Answers, % of High Confidence Answers, No Answers, No Rate, Not Helpful Rate, and Possible Answers.

instruction: What are intents in the context of chatbots?
output: Intents represent the intentions of a website visitor, such as 'Booking a ticket,' 'Paying a fee,' or 'Finding a news article.' They are contained in the questions that visitors ask to chatbots.

instruction: How can you set up intents for a chatbot?
output: To set up intents for a chatbot, you need to log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Chatbots, select a chatbot, go to Intents, and click 'New Intent.' Then, you name the intent, select or create a category, input the questions, and provide the answers.

instruction: Why are chat transcripts not being delivered to my email inbox?
output: The chat transcripts are not being delivered to your email inbox even if you have the 'Automatically email chat transcripts for archiving or follow-up' check box selected. Possible causes include: the email address specified in Comm100 is different from the email inbox you are checking, incorrect format for multiple email addresses, transcripts not enabled for the right campaign, or agents have not completed the wrap-up fields.

instruction: How can I ensure chat transcripts are delivered to my email inbox?
output: To ensure chat transcripts are delivered to your email inbox: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Navigate to Live Chat > Campaign. 3. Select your campaign from the Campaign drop-down list. 4. Navigate to Chat Window > Advanced. 5. Make sure the email address is correct and check for typos. 6. If you have multiple recipients, separate them by commas. 7. If Agent Wrap-Up is required, the transcript will be sent when the wrap-up form is completed or 1 hour after the chat ends, whichever comes first.

instruction: Why are offline messages not being delivered to my email inbox?
output: Agents are not getting offline messages in their email inbox. Potential causes include: the email address specified in Comm100 is different from the email inbox you are checking, incorrect format for multiple email addresses, and messages not enabled for the right Campaign. The solution involves logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to the Live Chat tab, selecting the correct Campaign in the Offline Message tab, ensuring the email address is correct, and adding one email entry per line for multiple recipients. If the issue persists, contact your email service provider or ISP for further testing and analysis.

instruction: What is the purpose of Comm100 Reports?
output: Comm100 provides robust reports focusing on data and metrics that matter most to chat quality, agent performance, visitor satisfaction, Chatbot performance, and Ticketing & Messaging performance to help make informed decisions for improvement.

instruction: What information does the Real-Time Report provide in Comm100 Live Chat Reports?
output: The Real-Time Report shows real-time live chat data and an overview of today's chat performance, including metrics such as the number of ongoing chats, available agents, queue length, and visitor satisfaction.

instruction: How can you add multiple email signatures in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To add multiple email signatures in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, follow these steps: 1. Log in to Comm100 Agent Console. 2. Navigate to Preferences > Ticketing & Messaging. 3. On the Ticketing & Messaging pop-up, go to Email Signature and select an email account. 4. Using the formatting toolbar, create your signature in the text field and click OK. 5. You can change the email account from the Reply with drop-down list when replying to an email. The email signature auto changes to the corresponding email account.

instruction: What happens to the email signature if you disable an email account from the Control Panel?
output: If you disable an email account from the Control Panel, its corresponding signature disappears from the Agent Console’s Preferences tab. However, by enabling the email account, you can recover the same.

instruction: How can you create a new contact in the Comm100 Contact Management system?
output: To create a new contact, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Contact Management > Contacts, click New Contact on the top toolbar, enter the contact's information, and click Save.

instruction: What are the steps to import contacts from a file into the Comm100 Contact Management system?
output: To import contacts, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Contact Management > Contacts, click Import Contacts on the top toolbar, download the sample file and edit your file according to the format, upload your file, choose the way to process duplicate contacts, and click Import.

instruction: How can I install Comm100 Live Chat on a self-hosted website?
output: Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Installation, copy the live chat code, and paste it onto your website code before the closing part in your website's HTML files.

instruction: What should I do if I use a website builder to install Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Follow the integration guide provided for your specific website builder. If you are not familiar with coding or do not have access to your website's source code, email the live chat code to your webmaster or the person who built your site for help.

instruction: What are some best practices for making bots accessible?
output: Some best practices for making bots accessible include deploying both chatbots and voice bots to accommodate users with different abilities, prioritizing accessibility in live chat by conforming to WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards, using accessible fonts and color contrast, enabling auto translation for chatbots, sending links to open in another window, optimizing the chat flow with event messages and smart triggers, simplifying language and avoiding jargon, and ensuring rich media accessibility by providing alternative text for images, captions or transcripts for videos, and using accessible buttons.

instruction: How can you optimize the chat flow for accessibility?
output: To optimize the chat flow for accessibility, you can use event messages to guide customers through the conversation, smart triggers to automate chatbot actions based on defined conditions, and the change language feature to allow customers to choose their preferred language. These strategies help ensure that users can navigate the chat effectively and receive the support they need.

instruction: How can you share web pages using the Push Page feature in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: With Comm100 Live Chat, the Push Page option allows you to send a long URL link by displaying it as text, making the message more readable for visitors. During the chat session, the Push Page feature allows you to automatically redirect your visitors to the online content or point them to the needed information without any clicks. To send a link using Push Page, follow these steps: 1. Log in to Comm100 Agent Console. 2. On the ongoing chat conversation, navigate to the replying area, and click the Push Page icon. 3. On the Push Page pop-up, provide the URL, Text to Display, and Push page in information. You can choose Push Page among the following types—The Side Window, Current Browser Window, or A New Window/Tab. 4. Click OK. The Push Page link appears on the Conversation Pane. On the visitor’s side, the URL sent using Push Page opens automatically based on the option chosen in the Push Page in field without being clicked.

instruction: What event does the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging Webhook support that is discussed in the document?
output: The event discussed is 'When a Ticket is Moved to Recycle Bin'.

instruction: What format is the data in when the 'When a Ticket is Moved to Recycle Bin' event occurs?
output: The data is in JSON format.

instruction: How can you integrate a WeChat Official Account with Comm100?
output: To integrate a WeChat Official Account with Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > WeChat, click the Add WeChat Official Account button, scan your WeChat QR code using your admin's personal WeChat ID, confirm the authorization on your WeChat ID, and your WeChat Official Account will be added.

instruction: What are some important notes to keep in mind when using Comm100's WeChat Integration?
output: Some important notes include: the maximum number of characters an agent can input in a single message is 2000, agents can only reply to messages received within 48 hours, and agents cannot reply to a visitor who has unsubscribed from the integrated WeChat account.

instruction: What are the steps to create a custom report in Comm100?
output: The steps to create a custom report in Comm100 include choosing a dataset, adding metrics and attributes, setting up chart visualization, and filtering out unwanted data.

instruction: What types of datasets are available for creating custom reports in Comm100?
output: The available datasets for creating custom reports in Comm100 include Live Chat datasets (Chat, Offline Message, Visit, Queue, Auto Invitation, Manual Invitation), Ticketing & Messaging datasets (Ticket, Ticket SLA), Bot datasets (Chatbot Intent Detection Record, Taskbot Trigger Record), and Global Settings datasets (Canned Message Usage, Agent Status Log).

instruction: What is the Offline Message Window?
output: The Offline Message Window is used for website visitors to leave offline messages when the status of the chat button is offline. Visitors can also choose to leave offline messages if they don’t want to wait for agents to answer their chat requests. Although offline messages can be viewed in your Comm100 account, you can set them to receive visitors’ messages in your email addresses.

instruction: How can you customize the Comm100 Live Chat Offline Message Window?
output: To customize the Comm100 Live Chat Offline Message Window, log in to your Comm100 account, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select a campaign, and go to Offline Message. Choose whether to open the Default Comm100 Offline Message Window, redirect visitors to a custom page, or trigger a Task Bot. Set your team name, avatar, and greeting message, define the visible and required fields, and specify the email addresses where visitors’ offline messages will be sent. Finally, click Save.

instruction: How can I change my payment information in the Comm100 system?
output: To change your payment information in the Comm100 system, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > Billing > Billing Profile, click Change in the Payment Info section, choose your payment method, complete the payment information, and click Save.

instruction: How can I change my Comm100 password?
output: To change your Comm100 password, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, hover over the agent icon in the left navigation bar, click 'Change Password', enter your current and new passwords, and click 'Save'.

instruction: How do you install Messenger on your website?
output: To install Messenger on your website, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Messenger, select the Messenger you want to install, go to the Installation tab, click Copy Code, and paste the entire installation code into your website before the closing </body> tag. Optionally, you can click the Live Preview link to check how the Messenger looks on your website.

instruction: What should you do if you need help with the installation code?
output: You can email the installation code to your webmaster for assistance.

instruction: How can you assign social media queries to a specified agent or department in Comm100?
output: You can assign social media queries to a specified agent or department in Comm100 by using the Social Media Routing feature. This involves logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to Ticketing & Messaging, enabling Routing Rules, and then creating custom routing rules based on predefined conditions.

instruction: What steps are involved in creating a new custom routing rule in Comm100?
output: To create a new custom routing rule in Comm100, you need to log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging, enable Routing Rules, click on New Rule, define the rule parameters such as name, conditions, department or agent, and priority, and then save the changes.

instruction: What are some best practices for improving live chat quality?
output: Some best practices for improving live chat quality include showing empathy, avoiding passive voice, responding promptly, asking the right questions, practicing appropriate chat etiquette, having thorough product knowledge, and conducting customer surveys.

instruction: Why is it important to avoid using passive voice in live chat?
output: It is important to avoid using passive voice in live chat because it can indicate denial of responsibility. Using an active voice conveys that the agent has taken responsibility for the customer's issue, making the customer feel like they have someone in the organization working personally to resolve their queries.

instruction: How do you install Secure Messenger on your website?
output: To install Secure Messenger on your website, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Secure Messaging, click the Secure Messenger link or the Install code icon, complete the security configuration, send the JWT of authorized customers to Secure Messenger, and click the Live Preview link to check how Secure Messenger looks on your website.

instruction: What are the key steps to complete the security configuration for Secure Messenger?
output: To complete the security configuration for Secure Messenger, you need to configure JWT validation, provide the Secure Messaging Contact Identity Key name, and specify the URLs to allow embedding Secure Messenger.

instruction: How can you bind a chat button with a specified agent or department?
output: You can bind a chat button with a defined agent or department by logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to the Live Chat tab, selecting a campaign, going to Routing Rules, turning on the Routing Rules toggle key, selecting the specific department or agent you want to bind the chat button with, setting the priority, and saving the changes. The chat requests from this chat button will then be automatically routed to the selected agent or department.

instruction: What are the main datasets included in the Ticketing & Messaging section of the Custom Report?
output: The main datasets included in the Ticketing & Messaging section of the Custom Report are the Ticket dataset and the Ticket SLA dataset.

instruction: What types of metrics are available in the Ticket SLA dataset?
output: The Ticket SLA dataset includes metrics such as SLA First Response Time, SLA Breached Tickets, SLA First Response Achieved Tickets, % SLA First Response Rate, SLA First Response Total Tickets, SLA Next Respond Time, SLA Next Response Achieved Tickets, % SLA Next Response Rate, SLA Resolution Achieved Tickets, % SLA Resolution Rate, SLA Resolution Time, and SLA Resolution Total Tickets.

instruction: Why does the chat button image not display on my site?
output: There are several potential causes: 1) Using the Text Link chat button without defining any Text Content, 2) Enabling the option to hide the chat button when the team is offline and having no online agents, 3) Enabling the option to display the chat button on specified domains/URLs only, and 4) Other unspecified reasons.

instruction: How can I fix the issue of the chat button image not displaying on my site?
output: To fix the issue: 1) Log in to your Agent Console window and ensure the chat button is working. If you don't want the offline image to be invisible, clear the 'Hide chat button when my team is offline' check box in your Control Panel's Chat Button page. 2) Log in to your control panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select your campaign, and go to Chat Button > Advanced. Ensure the 'Display chat button on specified domains/URLs only' check box is selected and input the correct website domain/URLs. 3) Input text like 'Chat Now' in the text content to display your Text Link button on the web page. 4) Contact the Comm100 support team if the issue persists.

instruction: How can I customize the greeting message in the chat window?
output: To customize the greeting message in the chat window, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, click the Live Chat tab in the left navigation bar, select Chat Window from the Campaign drop-down menu, click Advanced, edit the Greeting Message, and then click Save.

instruction: How can you configure Event Messages in the Comm100 Chatbot?
output: To configure Event Messages, log in to the Comm100 account, go to Bot > Chatbot from the left navigation menu, select your Chatbot from the drop-down list, go to Event Messages, click the Pencil icon under the Operations header, use the available Actions to configure the message, and click Save.

instruction: What are some scenarios that trigger Event Messages in the Comm100 Chatbot?
output: Scenarios that trigger Event Messages include when a visitor starts a chat, when a visitor's question is not recognized, and when a visitor rates an answer as not helpful.

instruction: What compliance standards do Comm100 GPT features adhere to?
output: Comm100 GPT features adhere to GDPR, ISO 27001, SOC2, HIPPA, and PCI DSS compliance standards.

instruction: How does the Azure OpenAI Service ensure data privacy and security?
output: The Azure OpenAI Service ensures data privacy and security by not making the data accessible to other Comm100 or Microsoft customers, not allowing OpenAI, Inc. access to the data, not using the data to improve OpenAI models, and not using the data to improve any Comm100 or Microsoft products or services. Additionally, the data is not used for automatically improving Azure OpenAI models for your use in your resource.

instruction: Can I have my own branding image in the visitor side windows?
output: Yes, you can put your own branding image (logo) in the visitor side window including Chat Window, Offline Message Window, and Pre-Chat Window.

instruction: How can I add a branding image to the chat window?
output: To add a branding image to the chat window, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, click Live Chat in the left navigation bar, select Chat Window from the Campaign drop-down menu, go to the Header section, click the Select banner image link, choose an image from the gallery or upload your own, and click Save.

instruction: How can I add agents to my Comm100 account?
output: To add agents to your Comm100 account, log in to your Comm100 control panel, go to Global Settings > People > Agents, click New Agent, enter the agent's information, and click Save.

instruction: What information do I need to provide when adding a new agent to Comm100?
output: When adding a new agent to Comm100, you need to provide the agent's email address, first name, last name, display name, password, departments, roles, and whether the agent is active. You can also add more information such as the agent's title, bio, phone number, and time zone settings.

instruction: How can visitors send email chat transcripts to themselves in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Visitors can send email chat transcripts to themselves by enabling the feature in the Comm100 Control Panel. This involves navigating to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window, expanding the Options for Visitors menu, and selecting the 'Allow visitors to email chat transcripts' checkbox. Visitors can then customize the sender information, use their own SMTP server, and customize the email subject.

instruction: What customization options are available for email chat transcripts in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The customization options for email chat transcripts in Comm100 Live Chat include setting the 'Send from' email address, using your own SMTP server, and customizing the email subject. These options allow you to personalize the sender information, track email statistics, and change the predefined email subject sent to the visitor.

instruction: What is Agent Assist for Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging and how does it work?
output: Agent Assist for Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging channels works similarly to the Comm100 Live Chat on Agent Console. Once enabled on the Comm100 Control Panel, it works for all Ticketing & Messaging channels except Email. It helps agents save time by providing pre-existing answers and standardized responses for continuity among agents.

instruction: How can agents add visitor questions to Agent Assist Learning in Comm100?
output: In the Ticketing & Messaging conversation area of the Comm100 Agent Console, agents can add visitor questions to Agent Assist Learning. Agents with proper permissions can manage Agent Assist and utilize the questions to improve their sources by adding Learning Questions to Public Canned Messages, Knowledge Base Articles, and Chatbot Intents regardless of the channel the question comes from.

instruction: How can you install the Comm100 Live Chat Desktop App on Windows?
output: You can download the installation file of Comm100 Live Chat Desktop App for Windows from the provided link. The desktop app works on Windows 7 or later. Once installed, a Comm100 icon will appear on your desktop screen, which you can click to launch and log into the app.

instruction: How do you uninstall the Comm100 Live Chat App from an iPhone?
output: You can remove the Comm100 Live Chat App from an iPhone using two methods: 1) Uninstall from Home Screen: Navigate to the Home screen, press and hold the Comm100 Live Chat App icon, tap 'Remove App', and then tap 'Delete App' to confirm. 2) Uninstall from Settings: Tap 'Settings', go to 'General' > 'Storage & iCloud Usage' > 'Manage Storage', find and tap the Comm100 Live Chat app, and then tap 'Delete App'.

instruction: How do you create a new service in the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To create a new service, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Booking > Services, click New Service, input the service name, set the color, booking page, and duration for the service, and then click Save.

instruction: How can you customize email notifications for appointments in Comm100 Booking?
output: To customize email notifications, go to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Booking > Services > Notification, click the edit icon against the email notification you want to edit, modify the email subject or content as needed, and then click Save.

instruction: How can you use webhooks in Comm100 Voice Bot?
output: Comm100 Voice Bot allows you to send data to and receive data from an external server or third-party services using Webhook. By using the HTTP POST method, Voice Bot Webhook can perform RESTful operations as per your business needs. To use Webhooks in Voice Bot, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Voice Bot > Intents. 3. In the Answer area, expand the Actions menu, scroll down to the Advanced section, and drag the Trigger a webhook action to the area. 4. On the Trigger a webhook action card, click the edit icon. The Webhook drawer appears. 5. On the Webhook drawer, you can set the details for the following sections: URL, Webhook Headers, Additional Post Body, Save Response to Variable, Response Code to Action. 6. Click OK. After the Webhook is successfully configured, you can start using it in your voice bot.

instruction: What formats are supported by Task Bot Webhooks in Comm100?
output: Task Bot Webhooks do not accept XML format. Only the JSON format is supported.

instruction: What are the email sending limits for connected email accounts in Comm100?
output: Comm100 does not limit the number of emails that you can send every day, whether it be one-on-one ticket replies or bulk emails sent via Outreach Campaigns. However, each email provider has its own rate limits on the number of emails or recipients.

instruction: Why is it important to check the email sending limits imposed by your email provider before using Outreach Campaigns?
output: It is important to check the email sending limits imposed by your email provider because exceeding these limits can strongly impact your business. For example, Gmail will temporarily disable the email account when the limit is exceeded and re-enable it 24 hours later.

instruction: How can I check if my live chat settings are working properly in Comm100?
output: To check if your live chat settings are working properly in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 account, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Installation from the left navigation menu, click Live Preview, and then click on your chat button to perform testing and check how the settings are working.

instruction: How can I change my display name shown to my website visitors in Comm100?
output: To change your display name in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > People > Agents, click the Pencil icon to edit an agent's details, type the new display name in the Display Name field, and click Save.

instruction: What are some best practices for delivering a personalized live chat experience using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Some best practices for delivering a personalized live chat experience using Comm100 Live Chat include using a pre-chat survey, addressing customers by name, showing agent info to customers, leveraging navigation history, wrap-up notes, and chat transcripts, sending proactive chat invitations, using canned messages, and integrating Live Chat with your CRM.

instruction: How can Comm100 Live Chat be integrated with a CRM to enhance customer service?
output: Comm100 Live Chat can be integrated with a CRM to grant agents access to detailed customer information managed by the CRM, such as customer ID, purchase history, and prior complaints. This integration allows agents to provide tailored service for each customer. Comm100 supports integration with various CRMs such as Salesforce and Dynamics 365.

instruction: How can I cancel my Comm100 account?
output: To cancel your Comm100 account, you must contact your account manager. If you do not have the contact info of your account manager, you can chat with Comm100 support.

instruction: What should I consider before canceling my Comm100 account?
output: Before canceling your Comm100 account, ensure you remove the Comm100 code from all your pages, pay off any overdue invoices, export all important data, and be aware that canceled accounts may be deleted from the database six months after closure.

instruction: How does Visitor Single Sign-On (SSO) work in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Comm100 Live Chat Visitor SSO supports SAML (Security Assertion Mark-up Language) and JWT (JSON Web Token) for exchanging authentication and authorization data between your IdP (Identity Provider) and the Comm100 Live Chat server. When a customer clicks on the chat window's login option, the Comm100 Live Chat server asks your IDP server whether the customer has been authenticated. If the customer has already logged in SSO using the same browser, the IDP server returns the response to Comm100, and the customer is connected to live chat immediately. Otherwise, the login page shows up in the chat window, asking customers to log in. The credentials provided on the page are sent directly to your SSO server, not Comm100, which means this authenticating process is done solely on the SSO service side, preventing man-in-the-middle hacks and other possible password breaches. Once authenticated, customer account information is sent to Comm100 Live Chat.

instruction: What are the requirements for setting up SAML Visitor SSO in Comm100?
output: Before configuring SAML Visitor SSO, you need to download the service provider metadata from Comm100 and share the file with your identity provider first. Your IDP provides the required configuration details accordingly. The configurations include the following: The SSO Sign-In URL which can receive SAML Request, Artifact Resolution Service URL, Logout URL, and SAML Certificate. To ensure data security, Comm100 suggests adding a signature to the SAML Response returned from IdP to Comm100 SSO, which requires a certificate to verify signature validation.

instruction: How can agents ban visitors from initiating chat requests using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Agents can ban visitors from initiating chat requests using Comm100 Live Chat by banning them through Visitor ID or IP address. This can be done from both the Agent Console and the Control Panel. From the Agent Console, agents can ban a visitor in the visitor list or during a chat. From the Control Panel, agents can add visitor IDs or IPs to the banned list.

instruction: What are the steps to ban a visitor from the Control Panel in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To ban visitors from the Control Panel in Comm100 Live Chat, follow these steps: 1. Log in to Comm100 Control Panel. 2. In the left navigation bar, click 'Live Chat'. 3. In the 'Settings' drop-down menu, go to 'Ban List'. 4. On the 'Ban List' page, select to ban visitors by ID or IP. 5. Add the visitor IDs or IP addresses according to your needs. 6. Click 'Save'.

instruction: How can you send canned messages using shortcuts?
output: To send a canned message using shortcuts, type the pound key (#) followed by the shortcut in the typing area of your chats or tickets. A list of canned messages with their shortcuts will appear. Click on the canned message or press the Tab or Enter key to insert the message into your typing area. You can then modify the message or send it out directly.

instruction: How can you locate canned messages if you cannot recall the shortcuts?
output: If you cannot recall the shortcuts, you can locate canned messages by category or by searching keywords. Click the Help Content tab on the right side of the chat window, then either click on the category the message belongs to or input the keyword in the search box. Double-click on the message to send it out directly or click on the message to edit it before sending.

instruction: How can agents and customers use the Audio & Video Chat feature in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The Audio & Video Chat feature in Comm100 Live Chat allows agents and customers to talk over chat at any time, improving communication, speeding up resolution time, and enhancing customer experiences. To use this feature, agents need to log in to the Comm100 control panel, navigate to Live Chat > Settings > Audio & Video Chat, and turn on the Audio & Video Chat toggle key. Visitors can request audio/video chats from the Chat Window, and agents can accept or decline these requests from the Agent Console.

instruction: How can visitors request an audio or video chat in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Visitors can request an audio or video chat by starting a chat and clicking on the audio or video icon at the bottom of the Chat Window. If the icons are not available, visitors should check if they are using supported browsers and platforms. Once the request is made, the agent can accept or decline the chat, and the audio/video chat will be established if accepted.

instruction: How is bot action usage calculated?
output: Bot action usage is calculated based on the number of messages your bot sends to your visitors. These messages are triggered or sent to visitors during any chat. Bot action usage calculation consists of Intent Answers and Event Messages.

instruction: Can you provide an example of bot action usage calculation?
output: In Scenario 1, one visitor chatted with the bot, triggering a single intent and leaving the chat in action 'B'. The bot sent two messages, resulting in two actions (A+B). In Scenario 2, the first visitor triggered four actions (A+B+C1+D) and the second visitor triggered two actions (A+B), totaling six actions.

instruction: What are the initial steps to get started with Comm100 Live Chat and Ticketing & Messaging?
output: The initial steps include setting a go-live aim date, forming your live chat rollout team, and making global functionality decisions such as setting up users, assigning user roles and permissions, and setting up departments.

instruction: What are some key decisions to make regarding the functionality of the live chat system?
output: Key decisions include customizing the chat system's look and feel, deciding whether to collect customer information via a pre-chat form, configuring queue options, determining customer capabilities during chats, and setting up post-chat surveys.

instruction: How can you create a Comm100 Chatbot?
output: To create a Comm100 Chatbot, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Bot > Chatbot from the left navigation menu, click the drop-down list and go to the Manage Chatbots section, click Manage, then click the New Chatbot button. Type a name, select a language from the Language drop-down, and click Save.

instruction: How can you configure the settings of a newly created Comm100 Chatbot?
output: To configure the settings of a newly created Comm100 Chatbot, click the Pencil icon against the newly-created Chatbot in the Chatbots list area. The Edit Chatbot drawer appears, where you can update the Chatbot Name, upload a new avatar, adjust Chatbot Sensitivity, and click Save.

instruction: How can you integrate Deltapath with Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To integrate Deltapath with Comm100 Live Chat, a Comm100 administrator or agent with the correct permissions must have the Deltapath administrator Login ID and Password. They need to log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Apps & Integrations > Deltapath, and follow the steps to add a Deltapath account, provide server details, and save the settings.

instruction: What should you do if you encounter a Deltapath server connection error in Comm100?
output: If you encounter a Deltapath server connection error in Comm100, you will see an 'Error connecting to the Deltapath server' message. This happens when the connection is broken abruptly. To reconnect to the server, click 'Try Again'.

instruction: How can you create a new live chat department in Comm100?
output: To create a new live chat department in Comm100, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings in the left navigation bar, select Departments from the People drop-down menu, turn on the Departments Toggle key, and click the New Department button. Then, enter the Name and Description for the department, add agents, select the recipient of offline messages, and click Save.

instruction: What editions of Comm100 support the department feature?
output: The department feature is only available in Comm100 Live Chat Business and Enterprise Edition.

instruction: How can you configure and manage Comm100 Messenger in the Control Panel?
output: In the Control Panel, you can add a new Messenger, edit, install code, copy, rename, and delete any Messenger. You can also configure Routing Rules, Triggers, and SLAs, enable Credit Card Masking, and review Audit Logs and Reports.

instruction: What can agents do with Messenger on the Agent Console?
output: On the Agent Console, agents can create Views and answer Messenger tickets. They can manage Messenger channel tickets using various fields to add conditions and create Views.

instruction: Why is my chat button not working?
output: When you click on the chat button and nothing happens, it could be due to the following reasons: 1. You are using a custom chat button that is not properly configured. 2. The live chat code on your website is outdated, and cookies are disabled in your browser. To resolve this, ensure the URL linked to the chat button is correct, paste the live chat installation code on your website, use JavaScript methods to open the chat window when the custom button is clicked, and ask visitors to enable cookies in their browser. If these solutions do not work, chat with support for further assistance.

instruction: How can you customize the Secure Messenger window with CSS?
output: You can customize your Secure Messenger window by using your own CSS code to deliver a consistent and professional image that resonates with your branding and website. The steps include logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Secure Messaging, clicking the Secure Messenger link or Edit icon, expanding the Customize Style with Your Own CSS drop-down, and using the CSS editor to make customizations.

instruction: What are some examples of customizations you can make to the Secure Messenger window using CSS?
output: Examples of customizations include changing the text font-size, customizing the New Case button's width, height, text color, and background color, changing the background color of the message bubble for agent and visitor, and changing the text font to fit the font used on your website.

instruction: What are the main features of the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging product?
output: The Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging product allows you to manage conversations that need follow-up, track tickets from the first call to resolution, create custom views, use @mentions for collaboration, merge tickets, manage contacts, use ticket signatures, create internal tickets, and tag messages.

instruction: What types of reports are available in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging includes several types of reports: Real-Time Report, Volume Report, Channel Report, Efficiency Report, and SLA Policies Report. These reports provide insights into ticket handling status, support traffic, performance metrics, agent response times, and SLA compliance.

instruction: How can you change the text on chat buttons and visitor side windows to a different language in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To change the text on chat buttons and visitor side windows to a different language in Comm100 Live Chat, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, click the Live Chat tab from the left navigation menu, select the Campaign drop-down menu, click Language and select the desired language from the drop-down list, and then click Save. The changes will take effect immediately.

instruction: What should you do if your preferred language is not in the pre-defined language list in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: If your preferred language is not in the pre-defined language list, you can customize the display language of visitor-side windows by clicking Advanced and selecting the 'Customize the language on the visitor side windows' option to manually edit the text in the Current Text column.

instruction: What is Agent Assist and how does it help agents?
output: Agent Assist is a virtual assistant that operates side-by-side with agents. It helps the agents to resolve customer queries by presenting them with answer suggestions and generating summaries for chats and tickets. Agent Assist presents multiple suggestions for a question to agents, allowing them to select a relevant suggestion without having to search for the answer manually. It can also generate a quick summary based on the chat transcript or ticket communication history.

instruction: How can you enable and configure Agent Assist?
output: To enable and configure Agent Assist, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Agent Assist > General Settings. 3. On the General Settings page, turn on the Agent Assist toggle key. 4. Select the desired language for Agent Assist from the Language drop-down list. 5. In the Answer Sources section, select the types of content sources that you want Agent Assist to use for suggesting answers to agents. 6. (Optional) Define the minimum matching score for Agent Assist to provide suggestions and select the number of suggestions you want Agent Assist to display. 7. (Optional) Enable the option to enrich question variants of Agent Assist answer resources. 8. (Optional) Enable the option to automatically add unrecognized visitor questions to Agent Assist Learning section.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging Webhooks?
output: The Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging Webhooks support both HTTP and HTTPS URLs and provide a callback with specific properties when a ticket is updated.

instruction: What information is included in the JSON data for the 'When a Ticket is Updated' event?
output: The JSON data for the 'When a Ticket is Updated' event includes details such as SiteId, TriggerId, TriggerName, ChannelAccountId, ChannelId, TicketInfo, ContactInfo, and EventInfo.

instruction: How can you set up a chatbot for the Live Chat channel?
output: To set up a chatbot for the Live Chat channel, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select a campaign, turn on the Chatbot toggle key, select a bot from the Bot for Campaign drop-down list, define chat distribution to the bot, and click Save.

instruction: What are the benefits of using a chatbot in your business?
output: The benefits of using a chatbot in your business include faster response time, handling capacity/multitasking, and cost-effectiveness.

instruction: How can you set up a timer to automatically stop inactive chats in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up a timer to automatically stop inactive chats in Comm100 Live Chat, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window. If you are using multiple campaigns, choose the correct campaign from the drop-down list. 3. On the Chat Window page, expand the Advanced section. 4. Select the 'Automatically end chats if visitors don’t respond within' check box, and choose the time period from the drop-down list. 5. Click Save.

instruction: What are some important notes to consider when setting up the timer for inactive chats?
output: Some important notes to consider are: 1. The setting for ending inactive chats automatically does not work for chats with a Chatbot. When a Chatbot chats with a customer, the chat ends automatically if the customer does not send a response within 1 hour. 2.
