You can customize the reminder messages shown to visitors by going to Live Chat > Campaign > Language > Customization.

instruction: How do I add an NPS to my Live Chat Post Chat Survey?
output: To add an NPS to your Live Chat Post Chat Survey, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign, select your campaign, turn on the Post-Chat toggle key, click the Add a Field link, choose or add a new field, select NPS as the field type, edit the left and right text if needed, save the field, and make it visible and mandatory if desired. Finally, click OK to add the NPS field to the post-chat window.

instruction: How can I get my NPS report?
output: To get your NPS report, go to Reporting > Post-chat Survey and select the appropriate Campaign if you have Multiple Campaigns enabled.

instruction: How can you change the chat window type in Comm100?
output: To change the chat window type in Comm100, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign, choose your campaign from the Campaign drop-down list, click Chat Window, select either Embedded or Popup chat window in the Type section, and click Save. The new settings take effect automatically and immediately.

instruction: What are the two types of chat windows available in Comm100?
output: The two types of chat windows available in Comm100 are Embedded Chat Window, where visitors can chat directly on web pages, and Popup Chat Window, where visitors need to click on the chat button to open a new popup window to chat with agents.

instruction: What are some best practices for managing customer service in a multi-brand scenario using Comm100?
output: Some best practices include using Campaigns to create customized chat experiences for each brand, setting up Departments to manage different business units, assigning Roles to grant permissions efficiently, using Canned Messages to improve response efficiency, scheduling Shifts to maintain agent availability, applying Routing Rules to direct customers to the appropriate department or agent, and measuring performance through robust reports to identify areas for improvement.

instruction: How can Comm100 help in customizing the live chat experience for different brands?
output: Comm100 allows customization through Campaigns, where you can adjust settings such as the chat button appearance, chat window design, pre-chat and post-chat features, offline messages, proactive chat invitations, language options, routing rules, chatbot integration, knowledge base access, and canned messages. This ensures that each brand can have a unique and tailored live chat experience that aligns with its specific needs and branding.

instruction: What is Comm100's Live Chat Report API?
output: Comm100's Live Chat Report API allows you to pull raw report data from Comm100 Live Chat into your own systems, so you can create custom and on-demand reports in Excel or your business intelligence platform. It can be used to create custom reports, store report data offline, and integrate into other third-party systems for data insights.

instruction: How can I access the Comm100 Live Chat Report API?
output: The Report API is part of Comm100's RESTful API and is available at no extra cost, but you need to be using the Ultra edition of Comm100. Access to reporting data is limited to the edition you are using, and some technical knowledge is required to implement the APIs. API usage limits are 300 API calls every 5 minutes per IP address.

instruction: What are some of the best practices recommended by Comm100 to ensure the security of your account?
output: Comm100 recommends several best practices to ensure the security of your account, including not sharing email addresses or passwords, restricting the number of agents with administrator privileges, auditing your account regularly, monitoring audit logs, authenticating visitors and agents with single sign-on, banning visitors from initiating chat requests, requesting sensitive data using Secure Forms, blocking unsolicited messages, managing restricted words, masking credit card numbers, setting a password policy, using IP allowlists for agents, using OAuth client authentication, and enabling two-factor authentication.

instruction: How can you enhance the security of your Comm100 account using two-factor authentication?
output: Two-factor authentication (2FA) adds a second layer of security to your Comm100 account by requiring a second form of verification in addition to your password. To set up 2FA, you need to install an authenticator app on a mobile device and use it to scan a QR code during the setup process. This helps protect your account from unauthorized access and enhances the overall security of your customer's valuable data.

instruction: How can you add an Office 365 or Microsoft Exchange Online account to Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To add an Office 365 or Exchange Online account, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Email, click 'Add Email Account' and choose 'Office 365' from the drop-down list. Enter your Microsoft account and password, and grant permissions to Comm100.

instruction: What is the Custom Ticket Identity rule in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: The Custom Ticket Identity rule allows agents to track status update notifications for a particular transaction as a single ticket. This rule can be set across all email channel types and involves defining a regular expression or string pattern to group related emails into one ticket.

instruction: How can I clear my unpaid bills for Comm100 services?
output: To clear your unpaid bills, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > Billing > Billing Profile, check your payment information, make necessary changes, and click 'Pay Now' on the right of the amount due. You can have up to three attempts per day to clear the bills. If you need further assistance after three failed attempts, you can chat with Comm100 support.

instruction: What happens if my automatic payment fails for Comm100 services?
output: If the automatic payment fails, you need to pay your bills manually to renew your subscription. Comm100 will keep providing services for nine days after the due billing date. If the bills are cleared during this period, your services won't be interrupted. Otherwise, Comm100 services will stop.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks for the 'Agent Status Changed' event?
output: The purpose of the Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks for the 'Agent Status Changed' event is to provide callbacks with specific properties in JSON format when an agent's status changes, such as going online, going away, logging into the Agent Console, or logging out of the Agent Console.

instruction: What are the different agent status changes covered by the 'Agent Status Changed' event in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks?
output: The different agent status changes covered by the 'Agent Status Changed' event in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks include: Agent changes status to Online, Agent changes status to Away, Agent logs into Agent Console, and Agent logs out of Agent Console.

instruction: What are the default categories provided by Comm100 for organizing chatbot intents?
output: Comm100 provides the default categories System and Smalltalk in the root folder.

instruction: How can you create a new category for chatbot intents in Comm100?
output: You can create a new category in two ways: on the Intents page or while creating an intent.

instruction: Why does the chat button on my website appear offline even though my agents are logged in?
output: The chat button may appear offline because the routing rules are trying to route chats to an agent who is currently offline, or chats are being routed to a department and the online agents are not members of that department.

instruction: How can I ensure the chat button appears online when my agents are logged in?
output: To ensure the chat button appears online, verify which agent or department the chat is being routed to. If routed to an agent, make sure they are online or change the chat assignee. If routed to a department, ensure the online agents are members of that department by checking under Global Settings > People > Departments.

instruction: How should you configure your Comm100 account for HIPAA compliance?
output: To configure your Comm100 account for HIPAA compliance, you need to follow these steps: 1. Set a strong password policy, 2. Enable IP Allowlist, 3. Set up auto logout for inactive agents, 4. Switch off send transcript access to visitors, 5. Disable automatic email chat transcripts, 6. Disable permission for non-admins to send chat transcripts, and 7. Ensure all webhook target URLs start with HTTPS.

instruction: What features in Comm100 may not be HIPAA compliant?
output: The features in Comm100 that may not be HIPAA compliant include Agent Chat, Social and SMS, Co-browsing, Ticket system, Audio & Video Chat, and Voice Bot. These features may involve sharing or transmitting PHI in ways that are not secure or compliant with HIPAA standards.

instruction: How can I find my Site ID in Comm100?
output: To find your Site ID, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > Site Profile. Your site ID appears on this page. You can also find the site ID in the URL after login.

instruction: How can I find my Campaign ID in Comm100?
output: To find your Campaign ID, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign. Expand the campaign dropdown list and open the Manage Campaigns drawer. Locate your campaign on the list and obtain the corresponding ID. You can input keywords to search for your target campaign.

instruction: What should I do if I receive an 'Email or password is incorrect' error message while trying to log in to my Comm100 account?
output: The possible causes could be that the email or password entered does not match the account details, or you are using the wrong login URL. Solutions include checking the email address associated with your account, resetting your password using the 'Forgot your password?' link, asking your Comm100 account Administrator to reset the password, and ensuring you have the correct login URL.

instruction: What are the initial steps to get started with Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Getting started with Live Chat involves creating your team, configuring the features you want to use, customizing the look and feel of the Live Chat window, and then adding the Live Chat widget to your website.

instruction: What features can be customized in the Comm100 Live Chat Campaign menu?
output: In the Campaign menu, you can customize the Chat Button, Chat Window, Pre-chat and Post-chat surveys, Offline Message, Invitation, Agent Wrap-up, Language, Routing Rules, Chatbot, KB Integration, and Canned Messages.

instruction: How can I create filters or views to display specific tickets in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: With Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, you can create multiple filters/views to quickly locate certain tickets based on predefined conditions. This helps narrow down the tickets in your system and only display those requiring your attention.

instruction: What are the steps to create a new view in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To create a new view: 1. Log in to your Agent Console. 2. Go to the Ticketing & Messaging module. 3. Click the Manage View icon in the Filter section. 4. Click the New View button. 5. Define a Name and set up Conditions for the View. 6. Save your settings. 7. Use the Move Down or Move Up icons to reorder the Views. You can also remove or edit existing views as needed.

instruction: What accessibility features does Comm100 Live Chat provide?
output: Comm100 Live Chat provides accessibility features such as video and audio chat, auto-translation, CSS customization, text-to-speech compatibility, text resizing, keyboard accessibility, multiple language support, co-browsing, push page, agent wrap-up, and chat transcripts.

instruction: How does Comm100 Live Chat support users with visual impairments?
output: Comm100 Live Chat supports users with visual impairments through features like text-to-speech compatibility, text resizing up to 200%, and customizable color contrast for the chat button and window.

instruction: How can you update the Comm100 Agent Console on different platforms?
output: For the Web App, updates are automatic. For the Desktop App, a message box will prompt you to download the update. For the Mobile App, a message box will remind you to get the latest version when you log in.

instruction: What is a Task Bot and how can it benefit businesses?
output: A Task Bot is a bot that automates rule-based and repetitive actions to help improve your team's productivity and efficiency. It allows businesses to increase customer engagement on their website and provide their customers with an 'always-on' self-service option. Businesses can collect leads, book meetings, route chats, reduce wait times, and automate basic customer service workflows.

instruction: What are the steps to create a Task Bot in Comm100?
output: To create a Task Bot, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Task Bot > Task Bots. 3. On the Task Bots page, click New Task Bot. 4. Select a template or build from scratch. 5. Drag and connect Task Bot actions in the Bot Builder area. 6. Provide a name and click Save. 7. Click the Preview Bot button to test your Task Bot. 8. Manage the Task Bot from the Task Bots page.

instruction: What is the purpose of the webhook event 'When the Status of a Ticket has Changed'?
output: The webhook event 'When the Status of a Ticket has Changed' notifies you with specific properties in JSON format when the status of a ticket changes.

instruction: What information is included in the JSON data for the 'When the Status of a Ticket has Changed' event?
output: The JSON data for the 'When the Status of a Ticket has Changed' event includes details such as SiteId, TriggerId, TriggerName, ChannelAccountId, ChannelId, TicketInfo, ContactInfo, and EventInfo.

instruction: How can you install Comm100 Live Chat on Blogger/Blogspot?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on Blogger/Blogspot, log into your Blogger/Blogspot account, click the Layout tab, add a new HTML/JavaScript gadget, paste the live chat code from your Comm100 account into the gadget, and save it. The live chat should now be visible in your blog's layout.

instruction: What is the purpose of adding a title to the HTML/JavaScript gadget when installing Comm100 Live Chat on Blogger?
output: A good title will alert your readers that this is the online chat support on your site.

instruction: What is the purpose of the webhook event described in the document?
output: The webhook event is triggered when a ticket is created, and it supports both HTTP and HTTPS URLs.

instruction: What format is the data in when the 'When a Ticket is Created' event occurs?
output: The data is in JSON format.

instruction: What is the purpose of the 'When an Agent Replied' webhook event in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: The 'When an Agent Replied' webhook event in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging notifies when an agent replies to a ticket, providing detailed information about the event in JSON format.

instruction: What information is included in the JSON data for the 'When an Agent Replied' event?
output: The JSON data for the 'When an Agent Replied' event includes details such as SiteId, TriggerId, TriggerName, ChannelAccountId, ChannelId, TicketInfo, ContactInfo, and EventInfo, which provide comprehensive information about the ticket, the contact, and the event itself.

instruction: How can an organization enable content review and approval via webhook on the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To enable content review and approval via webhook on the Comm100 Control Panel, log in to the Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Content Review and Approval, turn on the toggle key, select the channel accounts for content review, provide the webhook URL, configure webhook headers, enter additional webhook body JSON if needed, and click Save.

instruction: What happens on the Comm100 Agent Console when an agent sends a message that requires approval?
output: On the Comm100 Agent Console, when an agent sends a message that requires approval, the message is not sent out until the webhook response approves or rejects it. The agent sees a waiting indicator during this time. If the message is approved, it is sent immediately. If rejected, the agent receives a notification and can modify the message content and try sending it again.

instruction: How can you configure JWT validation using a Public Key for Secure Messenger?
output: To configure JWT validation using a Public Key, follow these steps: 1. Use the RS256 algorithm for signing the Private Key to generate JWT. 2. Provide the corresponding Public Key in the Comm100 control panel to validate the JWT. 3. Include the Contact Identity Key name and value in the payload.

instruction: What are the methods offered by Secure Messenger to sign the customer token?
output: Secure Messenger offers two methods to sign the customer token: 1. Public Key: This method provides the highest level of security by using a Public key for validation while JWT is signed with a Private Key. 2. Shared Token: This token is generated by Secure Messenger for each instance and securely stored. It must be copied and used in your application, ensuring the clipboard is cleaned after the copy-paste operation.

instruction: Can I customize the order of the columns in Agent Console?
output: Yes, you can customize the order of the columns in Agent Console, where you do real-time monitoring and chatting.

instruction: How do you enable custom app development in your Shopify store?
output: To enable custom app development in your Shopify store, log in as the store owner, go to the Apps section from the left sidebar, click on Apps and sales channels settings, then click on Develop apps for your store. Allow custom app development by reading the information provided and clicking Allow custom app development. Finally, create an app by providing the app name and email, and configure the necessary permissions.

instruction: How do you generate an API access token in Shopify?
output: To generate an API access token in Shopify, navigate to the API Credentials tab, click on Install app within the Access tokens section, and confirm the installation. The Admin API Access Token will be generated. Click Reveal token once to view the token, then copy and paste it on the Shopify Integration page on the Comm100 Control Panel.

instruction: How can you add a new field in the Pre-Chat window of the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To add a new field in the Pre-Chat window of the Comm100 Control Panel, log in to the Control Panel, click the Live Chat tab, select the appropriate campaign from the Campaign drop-down menu, turn on the Pre-chat toggle key, scroll down to the Fields section, click the Add a Field link, create the field and set its properties, and then click Save. The new field will appear in the Pre-Chat window and must be filled in by visitors before starting a chat.

instruction: How can I install Comm100 Live Chat on 3dcart?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on 3dcart, follow these steps: 1. Click the Content menu on the left of your 3dcart control panel, then choose Header & Footer. 2. Choose one position from Global Header, Global Footer, Global Left Banner, and Global Right Banner. 3. Enable it using the toggle switch, and then paste the live chat code into the section. 4. Click Save. The Live Chat button will then be on your website, allowing customers to click on it to chat with you.

instruction: What is Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) and why is it important for Comm100 accounts?
output: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) is a security process in which two different authentication factors must be provided to verify your identity. It helps protect your Comm100 account from unauthorized access by adding a second-level security layer to your primary-level authentication.

instruction: How can you set up Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) for a Comm100 account?
output: To set up 2FA for a Comm100 account, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to your avatar > profile name, select the Security Settings tab, and click Set up. Then, install a third-party 2FA authenticator app on a mobile device, scan the QR code provided, and enter the six-digit numeric code generated by the app to complete the setup.

instruction: What is Comm100 Queue Management?
output: Comm100 Queue Management is a digital solution designed for businesses to handle the queue of customers. It allows customers to enter a queue through a webpage instead of waiting in a physical line, thus saving time and increasing agent productivity.

instruction: How can administrators set up a queue in Comm100 Queue Management?
output: Administrators can set up a queue in Comm100 Queue Management by first setting up a location, then creating a queue, and finally setting up the queue with necessary settings such as the join queue page, agent assignment, working hours, language, and notifications.

instruction: How can I view my balance history?
output: To view your balance history, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > Billing > Billing History, and adjust the time range to view your balance history for the given period.

instruction: How do you install the Comm100 Live Chat Desktop App on macOS?
output: To install the Comm100 Live Chat Desktop App on macOS, follow these steps: 1. Go to the Comm100 Agent Apps webpage and click the macOS icon under Desktop App to download the installation file. 2. After the download completes, double-click the installation file, and a dialog box appears. 3. Drag the Comm100 Live Chat app into the Applications folder. 4. Click the Live Chat app in the Applications folder. A warning dialog box appears when you open the app for the first time. Click OK to proceed. 5. Click the apple icon in the top left corner on your desktop, choose System Settings > Privacy & Security. 6. Scroll down until you find the Security settings, for Allow applications downloaded from setting, choose the App Store and identified developers option, then click Open Anyway. 7. A pop-up appears requiring you to provide a password to make the changes. Enter your password and click Modify Settings. 8. A dialog box appears again. Click Open to open the Comm100 Live Chat app, then you can log in and use Comm100 Live Chat normally.

instruction: How do you uninstall the Comm100 Live Chat Desktop App on macOS?
output: To uninstall the Comm100 Live Chat Desktop App on macOS, follow these steps: 1. Open Applications, locate the Comm100 Live Chat app, right-click the app and choose Move to Trash. The Comm100 Live Chat app is removed from your macOS. Proceed to remove the software remnants. 2. Click the search icon on the top right corner on your desktop, input ~/library and press Enter. 3. Open the Library folder and then open the Application Support folder in it. 4. Locate the Comm100 Live Chat folder, right-click and choose Move to Trash. The remnants of Comm100 Live Chat are removed. You can reinstall the app afterwards.

instruction: Does Comm100 Live Chat support multi-agents?
output: Yes, Comm100 supports multi-agents. Comm100 Live Chat allows you to collaborate with other agents during a chat session. You can add unlimited agents into an account and have multiple support representatives to take care of the live chat service.

instruction: What is the purpose of the webhook event discussed in the HTML content?
output: The webhook event is triggered when the assignee of a ticket has changed.

instruction: What format is the data in when the 'Assignee of a Ticket has Changed' event occurs?
output: The data is in JSON format.

instruction: What is the purpose of the webhook event 'When a Ticket Reply is Received'?
output: The webhook event 'When a Ticket Reply is Received' notifies you with specific properties in JSON format when a reply to a ticket is received.

instruction: What information is included in the JSON data for the 'When a Ticket Reply is Received' event?
output: The JSON data for the 'When a Ticket Reply is Received' event includes details such as SiteId, TriggerId, TriggerName, ChannelAccountId, ChannelId, TicketInfo, ContactInfo, and EventInfo.

instruction: How can you forward email messages in Comm100 Agent Console?
output: To forward email messages in Comm100 Agent Console, log in to your Comm100 Agent Console, navigate to the Ticketing & Messaging tab, select the email ticket you want to forward, hover over the message bubble to reveal the Forward message icon, click the icon, provide the receiver's email address in the To: and CC: fields, add any necessary attachments, edit the email body if needed, and click Send.

instruction: What are some key notes to remember when forwarding email messages in Comm100?
output: When forwarding email messages in Comm100, the original email's body and header are included as a quote in the new forward email message bubble, retaining the HTML format, links, and inline images. Replies to forwarded emails are saved as new tickets. Forwarded email messages are not counted in reports, do not affect SLA results, and do not trigger any events. If forwarded to multiple addresses, all recipients can see each other in the To: and CC: fields.

instruction: What is Visitor Segmentation?
output: Visitor Segmentation enables you to divide your visitors into different segments based on pre-defined rules and keep operators informed of the visitors' segments in real-time.

instruction: How can you set up Visitor Segmentation?
output: To set up Visitor Segmentation, you need to enable the feature in your Comm100 account settings, create new visitor segments, define conditions for each segment, set up notifications, and prioritize multiple segments based on your business needs.

instruction: How can agent wrap-up information be automatically included in chat transcript emails?
output: Comm100 Live Chat offers the ability for chat transcripts to be emailed automatically with Agent Wrap-Up comments attached. The email transcript will be sent at different times depending on whether the wrap-up form contains Visible or Required fields.

instruction: How can agent wrap-up information be manually included in chat transcript emails?
output: After each chat ends, you can manually email the chat transcript by clicking the Email icon in the Agent Console. Agent Wrap-Up information can be added to the email content.

instruction: What is the purpose of creating a department in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: A department represents a business unit in your organization with specific responsibilities. Departments help you assign incoming visitors to the most suitable agents. You can create multiple departments to group your agents according to their responsibilities.

instruction: How do you create a department in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To create a department in Comm100 Live Chat, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 control panel. 2. Go to Global Settings > People > Departments from the left menu. 3. Turn on the Departments Toggle key and click New Department. 4. On the New Department page, enter the department name and add agents to the department. You can add descriptions to help you identify the department. 5. (Optional) Define whether the department can be used in Live Chat and Ticketing & Messaging. 6. Click Save. Now you have successfully created a department.

instruction: Why aren't my automatic chat invitations showing up when I want them to?
output: The possible causes could be that the invitation is not set up for the right campaign or invitations are set to show only once per visit. To resolve this, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select the correct campaign, go to Invitation > Auto Invitations tab, click the Pencil icon against the desired invitation, turn off the 'Only pop-up once per site visit' toggle key, and click Save.

instruction: What is Comm100 Agent Assist?
output: Comm100 Agent Assist is a virtual assistant and a cognitive natural language question-answering system designed to help support staff resolve visitor queries faster by providing relevant information whenever needed.

instruction: Why should you consider using Comm100 Agent Assist?
output: You should consider using Comm100 Agent Assist because it identifies customer intent, supports call resolution, automates processes, provides contextual support, and integrates with existing customer service systems without requiring additional training.

instruction: What is the purpose of the SLA feature in Comm100?
output: A service-level agreement (SLA) is a commitment between a service provider and a client. It lays out the expectations by which that service is measured. In Comm100, you can configure SLAs for Time to First Response, Time to Next Response, or Time to Resolution for Tickets within the Ticketing & Messaging solution.

instruction: How do you configure an SLA policy in Comm100?
output: To configure an SLA policy in Comm100: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. In the left navigation bar, go to Ticketing & Messaging. 3. In the Settings drop-down menu, go to SLA Policies, and click New SLA Policy. 4. Give the policy a name and turn on the Enable toggle key. 5. In the Target section, enter the response and resolution times that match your business SLA targets. 6. Set Conditions for when the Service Level Target applies. 7. Click Save to create the SLA policy.

instruction: How can agents tell if a visitor has read their message in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Agents can see message read status on the Agent Console. When an agent sends a message, a blue dot icon shows next to the message. Once the message has been read by visitors, the blue dot disappears.

instruction: How can visitors tell if their messages have been read by agents in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To allow visitors to tell if their messages have been read by your agents, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window, select a campaign, and go to Chat Window. Under the Options for Visitors drop-down menu, select the Display dot icon for unread messages check box, and click Save. On the visitor side, a blue dot appears next to an unread message and disappears as soon as the agent reads the message.

instruction: How can you configure voice bot conditions in Comm100?
output: In Comm100, you can configure voice bot conditions by logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to Bot > Voice Bot > Intents, choosing or creating an intent, expanding the Actions pane, selecting the Conditions operation, and setting up conditions based on your needs. You can add multiple condition branches and connect them with other action cards in the chatbot workflow.

instruction: What are the key components of a Conditions card in Comm100?
output: A Conditions card in Comm100 contains multiple branches, multiple conditions within a branch, and a default branch labeled 'Any other condition'. The branches are checked in sequential order, and there is no upper limit for the branches. Conditions can be combined using 'And', 'Or', or 'Logical Expression'.

instruction: How can I integrate my WhatsApp account with Comm100 using WhatsApp Cloud?
output: To integrate a WhatsApp account using WhatsApp Cloud, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > WhatsApp. 3. Click Add WhatsApp Account and select WhatsApp Cloud. 4. On the Add WhatsApp Account page, enter the WhatsApp account name, turn on the Enable toggle key, add Phone ID and Token from the WhatsApp Business Platform, copy Callback URL and Verify token information to WhatsApp Business Platform to set up Webhook, and click Save. Once the account is added, you can test the connection by clicking the Save & Test button.

instruction: How can I integrate my WhatsApp account with Comm100 using Twilio WhatsApp?
output: To integrate a WhatsApp account using Twilio, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > WhatsApp. 3. Click Add WhatsApp Account and select Twilio WhatsApp. 4. On the WhatsApp page, provide the WhatsApp account name, turn on the Enable toggle key, and connect Twilio using either Phone Number SID or Phone Number along with a Twilio Account SID and Auth Token. 5. Click Save. 6. Log in to your Twilio account and navigate to Develop > Messaging > Senders > WhatsApp senders. 7. Update the Webhook URL for incoming messages. The integration is now complete, and your agents can respond to incoming WhatsApp messages from the Ticketing & Messaging tab of the Agent Console App.

instruction: What are Intent Answers in Comm100 Chatbot?
output: Intent Answers are pre-set responses that the Chatbot sends for a visitor's specific questions. Comm100 Chatbot allows sending a variety of answers over different channels, like Live Chat, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, WhatsApp, LINE, WeChat, and so forth.

instruction: How can you create an answer flow in Comm100 Chatbot?
output: To create an answer flow in Intent-Answers, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot and select the Chatbot from the drop-down menu. 3. Go to Intents and click New Intent. 4. Fill in the Name, select Category, and add Questions. 5. Scroll down the page to the Answers section. 6. Click the Add First Action tab to start building your answer flow. 7. Click the Arrow symbol to expand the Action menu. 8. Drag an action card that you wish to add to the Answers flow. 9. Click and drag the connector to connect between the action cards and build a flow. 10. Click Save.

instruction: What types of chat buttons does Comm100 support for mobile-optimized websites?
output: Comm100 supports three types of chat buttons for mobile-optimized websites: Adaptive Chat Button, Image Chat Button, and Text Link Chat Button.

instruction: How can you customize the chat button for a mobile-optimized website using Comm100?
output: To customize the chat button for a mobile-optimized website using Comm100, log in to your Comm100 account, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Button, choose the Image type, and configure the settings for both Desktop View and Mobile View. You can also set advanced options to hide the chat button when your team is offline or display it on specified domains or URLs only.

instruction: What is Chatbot Sensitivity?
output: Chatbot sensitivity refers to the Chatbot’s capacity to provide matching answers to the visitor questions during the live chat. The Chatbot’s sensitivity is determined and set using a score range of 0 to 100 where 100 represents an absolute match, and 0 represents no match. The score range is manually set or adjusted to represent the level of matching answers provided by the chatbot to the visitor questions.

instruction: How does Chatbot Sensitivity work?
output: Chatbot sensitivity works by detecting the visitor’s question from the live chat and discovering its matching intent in the intent base. When a visitor enters a message to the bot, the Natural Language Processing engine scans all of the question variants for all the intents in the bot, assigning a confidence score to each. The response for the intent containing the question variant with the highest score will be displayed to the visitor if the score is higher than the High Confidence Answer Score threshold.

instruction: Can I view the visit counts and chat counts on my website?
output: Yes, you can view the visit counts and chat counts on your website. Visits and Chats Metrics provides the visit and chat counts on your website. You can locate it under the Chat Volume report.

instruction: How can I access the visit and chat counts on my website?
output: Log in to the Comm100 control panel. Navigate to Reporting > Chat Volume. A detailed report on Chats and Visits, as well as some other related metrics, appears. Set the Time range to bring out the results during a specific period of time.

instruction: What is Comm100 Booking?
output: Comm100 Booking is an online solution designed for businesses to manage the process of appointment scheduling with their customers. It allows customers to book a meeting by choosing from available time slots, eliminating the need for back-and-forth emails on availability. The streamlined scheduling process increases team efficiency and productivity, and brings a better user experience.

instruction: How can you create a booking page in Comm100?
output: To create a booking page in Comm100, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Booking > Booking Pages. 3. On the Booking Pages page, click New Booking Page. 4. Give the booking page a name. 5. Complete the settings for the booking page to keep consistent branding by uploading a logo, choosing the theme color, and inputting the greeting message. 6. Click Save. The booking page is created successfully.

instruction: How can you customize Secure Messaging's security in the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To customize Secure Messaging's security, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Secure Messaging, click the Secure Messenger link or the Edit icon, go to the Security tab, choose JWT validation methods, share the key for Contact Identity in JWT Payload, select the Display Secure Messenger on specified URLs only check box, provide the URL, and click Save.

instruction: What options are available in the Security tab for Secure Messaging?
output: In the Security tab for Secure Messaging, you can choose from available JSON Web Token (JWT) validation methods, share the key for Contact Identity in JWT Payload, select the Display Secure Messenger on specified URLs only check box, and provide the URL where the Secure Messenger should be displayed.

instruction: Where can I see a report of visitors' average waiting time in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: You can view visitors' average waiting time by logging into your Comm100 account, navigating to Reporting > Live Chat > Wait Time, and adjusting the Time Range filter to view the report by Time or by Department.

instruction: How can you use Contact Management Triggers in Comm100?
output: Contact Management Triggers allow you to apply webhooks to contact-related events, sending contact data to your own system in real time whenever a contact is created, deleted, and so on.

instruction: What are the steps to apply a webhook to Contact Management in Comm100?
output: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, click Contact Management > Triggers. 3. On the Triggers page, click New Trigger. 4. Choose the event type and the webhook from the drop-down lists. 5. Turn on the Enable toggle to bring the webhook into action. 6. Click Save.

instruction: Can I get all my website visitors' contact history?
output: Yes. All visitors' contact histories are available for you. Contact History includes the record of navigation, offline message, and chat history of a certain visitor. The contact history is recorded and stored on the Comm100 server and can be viewed during or after the chat.

instruction: What information is included in the visitors' contact history?
output: The contact history includes general information such as the latest name, email, IP, GEO information, referrer, landing page, search engine, and search keywords used, operating system, browser, and flash version. It also includes transcripts of chats, offline messages, navigation history, and the title & URL of pages visited during a session.

instruction: How can you customize the Offline Message window in Comm100?
output: To customize the Offline Message window in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat, select a campaign, go to Offline Message, choose to use the default offline message window or redirect visitors to a custom page, set the Title and Greeting Message, add new fields, set visible and required fields, define email addresses for receiving offline messages, and save the changes.

instruction: What should you consider when setting up email addresses for receiving offline messages in Comm100?
output: When setting up email addresses for receiving offline messages in Comm100, if you are using the Enterprise Edition and Routing Rules are enabled, you need to set up the email address under Settings > Departments. Edit each Department to define the email address to receive Offline Messages for that department. If using custom Routing Rules, set up the email address to receive the Offline Message when visitors fail to be routed based on any custom rules.

instruction: How can you integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Zendesk?
output: To integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Zendesk, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Integrations & API from the left navigation menu, click Settings under the Zendesk app, turn on the Enable Account toggle key, fill in your Zendesk site name, user name, and password, and then click Save.

instruction: What are the benefits of integrating Comm100 Live Chat with Zendesk?
output: After integrating Comm100 Live Chat with Zendesk, chat transcripts, offline messages, and client contact information can be sent to your Zendesk account automatically. You can view ticket details such as chat history and files sent during the chat in your Zendesk account. If the visitor's email address exists in your Zendesk contact list, a Zendesk icon will appear on your Agent Console during the chat, allowing you to view all cases under this contact.

instruction: What is the 'Chat Requested' event in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks?
output: The 'Chat Requested' event in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks occurs when a visitor requests a chat. The event data is provided in JSON format and includes various properties such as the visitor's browser, chat ID, city, country, email, first visit time, IP address, language, name, operating system, and more.

instruction: What are some of the key properties of a visitor in the 'Chat Requested' event data?
output: Some of the key properties of a visitor in the 'Chat Requested' event data include the visitor's ID, name, email, status, phone, company, first visit time, visit time, city, state, country, IP address, language, screen resolution, time zone, flash version, operating system, browser, custom fields, product/service, department, skill, custom variables, current browsing page, total visits, total chats, referrer URL, search engine, keywords, landing page, and total page views.

instruction: How can you integrate Zendesk Chat with Comm100 Chatbot?
output: To integrate Zendesk Chat with Comm100 Chatbot, you need to generate a Client ID from your Zendesk account and then integrate the Zendesk account with the Chatbot from the Comm100 Control Panel. The detailed steps include logging into your Zendesk account, creating an API client to generate a Client ID, and then using this Client ID to authorize the integration in the Comm100 Control Panel.

instruction: What are the steps to generate a Client ID from your Zendesk account?
output: To generate a Client ID from your Zendesk account, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Zendesk account. 2. Go to the Zendesk Products icon and select Chat. 3. Enable Chat from Settings > Channels > Web Widget. 4. Go to Settings > Account > API. 5. Click the Add API client button and add the necessary details. 6. Copy the generated Client ID and save it for future references.

instruction: What are Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks?
output: Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks are HTTP(S) callbacks that occur when a certain live chat event takes place, enabling you to extend the capabilities of Comm100 Live Chat.

instruction: How can you add webhooks to your Comm100 Live Chat account?
output: To add webhooks to your Comm100 Live Chat account, log in to the Comm100 Live Chat Control Panel, click 'Apps & Integrations' from the left navigation menu, go to the 'Webhooks' card and click 'Settings', then click 'New Webhook', choose the event type, provide the target URL, and click 'Save.'

instruction: What is a custom variable in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Comm100 Live Chat Custom Variable uses HTML Document Object Model (DOM) or JavaScript variables to read your website's information. Custom Variable can also retrieve QueryString from URL which is not JavaScript based.

instruction: How can you set up a custom variable in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: You can set up a custom variable in Comm100 Live Chat by using DOM elements, JavaScript variables, retrieving QueryString from URL, or via API. Each method involves specifying the relevant expressions or making API requests to capture and pass the information to the chat console.

instruction: What are Chat Group Tags in Comm100?
output: Chat Group Tags are a useful feature for clients with differently branded websites. Adding Chat Group Tags to your live chat code means that if a visitor chats on one of your websites and later initiates another chat on a different website, Comm100 will record those chats under separate visitor records, even if that visitor uses the same IP address and browser for both visits.

instruction: How do you set up Chat Group Tags in Comm100 Live Chat Code?
output: To set up Chat Group Tags in Comm100 Live Chat Code, you need to define the Chat Group Tags as follows: Comm100API.chatGroup = group_number; You can replace the 'group_number' with any natural number. Simply locate Comm100 Live Chat JavaScript Code on your website and add the tag. For example: Comm100API.chatGroup = 1; If you are using the old version of Live Chat Code, you can add the code to the specified area. This will ensure that chats initiated by the same visitor on different websites will appear under separate visitor records.

instruction: What are some best practices for keeping your live chat on-brand with Comm100?
output: Comm100 allows you to customize the style of the chat button, chat invitation popup, pre-chat window, chat window, offline message window, post-chat survey, and interface language to keep live chat in the same tone as your branding presence.

instruction: How can Comm100 help in delivering proactive customer service?
output: Comm100 allows you to implement proactive customer service by inviting visitors to chat automatically based on pre-defined rules or manually by monitoring visitors and sending personalized messages.

instruction: What features does Comm100 provide to reduce response time in live chat?
output: Comm100 provides features such as using pre-chat forms to collect information, routing customers to the right person, accepting chat requests automatically, creating canned messages, deploying a Chatbot, and allowing customers to leave offline messages.

instruction: How can Comm100 Live Chat leverage troubleshooting resources?
output: Comm100 Live Chat can leverage troubleshooting resources by integrating with a Knowledge Base, using audio and video chat, and employing co-browsing to guide customers through complex technical scenarios.

instruction: How does Comm100 help in collecting and utilizing customer feedback?
output: Comm100 helps in collecting customer feedback through post-chat surveys and allows agents to attach wrap-up comments to categorize chats and keep a record of customers' unique needs.

instruction: What options does Comm100 provide for tracking live chat performance?
output: Comm100 provides options to review chat transcripts and track metrics via reports, which help in optimizing customer service performance and improving customer satisfaction.

instruction: What security features does Comm100 offer for live chat?
output: Comm100 offers security features such as password policy, two-factor authentication, IP allowlist, and single sign-on to protect data security and ensure secure communication.

instruction: How can you integrate a Signal account with Comm100?
output: You can integrate a Signal account with Comm100 by registering Comm100 as a primary device or linking it as a secondary device. This allows your business to receive messages from Signal directly on the Comm100 platform, streamlining customer service operations and providing an additional layer of security for sensitive conversations.

instruction: What functionalities are available for Signal in the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: In the Comm100 Agent Console, you can read and send text messages, images, audio, or video messages through Signal. You can also create separate Views to manage Signal channel tickets, use Auto Translation and Agent Assist features, and block unsolicited messages from Signal contact identities.

instruction: How can you integrate a Facebook account into Comm100?
output: To integrate a Facebook account into Comm100, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Facebook. 3. Click Add Facebook Page. 4. Log in with your Facebook account and allow Comm100 Live Chat to access your Facebook pages. If you have multiple Facebook pages connected to this account, select the one you want to integrate. 5. Switch the toggle key to enable or disable the integration of the Facebook account. 6. Select the integration options that you want for creating a ticket. 7. Click Save. The connected Facebook accounts will be listed on the Facebook page. You can edit or delete these accounts from the Operations column.

instruction: How can you integrate a Twitter account into Comm100?
output: To integrate a Twitter account into Comm100, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. Navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Twitter. 3. Click Add Twitter Account, log into your Twitter account and click Authorize app to authorize Comm100 to access your account. 4. You can click on the Edit symbol under the Operations menu bar to check for more integration options. The integration is now complete. The standalone Ticketing & Messaging tab in your Agent Console now allows your live chat agents to view and reply to Facebook pages, Twitter interactions, and other social media channels.

instruction: How can I set notifications for my live chat in Comm100?
output: You can customize sound notifications in your Agent Console window. Log in to your Comm100 Agent Console App, go to Preferences, click Live Chat, and then go to the Notification tab to choose a proper sound option for different scenarios. You can also adjust the volume and turn on or off popup notifications.

instruction: How do I enable notifications for Comm100 Live Chat in different browsers?
output: For Chrome, go to Settings, click Privacy and security, then Site Settings, and check the Notifications section to ensure the comm100.io domain is not blocked. For Safari, go to Preferences and allow comm100.io to show alerts in Notification Center.

instruction: What are the main differences between the Comm100 Live Chat Web App and Desktop App Agent Console?
output: The Web App Agent Console allows agents to chat with website visitors using any major web browser and is created with HTML 5 for compatibility across devices and platforms. The Desktop App Agent Console runs on Windows and macOS, has a separate taskbar icon for chat, and includes additional features such as auto away, auto logout, and the ability to pop out the Visitor tab in a new window.

instruction: What additional features does the Comm100 Live Chat Desktop App offer compared to the Web App?
output: The Desktop App includes features such as starting the Agent Console as your machine starts up, auto away (automatically switching to Away status after a period of no mouse or keyboard input), auto logout (automatically logging out after a period of no mouse or keyboard input), and the option to pop out the Visitor tab in a new window for better monitoring while chatting.

instruction: Why am I receiving the 'Force Login' prompt when trying to log in to the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: You receive the 'Force Login' prompt because either someone is already logged in using your login information, the agent console app is minimized and you are attempting a second login, or you closed the agent console without logging out and are trying to log in again.

instruction: What should I do to solve the 'Force Login' problem in the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: To solve the 'Force Login' problem, click the OK button in the Force Login window to log out from the previous session or log out the person using your credentials. To prevent this issue, always log out before closing the console application. If you suspect unauthorized access, change your password on the Comm100 Control Panel.

instruction: What is Comm100 Agent SSO?
output: Comm100 Agent SSO (Single Sign-On) allows your agents to have a single login across Comm100 and other applications, enabling secure movement between them without needing to log into separate accounts or remember multiple usernames and passwords.

instruction: Which standards and identity providers does Comm100 support for Agent SSO?
output: Comm100 supports Agent SSO via SAML (Security Assertion Markup Language) or JWT (JSON Web Token) standards. The supported SSO identity providers include Azure AD, Google Cloud Identity, and Okta.

instruction: What information is provided when a 'Chat Transferred' event occurs in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks?
output: When a 'Chat Transferred' event occurs, Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks provide a callback with properties such as the event type, details of the agent transferring the chat, details of the agent receiving the chat, and information about the visitor and the chat. The data is in JSON format.

instruction: What are some of the visitor properties captured by Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks?
output: Some of the visitor properties captured include the visitor's id, name, email, status, phone, company, first visit time, visit time, city, state, country, IP address, language, screen resolution, time zone, flash version, operating system, browser, custom fields, product/service, department, skill, custom variables, current browsing page, total visits, total chats, referrer URL, search engine, keywords, landing page, and total page views.

instruction: How can you integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Zapier?
output: You can integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Zapier by logging into your Zapier account, creating a new Zap, selecting Comm100 as the app, choosing a trigger event, connecting your Comm100 account, setting up an action event in another app (e.g., Trello), and enabling the Zap.

instruction: What are some examples of actions you can automate using Comm100 and Zapier integration?
output: Examples of actions you can automate include adding contacts to Zoho CRM when a chat ends, sending Slack notifications when a chat begins, and updating contact information in HubSpot when an offline message is submitted.

instruction: Why am I receiving an account locked error message when I log in to Comm100?
output: Your account gets locked when you log in to Comm100 because the number of your failed login attempts has exceeded the maximum number determined by the password policy settings on your site.

instruction: What can I do if my Comm100 account gets locked?
output: If your account gets locked, you can ask the site administrator to unlock your account from the Control Panel, wait 30 minutes for the account to unlock automatically, or reset your password by clicking the 'Forgot your password' link on the login page.

instruction: How can you enable Auto Translation for Live Chat in Comm100?
output: To enable Auto Translation for Live Chat in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Global Settings > Auto Translation, and turn on the Auto Translation for Live Chat toggle key. Optionally, you can add words and phrases to the no-translation list in the List Words/Phrases That Do Not Require Translation area.

instruction: How do you use Auto Translation in the Comm100 Live Chat Agent Console?
output: To use Auto Translation in the Comm100 Live Chat Agent Console, log in to your Comm100 Live Chat Agent Console, go to Preference and click Global. From the Language tab, select the Auto Translate to checkbox and choose a language from the dropdown list. Click OK to save the setting. During a chat, the system auto-detects when a visitor is speaking a different language, and you can click a button to turn on the translation. After Auto Translation is turned on, chat messages will be automatically translated.

instruction: How can you manage appointments on the Agent Console in Comm100 Booking?
output: In Comm100 Booking, you can view and manage booked appointments on the Agent Console. You can view appointments in a calendar view, reschedule or cancel future appointments, mark no-shows, and manually create appointments for customers.

instruction: What permissions do administrators have regarding managing appointments?
output: By default, site administrators can view and manage the appointments of all agents. They can also grant the permission of managing all appointments to an agent. Individual agents can manage their own appointments.

instruction: How does the Comm100 Chatbot use visitor location data?
output: Comm100 Chatbot allows you to ask visitors to share their location to achieve more personalized responses. The location information includes latitude and longitude, which can be sent to your own application using Webhook. The corresponding response from your application will be displayed as the Chatbot reply, providing more efficient chatting experiences throughout complex interactions.

instruction: What are the steps to configure the Comm100 Chatbot to collect visitor location data?
output: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. 3. Select a Comm100 Chatbot from the drop-down list, and go to Intents. 4. Select the existing Intent you want to edit or create a new Intent. 5. On the Edit Intent page, go to the Answers section and select the Live Chat channel. 6. From the Actions option, drag the Collect Location action to the Answer flow area. 7. From the Advanced action options, select Webhooks, and input your Webhook URL. 8. Your web application will process the message and return the answer accordingly. 9. The geolocation info sent to your application includes Longitude and Latitude in JSON format. 10. Save the changes to test your Chatbot.

instruction: How can I track visitors' footprints on my website using Comm100?
output: On the Comm100 Agent Console, you can track the URLs of webpages that visitors have visited on your website. With Comm100 Live Chat, the footprint is recorded in real-time, and you can view the total duration of a visit and the minutes that a visitor has stayed on each webpage.

instruction: What are the steps to track a visitor's navigation history on my website using Comm100?
output: To track a visitor's navigation history on your website, follow these steps: 1. On the Comm100 Agent Console, go to the Visitors tab. 2. Locate the target visitor you want to track, and click the Details link. 3. Click the Navigation tab. The visitor's footprint on your website is listed in chronological order. You can get the information updated by clicking Refresh.

instruction: What is the scoring range used by Agent Assist to match visitor questions with help resources?
output: The Score can be adjusted within a range of 0 to 100.

instruction: How does the score threshold affect the suggestions provided by Agent Assist?
output: Setting a higher score threshold means that Agent Assist will interpret conversations more narrowly and only make suggestions when it is very confident that a resource is relevant. It is recommended that as your pool of help resources grows, you should slowly raise your score threshold.

instruction: What are the main steps to set up Comm100 Agent SSO with Okta?
output: The main steps to set up Comm100 Agent SSO with Okta are: 1. Create an app integration for Comm100 in Okta. 2. Assign the Comm100 integration app to users. 3. Set up SAML SSO on the Comm100 Control Panel.

instruction: How do you create an app integration for Comm100 in Okta?
output: To create an app integration for Comm100 in Okta, go to Applications > Applications in the Okta Admin Console, click Create App Integration, select SAML 2.0 as the Sign-on method, and configure the SAML settings including Single sign on URL, Audience URI, and Attribute Statements.

instruction: How can you review the Chatbot's chat history?
output: To check the chat history, go to Live Chat > History > Chats. For chats handled by the Chatbot, you can select the bot from the drop-down list to see all the bots. Choose the specific bot for which you want to check the History. You can filter the Chats by Time, Department, Bot, and Category. The Details option under the Operations header shows the chat transcript, chat-related information, and relevant visitor information.

instruction: How can you create a view to see tickets handled by the Chatbot in the Agent Console?
output: To create a view of chatbot tickets, follow these steps: 1. Log in to Agent Console. 2. In the side navigation, click Ticketing & Messaging. 3. On the Ticketing & Messaging page, click the Manage Views icon in Views. 4. On the Manage Views page, click New View. A new pop-up opens. 5. Type a Name, choose to make it Public or not. 6. Create a rule and define its conditions. 7. Click Save. You can add a condition that triggers when the Assigned Agent is the Chatbot. Once you save the view, you can see all tickets handled by the Chatbot by clicking the view.

instruction: What is a Contact in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: In Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, a Contact is a customer who has a unified identity in the Comm100 system, allowing you to track and manage the complete communication history of a customer.

instruction: How can you manage Contacts in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: In Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, you can manage Contacts by creating, editing, changing, and merging them. You can also create views to categorize Contact messages based on specific Contact Identities.

instruction: What does the 'Do Not Honor' error mean when trying to pay with a credit card?
output: The 'Do Not Honor' error means that the financial institution or the credit card issuer bank has declined the payment, and the payment cannot be processed or approved. You should contact your bank or financial institution for more details.

instruction: What should you do if you receive a 'Do Not Honor' error when paying with a credit card?
output: You should double-check your credit card information and update it in your Billing Info. After verifying all the information, go to Global Settings > Billing Info, and click the Charge Amount Due button again in your Comm100 account.

instruction: How can you test the chatbot in the simulator?
output: To test the chatbot in the simulator, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Bot > Chatbot, select your chatbot from the drop-down list, go to Intents, and click the Test Bot button. Use the Test Bot window to send test messages to the bot and see the answers being returned.

instruction: What are the benefits of testing the chatbot in the live chat preview?
output: Testing the chatbot in the live chat preview allows real-time testing as buttons, links, forms, and prompts are functional. It also allows you to switch campaigns from the drop-down and test the linked chatbot.

instruction: Can I export reports in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Yes, you can export Comm100 Reports. The feature of exporting reports is available in Comm100 Live Chat Business. If you are using the Comm100 Live Chat Team edition, please upgrade your Live Chat to the Business edition to get the Exporting Reports feature.

instruction: How can agents manually convert a chat to a ticket during a chat session in Comm100?
output: After integrating Comm100 Live Chat with Comm100 Ticketing System, agents can manually convert a chat to a new ticket or attach the chat to an existing ticket in the Live Chat Agent Console window. This integration eliminates the need for agents to switch between Live Chat and Ticket applications.

instruction: What are the steps to generate a ticket from a chat in Comm100?
output: To generate a ticket from a chat, follow these steps: 1. In the agent console chat window, click 'Mark for follow up'. 2. Create a new ticket or attach the chat to an existing ticket. 3. Click 'OK'. The chat transcript will be attached to the ticket when the chat ends, and follow-ups can be done in the Ticketing & Messaging module.

instruction: How can you use a third-party chatbot with Comm100?
output: You can use a third-party chatbot and manage its deployment using Comm100 by integrating it using Webhooks and deploying it over Live Chat and social messaging channels.

instruction: How does the third-party chatbot work with Comm100?
output: Comm100 sends information for events such as chat joined, questions asked, intents clicked, location shared, and form submitted via Webhooks. The third-party chatbot processes the data using its bot engine and sends a response to Comm100, which then displays an answer to your visitors. The data format type of the request and response is JSON.

instruction: How can you access messages from different channels within the Ticketing & Messaging system?
output: You can create multiple Views to quickly locate messages from certain channels based on predefined conditions. The Filters help you narrow down the tickets you are looking for. Log in to the Agent Console and go to the Ticketing & Messaging tab. You can find tickets from all your integrated channels under 'All' within the Views column, but you can also create custom Views to organize your inbox into meaningful categories.

instruction: How do you create a custom filter for messages in the Ticketing & Messaging system?
output: To create a custom filter, click the 'Manage Views' icon. Give your View a name and choose the source of the message as the condition. For example, when the first message channel is SMS, the filter will show all tickets created from the SMS Channel. Save the configuration. If you have more than one channel integrated, create filters for messages/tickets from other channels. You can reorder, remove, or edit filters as necessary.

instruction: What are the benefits of using a Chatbot in your business?
output: The benefits of using a Chatbot in your business include faster response time, handling capacity/multitasking, and cost-effectiveness.

instruction: How can you set up a Chatbot for social channels using Comm100?
output: To set up a Chatbot for social channels using Comm100, log in to the Control Panel, go to Bot > Chatbot, click Manage, then New Chatbot, provide the necessary details, select the Engine, Language, and Channel, and save. Then, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels, select the social channel, add or choose an account, enable the bot, and configure routing rules if necessary.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Spell Check feature in Comm100?
output: The Spell Check feature in Comm100 helps improve service efficiency for agents by identifying misspelled words and allowing quick corrections from a suggestion list. It supports multiple languages including English, French, German, Spanish, and more.

instruction: How can you enable and verify Spell Check in Comm100 Desktop App and Web App?
output: In the Comm100 Desktop App, you can enable and verify Spell Check by going to the Agent Console, clicking on 'Global' from the 'Preferences' drop-down menu, and ensuring that Spell Check is enabled for your language. In the Web App, Spell Check is browser-based and available in Edge, Chrome, and Firefox. You need to verify the language settings in your browser, ensure your language is in the 'Preferred languages' list, and that spell check for your language is turned on. Additionally, in the Web Agent Console, go to 'Global' from the 'Preferences' drop-down menu and verify that Spell Check is enabled.

instruction: Can I view the referrers in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Yes, with Comm100 Live Chat, you can easily know how your customers find you by the 'Referred From' column in your Agent Console window. Each line in 'Referred From' is displayed as a clickable referral URL.

instruction: Are referrer URLs saved for all visitors in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The referrer URL is recorded in the History Chats and Messages for visitors who have interacted with your agents or left offline messages. However, Comm100 does not save the referral URL for online visitors who haven't interacted with your agents or left offline messages.

instruction: What is the Dynamic Campaign feature in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The Dynamic Campaign feature is an advanced option of the Multiple Campaigns feature in Comm100 Live Chat. It allows you to run different campaigns on the same web page, with each campaign taking effect only when certain conditions are met.

instruction: How do you set up a Dynamic Campaign in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up a Dynamic Campaign in Comm100 Live Chat, log in to your Comm100 account, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign, manage your campaigns, and create new rules for the Dynamic Campaign. Each rule has a targeted campaign that defines how your chat button, invitation, and visitor side windows should work when the rule is triggered. Finally, copy the Live Chat Code of the Dynamic Campaign and paste it onto your website.

instruction: Why can't I receive push notifications on my Android phone when using the Comm100 app?
output: Possible reasons include: the notification for chat events is disabled in the Comm100 app, the notification for the Comm100 app is disabled in your phone settings, lock screen notifications are disabled on your phone, power saving settings of your phone interrupt Comm100 app notifications, or your phone’s data saver prevents the Comm100 app from sending and receiving data in the background.

instruction: How can I fix the issue of not receiving push notifications on my Android phone for the Comm100 app?
output: Check the following settings: ensure app notifications are enabled in the Comm100 app, verify phone notification settings for the Comm100 app, enable lock screen notifications, ensure no power saving mode is preventing the Comm100 app from running, and disable any data saving settings that might restrict the Comm100 app.

instruction: What are the possible causes for being unexpectedly logged out of the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: The possible causes include: logging in from another place (e.g., another device or browser tab), someone with your login credentials forcing a log in, losing connection with the server due to an unstable internet connection, or an Admin/co-worker with 'Log Agents Off' permission clicking the Kick-Off button in the Agent tab.

instruction: What are the solutions if you are unexpectedly logged out of the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: The solutions include: reconnecting to the internet and ensuring the connection is stable, having the person using your login credentials log out of your account or logging in and kicking them out if required, and changing your password if you feel that your account may have been compromised.

instruction: How can agents handle incoming calls and call tickets on the Agent Console in Comm100 Voice?
output: In Comm100 Voice, after the Voice service is set up on the Control Panel, agents can handle incoming calls and check call logs on the Agent Console. Incoming calls are auto-attached as messages into new tickets, and agents can manage these voice tickets similarly to other tickets. Voice tickets are created immediately when a call comes in, regardless of whether the call is answered or not.

instruction: What are the different call statuses an agent can have on the Agent Console?
output: On the Agent Console, agents can have the following call statuses: Online (available to take a call), Away (unavailable for a call), In a call (when taking a call, calling a number, or during Agent Wrap-up time), and Offline (when logged out). Agents can manually change their status to Online or Away, while In a call and Offline statuses are updated automatically by the system.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Ticket Merge operation?
output: Ticket Merge is an operation for you to merge the history of a source ticket with a target ticket. The merge operation is irreversible, and after the merge, the target ticket keeps its property values. Future incoming emails, chat transcripts, and offline messages to the source ticket will automatically be attached to the target ticket.

instruction: How can you merge a ticket with another ticket?
output: To merge a ticket with another ticket, go to the Ticketing & Messaging tab of the Agent Console, find a ticket you want to merge with from the ticket list, click the drop-down list icon next to the Close button, and select Merge. Then, select a ticket you want to merge into another ticket, search for a certain ticket using identifiers like Ticket ID, Contact Email, or any text from within the Ticket, select your target ticket, and click Merge. Finally, click OK to confirm the merge.

instruction: How can you customize file attachments in Secure Messaging?
output: To customize file attachments in Secure Messaging, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Secure Messaging, click the Secure Messenger link or the Edit icon, go to the Attachment tab, and set the max file size, enable attachments in contact replies, define allowed file types, and provide the allowed file types in the text area. Finally, click Save.

instruction: What file types are not supported by Comm100 for security purposes?
output: The following file types are not supported by Comm100 for security purposes: .EXE, .SYS, .SRC, .CMD, .BAT, .RAR, .DLL, .COM, .ISO, .HTML, .RM, .AVI, .TMP, .MDF, .MID, .JAR, .PIF.

instruction: What is the purpose of the post-chat survey window in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The post-chat survey window allows visitors to leave evaluative comments and rate agents' performance after a chat. It helps gather clients' feedback, evaluate employees' performance, and identify improvement opportunities.

instruction: How can you customize the post-chat survey window in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To customize the post-chat survey window, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to the Live Chat tab, select the appropriate campaign, turn on the Post-chat toggle key, customize the greeting message, add or create new fields, and set the visibility and requirements for the fields.

instruction: What are the system requirements for Comm100 Live Chat on the visitor side?
output: Visitors only need a web browser to initiate a chat request through Comm100 Live Chat. Supported web browsers include Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and Safari on Windows, macOS, and Linux. For Android visitors, supported browsers are Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox. For iOS visitors, supported browsers are Google Chrome and Safari.

instruction: What are the system requirements for Comm100 Live Chat on the agent side?
output: Comm100 Live Chat agent side has two parts: Control Panel and Agent Console. The Control Panel requires only a web browser and supports Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and Safari. The Agent Console has a web app version that supports Microsoft Edge 14 or above, Google Chrome 49 or above, Mozilla Firefox 51 or above, and Safari 10 or above. The desktop app version supports Windows 7 or above and macOS version 10.9 or above. Mobile apps are supported on iOS 8.0 or above and Android 4.0 or above.

instruction: What is the purpose of generating a HAR file?
output: A HAR file is used to identify performance issues, such as slow load times, page rendering, browser, and performance. It keeps track of each resource loaded by the browser and timing information for each resource, helping in debugging complex issues.

instruction: How can you generate a HAR file in Google Chrome?
output: To generate a HAR file in Google Chrome, follow these steps: 1. Open Google Chrome and go to the page where the issue is occurring. 2. Select More Tools > Developer Tools or right-click and select Inspect. 3. Select the Network tab. 4. Ensure the Record network log button is red. 5. Select the Preserve log check box. 6. Click the Clear button to clear existing logs. 7. Reproduce the issue while recording. 8. Right-click the network request log and select Save all as HAR with content. 9. Save the file to your computer in .har format.

instruction: What are the collaboration options available for agents in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Comm100 Live Chat allows agents to collaborate by transferring chats to another agent, joining an ongoing chat, making internal notes, and chatting with other agents.

instruction: How can agents transfer a chat to another agent or department in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Agents can transfer a chat to another online agent or to a department. If Auto Distribution is enabled, the chat goes to an available agent in the department based on the Auto Distribution Method. If Auto Distribution is not enabled, all agents in the department will be notified until one accepts the transferred chat.

instruction: Where can I find the Twilio Account SID and Auth Token?
output: Log into your Twilio Account. On your project Twilio Dashboard, you can find the Account SID and Auth Token. You can also go to Settings, General, and locate your ACCOUNT SID. Within the same page, you can also find the Auth Token. If you have multiple tokens, you must use the Primary Token.

instruction: How can I find the Phone Number SID in Twilio?
output: To find your Phone Number SID, navigate to Phone Numbers > Manage Numbers > Active Numbers, then click on one of your integrated phone numbers. There you can find the SID for the phone number.

instruction: How can you automatically invite visitors to chat using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: With Comm100 Live Chat, you can automatically invite visitors to chat based on pre-defined rules. This ensures that no target visitors are missed and frees you from manually identifying and sending invitations.

instruction: What are the steps to create a new auto invitation in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Invitation. 3. Under the Auto Invitations tab, click New Auto Invitation. 4. On the New Auto Invitation page, enter the invitation name and turn on the Enable toggle key. 5. Enter the invitation message. 6. Choose the invitation style based on your preference. 7. Set the invitation conditions. 8. Turn on options like 'Only pop-up once per visit' and 'Hide invitation on mobile' as needed. 9. Click Save.

instruction: How do I reset the integration of my Twitter account with Comm100?
