output: To reset the integration of your Twitter account with Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Twitter, click on the Reset Account icon under Operations, and then click Authorize app in the popup window. This will reauthorize your Twitter account for the Comm100 integration.

instruction: What is the maximum number of files that can be transferred during a chat session in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Up to 20 files can be transferred between the agent and the visitor during a chat session.

instruction: What is the maximum file size allowed for transfer in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The maximum size of a file is 10 MB.

instruction: What is Voice Bot Sensitivity?
output: Voice Bot Sensitivity refers to the voice bot's capacity to provide matching answers to callers' questions. The voice bot's sensitivity score ranges from 0 to 100, where 100 represents an absolute match, and 0 represents no match. The score range is set to represent the matching degree of the voice bot's answer to callers' questions.

instruction: How does Voice Bot Sensitivity work?
output: When a caller inputs a question, the Natural Language Processing engine scans all of the question variants for all the intents in the bot, assigning a confidence score to each. The response for the intent containing the question variant with the highest score is sent to the caller if the score is higher than the High Confidence Answer Score threshold. Depending on the matching degree, the voice bot may provide High Confidence Answers or No Answer. High Confidence Answers have a matching degree equal to or greater than the High Confidence Answer score threshold, which is set to 40 by default. If no matching answer is found, the voice bot returns no answer and provides an alternative solution, such as 'Chat with a Live Agent.'

instruction: Where can I find the LINE Channel ID, Channel Secret, and Channel Access Token?
output: You can find the LINE Channel ID, Channel Secret, and Channel Access Token in the LINE Developers Console. You need to log in to your LINE business account, go to the LINE Developers Console, create a Provider or choose an existing one, create a Messaging API channel, and then find the credentials in the channel's Basic settings and Messaging API tabs.

instruction: What are the steps to set up integration with Comm100 using LINE Official Account?
output: To set up integration with Comm100 using LINE Official Account, you need to: 1) Log in to your LINE business account, 2) Go to the LINE Developers Console, 3) Create a Provider or choose an existing one, 4) Create a Messaging API channel, 5) Fill in the necessary details, 6) Find the Channel ID and Channel Secret in the Basic settings tab, and 7) Issue a Channel Access Token in the Messaging API tab.

instruction: How can you enable the Comm100 Live Chat GoToMeeting Integration?
output: To enable the Comm100 Live Chat GoToMeeting Integration, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, click on Apps & Integrations in the left navigation menu, scroll down to the GoToMeeting Integration and click Settings, then turn on the GoToMeeting Integration toggle key.

instruction: How do you start screen sharing in Comm100 Live Chat after integrating with GoToMeeting?
output: After the integration is set up, a screen-sharing icon will appear on your chat console. Clicking on the icon will directly send a link to the visitor you’re chatting with to join the screen-sharing session.

instruction: How can you customize a manual invitation with a predefined message in Comm100?
output: To customize a manual invitation with a predefined message in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 control panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign from the left navigation menu, select a campaign, go to Invitation, select the Manual Invitation tab, provide a personalized message in the Invitation Message section, choose an invitation style (Bubble or Greeting Messages), and click Save. The settings and changes will take effect immediately.

instruction: What are the invitation styles available for manual invitations in Comm100?
output: Comm100 provides two invitation styles for manual invitations: Bubble and Greeting Messages. The Bubble invitation style works with the Adaptive Chat button and appears above an agent avatar, while the Greeting message invitation style works with an embedded chat window and appears as a greeting message in the chat window when a chat invitation is issued.

instruction: What is Visitor Single Sign-On (SSO) for Comm100 Messenger and how does it work?
output: Visitor Single Sign-On (SSO) for Comm100 Messenger allows you to authenticate your visitor's account information before the chat starts. It uses Security Assertion Mark-up Language (SAML) to exchange authentication and authorization data between your Identity Provider (IDP) and the Comm100 Messenger server. When a customer clicks on the chat window's login option, the Comm100 Messenger server asks your IDP server whether the customer has been authenticated. If authenticated, the customer is connected to Messenger immediately; otherwise, the login page appears for the customer to log in.

instruction: What are the requirements for setting up Visitor SSO in Comm100 Messenger?
output: Before configuring Visitor SSO, you need to collect the following details: Sign-In URL, Artifact Resolution Service URL, Logout URL, and SAML Certificate from your identity provider. Additionally, Comm100 suggests adding a signature to the SAML Response returned from IDP to Comm100 SSO to ensure data security.

instruction: How can you enable Visitor SSO in your Comm100 account?
output: To enable Visitor SSO in your Comm100 account, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. Go to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Visitor Single Sign-On. 3. Turn ON the Visitor Single Sign-On toggle key. 4. Add the required information in the SSO Settings section. 5. Add user attributes in the SSO Data Mapping section. 6. Select a sign-in option from the Sign-In Options drop-down list. 7. Click Save.

instruction: Where do I find the Telegram Bot Token?
output: To find the Telegram Bot Token, log in to your Telegram account, search for @botFather, and follow the instructions to create a new bot. The Bot Token will be provided in the message from BotFather.

instruction: What should I do if I need to change my Telegram bot's token?
output: If you need to change your bot's token, type /revoke and choose your bot name. BotFather will replace your token with a newer one.

instruction: How can I upgrade my Comm100 trial account to a paid account?
output: To upgrade to a paid account, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > Billing > Billing Profile, click Buy Now, choose the billing period and plan, select your payment method, enter your billing information, and confirm your order.

instruction: What are the different Comm100 plans available?
output: Comm100 provides Comm100 Live Chat and Comm100 Omnichannel plans. Comm100 Live Chat is available in Live Chat Startup and Live Chat Plus versions, while Comm100 Omnichannel is available in Omnichannel Gold, Omnichannel Platinum, and Custom editions. These plans are priced per agent based on monthly/yearly subscriptions.

instruction: What are the different modes available for Question Grouping in Comm100's Chatbot Learning?
output: The different modes available for Question Grouping are Precise Mode, Standard Mode, and Simple Mode.

instruction: What are the advantages of using the Question Grouping feature in Comm100's Chatbot Learning?
output: The advantages of using the Question Grouping feature include creating new intents or refining existing ones, saving manual effort of analyzing learning questions one by one, and helping the Chatbot cater to an extensive array of questions when the intents are refined based on groups.

instruction: What are some key strategies for managing a difficult customer?
output: Key strategies for managing a difficult customer include staying calm, having a script ready, personalizing your response, empathizing with the customer, keeping the language optimistic, taking help from another agent, and going the extra mile for the customer.

instruction: How can empathy improve customer service interactions?
output: Empathy can improve customer service interactions by building an enriched bond between you and your customers, gaining a better understanding of customers' needs, rectifying a negative customer experience, increasing customer retention, and improving brand image.

instruction: How can agents create internal tickets in Comm100 Agent Console?
output: Agents can create internal tickets in Comm100 Agent Console by logging in, navigating to the Ticketing & Messaging tab, clicking 'New', selecting 'Internal', filling in the details, and hitting 'Create & Send'.

instruction: What are the different datasets included in the Live Chat metrics and attributes?
output: The Live Chat datasets include the following: Chat dataset, Offline Message dataset, Visit dataset, Queue dataset, Auto Invitation dataset, and Manual Invitation dataset.

instruction: What is the definition of 'Abandoned Chats' in the Chat Dataset?
output: Abandoned Chats are the number of chat requests abandoned by visitors before connecting with agents.

instruction: How do you integrate a LINE account with Comm100?
output: To integrate a LINE account with Comm100, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > LINE. 3. On the Channel Account tab of the LINE page, click Add LINE Account. 4. Enter the LINE channel account name. 5. Turn on the Enable toggle key to send and receive messages from the LINE accounts. 6. Enter Channel ID, Channel Secrets, and Channel Access Token. 7. Click OK. 8. Enable the Comm100 webhook from the Messaging API tab of the LINE Provider Channel. The LINE account has been added, and you can manage multiple LINE accounts via the Comm100 Control Panel.

instruction: What do you need before integrating the LINE channel with Comm100?
output: Before integrating the LINE channel with Comm100, you need to set up a LINE Official account and obtain the Channel ID, Channel secrets, and Channel access code (long-lived) from the LINE Developers Console.

instruction: How can you reset your Facebook page integration with Comm100?
output: You can reset your Facebook page integration with Comm100 by following these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. In the left navigation bar, go to the Ticketing & Messaging tab. 3. Click the Channels drop-down menu, then click Facebook. 4. Click Add Facebook Page. 5. Re-log into your Facebook account and authorize the access. The Facebook page appears in the list. 6. Click the Pencil icon next to each page to manage it inside Comm100. 7. Click the Bin icon to remove any page. 8. Click Ok to confirm the change. Now your Facebook account has been reauthorized for Comm100 integration.

instruction: How can I manage agents in my Comm100 account?
output: You can manage agents by adding multiple agents to your account, editing their information, resetting their passwords, assigning them to different departments, and granting them permissions by giving them roles.

instruction: What roles can be assigned to agents in Comm100?
output: Administrators and Agents are system default roles that can be assigned to agents in Comm100.

instruction: How can you set up logical expressions for conditions in Auto Invitation, Visitor Segmentation, Routing, and Dynamic Campaign?
output: To set up logical expressions for conditions, select 'Use logic expression' from the drop-down list, click 'Add a Condition' and set up conditions based on your needs. Enter the logical expression using condition identifier numbers. Ensure parentheses come in pairs, logical operators are not case sensitive, and spaces are added appropriately. Click outside the text box to verify the expression, and save the changes after successful verification.

instruction: Can you provide an example of a logical expression with conditions?
output: If you have 5 conditions, you can use an expression like '(1 or 2 or 3) and (4 and 5)'. This means the rule will be triggered when any of the 1 to 3 conditions is met as well as condition 4 and condition 5 are met.

instruction: How can you customize the Messenger Window to match the style of your website?
output: To customize the Messenger Window, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Messenger, click the Messenger link or the Pencil icon, and then customize the Header and Body sections by selecting theme colors, adding titles, welcome messages, company name, uploading a company logo, setting reply time messages, selecting conversation background textures, displaying agent avatars, and removing the 'Powered by Comm100' text. Finally, click Save to apply the changes.

instruction: What is the 'Continue conversation in another device' feature and how does it work?
output: The 'Continue conversation in another device' feature allows visitors to maintain conversations on another device without login. Once enabled, visitors can copy the link URL from the Messenger window's drop-down menu, open it on another device, and authenticate using a dynamic security code. The link URL can be used only once and expires in 10 minutes. If the visitor's devices are in sync, new conversations will auto-sync across devices, but old conversations will disappear if the link is used on a device with existing conversations.

instruction: How can I view offline messages left by my visitors in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: There are three ways to view offline messages left by visitors in Comm100 Live Chat: 1. View Messages in Email Account: Forward the messages to a preferred email address automatically and read them in your email system. 2. View Messages in Live Chat Control Panel: Log in to your Comm100 account, go to Live Chat > History > Messages, set the filter conditions, and click the Details icon to view the message. 3. View Messages in Ticketing & Messaging: If integrated with Comm100 Ticket, offline messages can be automatically generated as tickets and viewed in the Ticketing & Messaging tab in the agent console.

instruction: How can I view offline messages in the Live Chat Control Panel?
output: To view offline messages in the Live Chat Control Panel, log in to your Comm100 account, go to Live Chat > History > Messages from the left navigation menu, set the filter conditions to get your messages, and click the Details icon to view the message.

instruction: How can you customize the user interface of Secure Messenger?
output: To customize the user interface of Secure Messenger, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Secure Messaging, and click the Secure Messenger link or the Edit icon. On the General tab, you can select a theme color, font, adjust the font size, change the ticket subject, remove the 'Secured by Comm100' text, allow contacts to reopen resolved tickets, and customize the style with your own CSS. After making changes, click Save to apply them.

instruction: What customization options are available in the General tab of Secure Messenger?
output: In the General tab of Secure Messenger, you can select a theme color, choose a font, adjust the font size, change the ticket subject, remove the 'Secured by Comm100' text, allow contacts to reopen resolved tickets, and customize the style with your own CSS.

instruction: What are the steps to create a Comm100 Chatbot?
output: To create a Comm100 Chatbot, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Chatbot, click on Manage Chatbots, then click New Chatbot. Give your chatbot a name, choose the engine, language, channel, and payment status, and click Save.

instruction: How can you set up the Comm100 Chatbot for Live Chat?
output: To set up the Comm100 Chatbot for Live Chat, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Chatbot in the Comm100 Control Panel. Turn on the Enable toggle key, select the chatbot you want to use from the Bot for Campaign drop-down list, define when to allocate chats to the chatbot, and click Save.

instruction: What is the purpose of Comm100's Chatbot reporting?
output: Comm100's Chatbot reporting serves as an important tool for measuring the achievements of the Chatbot and helps identify areas for improvement.

instruction: What types of reports are provided by Comm100 for Chatbot reporting?
output: Comm100 provides Chatbot Reporting for features such as Chats & Tickets, Answers, High Confidence Answers, Rating, Chatbot & Agent, Chatbot Usage, Top Intents, Collected Leads, and Booked Meetings.

instruction: Can I customize my own live chat?
output: Yes! Comm100 Live Chat is customizable and you can customize the live chat according to your needs. Currently, all configurable items include Chat Button, Chat Window, Invitation, Pre-Chat Window, Offline Message Window, Post-Chat Survey, Interface Language, and some other advanced settings.

instruction: What are the common network-related issues experienced with Comm100?
output: Common network-related issues with Comm100 include receiving a 'Network Error' message when logging in, an error message saying 'We are not able to connect to the server', delays in message delivery, and seeing the message 'Internet connection is unstable or unavailable'.

instruction: What are the potential causes of network-related issues with Comm100?
output: The potential causes of network-related issues with Comm100 include network errors caused by connection-related issues, inactive server due to failure to get a response from Comm100's chat server, latency due to slow or unstable connection, and unexpected errors if the network is unstable.

instruction: How can I integrate my Telegram account with Comm100?
output: To integrate your Telegram account with Comm100, you need to log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Telegram, click 'Add Telegram Account', enable the toggle key to send and receive messages, enter the Name and Auth token, and click 'Save'. The integration is then complete, and your agents can respond to incoming Telegram messages from the Comm100 Agent Console.

instruction: What do I need before integrating the Telegram channel with Comm100?
output: Before integrating the Telegram channel with Comm100, you need to set up a Telegram account and obtain a bot token from the Telegram account.

instruction: What is the purpose of Comm100's Super Agent feature?
output: Comm100's Super Agent feature enables agents to handle chats and tickets from multiple sites faster and easier by managing multiple sites on one Control Panel and handling all chats and tickets from different sites on one Agent Console.

instruction: What are the key operations that super agents can perform on the Agent Console?
output: Super agents can log in to handle chats and tickets from all sites they work for, switch between site tabs, handle all chats under one tab, and change their status for each site or for all sites collectively.

instruction: How can I connect my own bot to Comm100 Live Chat using Webhooks?
output: To connect your own bot to Comm100 Live Chat using Webhooks, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Go to Bot > Chatbot from the left navigation menu. 3. Click the drop-down list and go to the Manage chatbots area. 4. Click Manage to open the Chatbots drawer. 5. Click New Chatbot to open the New Chatbot drawer. 6. Give your bot a Name. 7. Select Third Party from the Engine drop-down list. 8. Provide the Webhook target URL. 9. Click Save. 10. To modify the bot settings, click the Pencil icon to edit the display Name, Avatar, and Webhook Target URL. 11. Assign the newly created bot to a Campaign to deploy it.

instruction: What happens when an event occurs in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: When an event (Chat Joined, Question Asked, Intent Clicked, Location Shared, Form Submitted) occurs in Comm100 Live Chat, the information is passed to the bot via webhook. The bot processes the information using its own Bot Engine and sends a response to Comm100, which then displays the bot's answers to the visitors. The data format type of the request and response is JSON.

instruction: Can I edit the interface text of visitor side windows for different wordings in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Yes, Comm100 Live Chat supports changing the interface text of your visitor side windows including Pre-Chat Window, Chat Window, Post-Chat Window, and Offline Message Window. You can either change the text to a different language or re-define it for different wording according to your own preference.

instruction: How can you customize the Secure Messaging Form in the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To customize the Secure Messaging Form, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Secure Messaging, click the Secure Messenger link or the Edit icon, go to the Form tab, click + Add Field, select the Field name and add the Display name, and click OK. You can then manage the fields by making them mandatory or optional, editing, reordering, or deleting them, and finally, click Save to apply the changes.

instruction: What actions can you perform on the fields in the Secure Messaging Form?
output: Once the field appears in the list, you can make a field mandatory or optional using the Required toggle key, edit existing fields using the Edit icon, change their sequence by dragging them up or down, and delete a field using the Delete icon.

instruction: What are the basic distribution rules for auto-distributing chats in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Basic Chat Distribution Rules define how chat requests are distributed to agents within a department. These rules include Load Balancing, Round Robin, and Capability Weighted.

instruction: How does the Preference Rule work in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The Preference Rule, when enabled, directs the chat to the agent who has previously chatted with the visitor, provided the agent is online and has not reached the maximum chat number. This helps provide a more personalized service and increases chat efficiency.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Backup Rule in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The Backup Rule allows chats to be distributed to agents in a backup department when all agents in the original department are offline or have reached their maximum chat number. This ensures nonstop customer service during special occasions or peak seasons.

instruction: How can I set the offline button to redirect visitors to my own page in Comm100?
output: To set the offline button to redirect visitors to your own page in Comm100, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 account. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign. 3. Select the campaign from the drop-down list, and go to Offline Message. 4. Click the 'Redirect visitors to a custom page' tab, and fill in the URL of your own page. 5. Click Save.

instruction: Why am I receiving a 'Need admin approval' error message when integrating or reauthorizing Office 365 and Shared Mailbox emails with Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: The potential cause could be incorrect user/admin consent settings or permissions in the Azure portal.

instruction: What are the solutions to resolve the 'Need admin approval' error message in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: You can review user/admin consent settings in the Azure portal based on the correct user/admin consent settings and permissions. The solutions include: 1. Restricted resource access to allow app integration (MS Recommended). 2. No user consent; requires admin consent for apps. 3. No user consent; requires admin consent for apps, but admin consent request disabled.

instruction: How can I reset my Comm100 password if I forget it?
output: If you forget your password, visit the Comm100 User Sign In page, click the 'Forgot your password' link, enter your email address, and click 'Reset Password'. You will receive an email with a link to reset your password.

instruction: How can I change my Comm100 password after logging in?
output: If you know your current password, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, hover over the agent icon in the left navigation bar, click 'Change Password', enter your current and new passwords, and click 'Save' to successfully change your password.

instruction: What are the prerequisites for sending a JSON Web Token (JWT) to Secure Messenger?
output: Before sending the JWT of the authorized customer to Secure Messenger, you need to ensure that you have accomplished the following pre-requisites: Configured JWT validation, provided the Secure Messaging Contact Identity Key name, and specified the URLs to allow embedding Secure Messenger.

instruction: How can you generate and sign a Contact JWT for Secure Messenger?
output: You can generate a Contact JWT using either an existing JWT associated with a current logged-in customer or using any JWT library to generate a new JWT for a logged-in customer. The JWT must include an identity field and an expiry date. The signing of Contact JWT happens dynamically based on the configured method you choose from the Comm100 Control Panel, either using a Public Key, JWKS, or a shared token.

instruction: Why do online visitors not show in the Agent Console Window?
output: Possible causes include: 1) Comm100 Live Chat code is not pasted to the page visitor is on. 2) Only using a Chat link, not the JavaScript installation Code. 3) The pasted code is wrong or incomplete. 4) 'All Visitors' is not selected in the visitor filter. Solutions include: 1) Paste your live chat code onto the web page. 2) Remove the revised code and paste the original code without changes. 3) Select 'All Visitors' in the visitor filter.

instruction: How does the Note feature work in Comm100 Agent Console?
output: The Note feature in Comm100 Agent Console is used for internal communication among agents while using Live Chat or Ticketing & Messaging. It helps agents assist each other in handling customer queries and tickets without being visible to visitors, thereby delivering a consistent customer experience and improving agent efficiency.

instruction: How can agents use the Note feature during a Live Chat session?
output: During a Live Chat session, agents can use the Note feature to type internal comments or attach files in the Note tab of the Conversation pane. This allows them to share information or correct a teammate's response without the visitor seeing it. Once the chat ends, the Note's text area and file attachment become disabled, but the Note information can be retrieved from the chat transcript in the Comm100 Control Panel.

instruction: How can you install Comm100 Live Chat on your site using Google Tag Manager?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on your site using Google Tag Manager, you need to prepare the Comm100 Live Chat code first, then follow these steps: 1. Sign in to Google Tag Manager and create an account if you don't have one. 2. Set up the container and choose 'Web' as the target platform. 3. Install the GTM onto your website. 4. Create a new tag in the GTM dashboard, name it, choose 'Custom HTML' for Tag Configuration, and paste your Comm100 Live Chat code. 5. Set the triggering to 'All Pages' and save the tag. 6. Submit and publish your changes in the GTM dashboard. After publishing, you can visit your website to see the Comm100 Live Chat button.

instruction: What is the purpose of setting up webhooks in Comm100?
output: Webhooks allow you to set up event-driven communications between Comm100 and an external server or third-party services. By setting up webhooks, you can send a real-time notification to a third-party system whenever an event within the Comm100 platform occurs.

instruction: How can you create a webhook in Comm100?
output: To create a webhook in Comm100, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, click 'Apps & Integrations'. 3. Go to the 'Webhooks' card and click 'Settings'. 4. Click 'New Webhook'. 5. On the New Webhook page, complete the settings for the webhook, including providing a webhook name, the Target URL, and any required authorization or additional headers. 6. Click 'Save' to create the webhook.

instruction: How can you auto-fill pre-chat fields in Comm100 Live Chat based on custom variables?
output: Comm100 Live Chat allows you to auto-fill pre-chat fields based on the value of custom variables. By mapping the pre-chat field with the variable, you can populate the fields automatically with the variable values.

instruction: What are the steps to set up pre-chat fields based on custom variables in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up pre-chat fields based on custom variables, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Pre-chat. 3. Edit the pre-chat field you want to map with the variable. 4. Ensure the field name or display name matches the variable name. 5. Click OK and then Save. The value of the custom variable will appear in the pre-chat window after saving the changes.

instruction: What is Comm100 Voice and what does it offer?
output: Comm100 Voice is designed for businesses offering call center customer services. The Voice system helps you communicate with your customers over phone calls, manage phone lines, route incoming calls, and set up operating schedules for your team more efficiently.

instruction: How do you connect a Twilio account to Comm100 Voice?
output: To connect a Twilio account to Comm100 Voice, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Voice > Voice Provider, input the Account SID and Auth Token of your Twilio account, and click Connect.

instruction: What is a Voice Bot?
output: Voice bots are chatbots operating in voice channels. They can understand speech and talk with people like a human agent. Like chatbots, voice bots can run automated chat flows for various purposes, put data into your Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and transfer calls to the appropriate agents. Voice bots use Natural Language Processing (NLP) to interpret words. When it comes to giving replies, voice bots can either use pre-recorded audio files or Text-to-Speech (TTS) technology.

instruction: How do you create a Voice Bot in Comm100?
output: To create a Voice Bot, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Voice Bot. 3. Click New Voice Bot. 4. On the New Voice Bot drawer that appears, input your bot name, select the language, choose the voice, and choose the channel (Twilio or SIP). 5. Click Save. Your voice bot is successfully created.

instruction: What are the supported browsers for Audio & Video Chat in Comm100?
output: The supported browsers for Audio & Video Chat in Comm100 are Google Chrome (supported on Windows, macOS, Android), Mozilla Firefox (supported on Windows, macOS, Android), and Safari 11.0 or above (supported on iOS 11, macOS).

instruction: What is the Live Chat Queue in Comm100?
output: Chat queue is automatically enabled when you activate the Auto Distribution feature. With Auto Distribution enabled, when all agents reach their maximum concurrent chats, visitors will enter a chat queue and get notified of their positions in the queue. Visitors also have the option to leave offline messages if they don't want to wait.

instruction: How can you limit the chat queue length in Comm100?
output: To limit the chat queue length, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window, expand the Advanced area, select the Limit chat queue length checkbox, and set the maximum number of people in the chat queue or the maximum estimated wait time. You can also customize the message sent to visitors when they cannot enter the chat queue.

instruction: How does Chatbot Learning work?
output: Learning is a continuous process for Comm100 Chatbot. It evolves with the addition of visitor questions into its Learning page. A question is added automatically into the Learning page if the Chatbot could not recognize the visitor's question, the visitor marks the answer provided by the Chatbot as Not Helpful, the Chatbot provides possible answers to the visitor's question, or the visitor questions are very similar to the existing intents.

instruction: How can you manually add multiple visitor questions to the Learning page?
output: To add multiple questions manually in the Learning page, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Bot > Chatbot, select your chatbot from the drop-down list and go to Learning. On the Learning page, click Add Multiple Visitor Question, type or copy-paste the questions in the pop-up, and click Save. You can enter up to 50 questions at a time, one question per line.

instruction: Where can I find the attachments sent with offline messages in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: You can find the attachments sent with offline messages in the History menu of your live chat account. Log in to the Comm100 control panel, go to Live Chat > History > Messages, and click the Details icon to view a message. Scroll down to the Message Info section and click the name of the attachment to download the file.

instruction: Why does my chat button disappear when I go offline, and how can I make it show all the time?
output: The chat button disappears when you go offline because you have enabled the option to hide the offline chat button. To make it show all the time, log in to your Comm100 account, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select your campaign, go to Chat Button, and clear the 'Hide chat button when my team is offline' check box.

instruction: How can you use Agent Assist suggestions on the Agent Console?
output: After proper setup, Agent Assist suggestions appear automatically in the chat or ticket replying area on the Agent Console when a question is asked. You can mouse over the suggestion to preview the answer, click the suggestion to adopt and edit the answer before sending it out, double-click a suggestion to send it out directly, choose the message for which you want Agent Assist to show suggestions, and add a question to Agent Assist learning to train it.

instruction: How do you use Agent Assist to generate a summary for chats or tickets?
output: To generate a summary, click the 'Note' tab in the replying area of the chat or ticket, then click the 'Let Agent Assist make a summary' button in the bottom left. A quick summary of the chat or ticket will appear in the 'Note' area. You can edit the generated summary as needed and click 'Add' to share it with other team members.

instruction: How can you customize the Comm100 Live Chat Window using CSS?
output: You can customize the Comm100 Live Chat Window using your own CSS code by logging into your Comm100 Control Panel, and going to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window > Customize Style with Your Own CSS. This allows you to deliver a consistent and professional image that resonates with your branding and website.

instruction: How can you change the background image of the chat window?
output: You can set a custom background image for your chat window by adding the following CSS code: .chat { background: url(your_background_file.jpg); background-repeat: repeat; background-position: left top; }. If you also want to change the background of the Pre-chat form and Post-chat form, you can use the following code: .chat,.window__form{ background: url(your_background_file.jpg); background-repeat: repeat; background-position: left top; }

instruction: What are the initial steps to set up your agent profile in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Before you begin accepting tickets, you need to customize a few personal settings for your account from the Control Panel. You can set the Avatar, First name, Last name, Display name, and so forth on the Edit Agent page. Navigate to Global Settings > People > Agents to customize these details.

instruction: How can agents manage their status and preferences in the Agent Console?
output: Agents need to log in to the Agent Console and set their status to Online when available to start accepting tickets, change their status to Away during breaks, and log out when their shift ends. Preferences can be set in the Preferences tab, which includes settings for Sound & Popup notifications, Email Signatures, Language, and Global settings such as Auto login, Auto away, and Auto logout.

instruction: Why can't my website visitors see the chat button?
output: Possible causes include issues with the Live Chat JavaScript installation, the visitor being banned, the chat button being set to visible only on certain domains/URLs, no agents being online with the 'Hide Offline Button' option enabled, or the chat button being hidden by website rules.

instruction: How can I fix the issue of the chat button not being visible to my website visitors?
output: Solutions include ensuring the live chat code is correctly pasted, checking the ban list and lifting any bans, clearing the 'Display chat button on specified domains/URLs only' checkbox, keeping the 'Hide chat button when my team is offline' checkbox cleared, and ensuring no website rules are hiding the chat button.

instruction: What is the purpose of updating firewall settings for Comm100 domains?
output: The purpose of updating firewall settings for Comm100 domains is to optimize the connectivity between your network and the Comm100 platform and its services.

instruction: What should you do if your Control Panel domain is dash11.comm100.io?
output: If your Control Panel domain is dash11.comm100.io, you need to update the firewall for the corresponding domains listed in the document.

instruction: What is an entity in the context of voice bots?
output: For voice bots, an intent represents the task or action that the caller wants to perform. Entities are pieces of information that provide more context to an intent. They might be times, dates, locations, people, or other pieces of information specific to the caller. The primary purpose of an entity is to extract the data from callers' utterances so that the voice bot can provide context-relevant and valuable answers to the caller.

instruction: How do you mark keywords as entities in voice bot intent questions?
output: To mark keywords as an Entity in a question, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation bar, go to Bot > Voice Bot > Intents. 3. On the Intents page, go to an existing intent or create a new intent. 4. In the Questions section, select the keywords in the question that you want to mark as an Entity. 5. In the Entity column, choose the entity for the keyword. 6. In the Save to Variable column, input the variable name for the information. This helps the voice bot recognize and use these values to provide context-relevant answers.

instruction: How many languages does Comm100 Chatbot support?
output: Comm100 Chatbot now supports over 30 different languages, including Cantonese, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Danish, Dutch, English, French, German, Hindi, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Thai, Turkish, Ukrainian, Bengali, Finnish, Filipino, Marathi, Malay, Romanian, Sinhala, Tamil, Telugu, and Vietnamese.

instruction: How can you choose the language for your Comm100 Chatbot?
output: To choose your Chatbot language, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. 3. Click the drop-down list and go to the Manage Chatbots area. 4. Click Manage. 5. The Chatbots drawer appears. Click New Chatbot. 6. On the New Chatbot drawer, provide the Chatbot's name and select a Chatbot engine from the drop-down list. 7. Choose the Language for the new Chatbot. Note: You cannot change the language of a bot once it is created. 8. Click Save. You have successfully created a Chatbot with your chosen language.

instruction: What are the options available for opening a link from a chatbot answer?
output: The available options are The Side Window, A new window/tab, and The current browser window.

instruction: What are the methods to add a link in a chatbot answer?
output: There are two ways to add a link: Via Text and Via Buttons.

instruction: What are the prerequisites for integrating an Instagram Professional account into Comm100?
output: The prerequisites for integrating an Instagram Professional account into Comm100 are: an Instagram Professional account and an Instagram Professional Account linked to a Facebook Page.

instruction: How can you connect your Instagram Professional account to Comm100?
output: To connect your Instagram Professional account to Comm100, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Instagram. 3. Click Add Instagram Page. 4. Log in with your Facebook account. 5. Allow Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging to access your Instagram account and click Done. 6. From the Channel Account tab, click the Instagram account name or the Pencil icon from the list to configure the integration options. 7. Turn ON the toggle key to enable the integration of the Instagram account. 8. From the Integration Options section, configure the desired options. 9. Click Save.

instruction: How can you integrate Comm100 Live Chat with your Shopify store?
output: To integrate Comm100 Live Chat with your Shopify store, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Apps & Integrations, click Settings under the Shopify app, and follow the steps to add your Shopify store by providing the store URL, token, and campaign details.

instruction: What benefits do you get after integrating Comm100 Live Chat with your Shopify store?
output: After integrating Comm100 Live Chat with your Shopify store, you can see your Shopify store customers' data within the Comm100 Agent Console, including their information, order history, live cart information, and real-time notifications of cart updates. You can also view customer information, promote products through live chat, and see visitors' cart data in real-time.

instruction: What are the benefits of setting up multiple knowledge bases in Comm100's system?
output: Setting up multiple knowledge bases is helpful for supporting various products, avoiding confusion and overwhelming customers using only one product. It allows for separate internal and public knowledge bases, separation of articles between products, departments, branches, tailoring to different customer bases, and providing knowledge bases in different languages.

instruction: How can you create multiple knowledge bases in Comm100?
output: To create multiple knowledge bases, log into your Comm100 account, go to Knowledge Base > Knowledge Bases from the left navigation menu, navigate to the Manage knowledge bases area, click Manage, then click New Knowledge Base and customize the settings, build a repository of articles, and integrate it into a live chat campaign.

instruction: Where can I view the Agent Performance Report?
output: You can view the Agent Performance Report in your account. From the left navigation menu, go to Reporting > Live Chat reports to see various options or parameters such as Real-time, chat volume, wait time, and so forth to access the agent’s performance.

instruction: What information does the Agent Performance Report provide?
output: The Agent Performance Report provides data regarding agents' overall performance in terms of chat time and wait time within a specific time period. Detailed metrics include Avg. Chat Time, Avg. Wait Time, Chats, Total Chat Time, and Last Message Sent by Agent.

instruction: How can you manage agent permissions in Comm100?
output: You can manage agent permissions by editing agents individually or by granting role permissions. An agent has both the permissions that are granted individually and the permissions of all the roles that the agent has been assigned.

instruction: How do you enable or disable individual agent permissions in Comm100?
output: To enable or disable individual agent permissions, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > People > Agents, locate the agent, and click the gear icon in the Permissions column. Turn on or off the toggle keys of the target permissions in the Individual Permissions column, then click Save.

instruction: What is the impact of deleting agents on history chats, tickets, and reporting statistics?
output: Deleting an agent affects the data displayed in the Comm100 system, including history chats, tickets, and reporting statistics. History chats and tickets are saved but the agent is marked as deleted and cannot be filtered alone. Reporting statistics based on existing agents will change, while overall chat statistics remain the same.

instruction: What actions should be taken before deleting an agent?
output: Before deleting an agent, you should reassign the agent's unresolved tickets, change routing rules for future chat requests and tickets, and check settings in related modules such as live chat shift arrangements, segmentation settings, trigger actions, SLA policy conditions, and bot actions to ensure the agent is not involved in any ongoing processes.

instruction: How can agents manage customers in a queue using the Agent Console?
output: Agents can manage customers in a queue by viewing and serving customers based on their queue status. They can mark summoned customers as arrived or no-shows, summon or remove customers from the waiting list, end service sessions, and manage no-show customers by rejoining them to the waiting list or removing them.

instruction: How can agents manage queue settings on the Agent Console?
output: Agents can manage queue settings by changing the queue status and updating the number of available serving agents. The queue status can be set to automatic based on working hours and holidays or changed to manual mode. The number of available serving agents can be updated in real-time to provide more accurate wait time estimates.

instruction: How does Agent Assist Learning work?
output: Agent Assist identifies customers' questions and provides suggestions with a confidence score higher than the defined value. When it cannot find a matching answer, the unrecognized customer questions can be automatically added to its Learning section. Agents can also manually add questions to the Learning section. These questions need to be associated with matching content in its answer resources or new answer resources need to be created for them.

instruction: How can you train Agent Assist using the Learning feature?
output: To train Agent Assist, you can add unrecognized customer questions to the Learning section automatically by verifying the configuration in the Comm100 Control Panel. Agents can also manually add questions to the Learning section while handling chats or tickets. Once questions are added, they need to be associated with answer resources by creating new resources or linking them to existing ones.

instruction: How can I install Comm100 Live Chat on a Joomla! website?
output: To install Comm100 Live Chat on a Joomla! website, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Installation to find the installation code, copy the code, log in to your Joomla! admin panel, go to System > Site Templates, choose your site template, go to the Editor tab, choose the index.php file, paste the installation code before the closing </head> tag, and click Save & Close.

instruction: Where do I paste the Comm100 Live Chat installation code in Joomla!?
output: You need to paste the Comm100 Live Chat installation code in the index.php file of your site template before the closing </head> tag.

instruction: How can you edit an agent's information in the Comm100 system?
output: To edit an agent's information, you need to log in to the Comm100 account, go to Global Settings > People > Agents, find the agent and click the edit icon in the Operations column, edit the agent's information, and then click Save.

instruction: What information can be edited for an agent in the Comm100 system?
output: You can edit the agent's email, first name, last name, display name, password, departments, roles, active status, and more information such as title, bio, phone number, and time zone settings.

instruction: What are the requirements to import chatbot entities?
output: The requirements to import chatbot entities include supported formats (XLS, XLSX, and CSV), a maximum file size of 100 KB per file, a maximum of 50 entities in a single file with a total number of entities not exceeding 250, and synonyms must be comma-separated.

instruction: What information is included in the sample file for importing entities?
output: The sample file for importing entities includes the fields Entity Name, Keywords, and Synonyms.

instruction: How can a site administrator change an agent's time zone in Comm100?
output: To change an agent's time zone, the site administrator or agents with the Manage Agent & Agent Roles permission should follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Global Settings > People > Agents. 3. Click the agent's name in the list. 4. On the agent information page, expand the More Information section, and change the time zone setting. 5. Click Save.

instruction: How can an agent change their own time zone in Comm100?
output: To change their own time zone, an agent should follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. Move the mouse cursor to the avatar in the lower left corner and click the name. 3. On the Profile tab, expand the More Information section, and change the time zone setting. 4. Click Save.

instruction: How can you enable JWT SSO for agents to log into Comm100?
output: To enable JWT SSO for agents to log into Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to the Global Settings module, click Security on the left, enable Agent Single Sign-On, switch to JWT SSO, fill in the required information, and save changes.

instruction: What information is required to enable JWT SSO in Comm100?
output: To enable JWT SSO in Comm100, you need the remote login URL for your JWT service, the remote logout URL (optional), and the shared secret token generated when you enable JWT SSO. This information should be provided by your tech team responsible for the JWT authentication system.

instruction: How can you integrate Watson Assistant with Comm100?
output: To integrate Watson Assistant with Comm100, you need to follow these steps: 1. Get the API details of your Watson Assistant from your IBM Cloud account. 2. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Apps & Integrations, and add the IBM Watson Assistant using the obtained API details. 3. Create a Watson Chatbot in the Comm100 Control Panel by selecting the integrated Watson Assistant and configuring the chatbot settings.

instruction: What are some limitations of using Watson Chatbots in Comm100?
output: When using Watson Chatbots in Comm100, certain menus such as Intent, Entity, Learning, Event Messages, Canned Quick Replies, Booked Meetings, and Collected Lead are not applicable. Additionally, Watson Chatbots are not included in the corresponding Chatbot reports provided by Comm100. However, the Comm100 Smart Trigger feature can work with Watson Chatbots, although some conditions like Intent are not applicable. The Watson assistant's default inactivity timeout setting also applies when using a Watson chatbot in Comm100.

instruction: How can you enable Auto Translation for Ticketing & Messaging in Comm100?
output: To enable Auto Translation for Ticketing & Messaging in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Global Settings > Auto Translation, and turn on the Auto Translation for Ticketing & Messaging toggle key. You can choose to send either only the translation or both the original and translation when replying to a contact.

instruction: What steps should an agent follow to use Auto Translation for a ticket in the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: To use Auto Translation for a ticket in the Comm100 Agent Console, log in to the Agent Console, navigate to Preferences > Global, select the Auto-translate to check box in the Language tab, and choose a language from the drop-down list. If the contact is using a different language, click the Auto Translation icon in the reply area to enable Auto Translation and select the contact and agent language. The system will automatically translate the contact's messages into the agent's language.

instruction: How can you enable and customize the Pre-Chat window in Comm100?
output: To enable and customize the Pre-Chat window in Comm100, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to the Live Chat tab, select a campaign from the Campaign drop-down menu, go to the Pre-chat tab, and turn on the Pre-chat toggle key. Then, set the Title, define the Greeting Message, choose social login options if needed, set the Visible and Required fields, and click Save.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Pre-Chat window?
output: The Pre-Chat window is where visitors enter their information before initiating a chat request. It helps agents know more about visitors before accepting their chats.

instruction: What is the format of the data received when a 'Chat Ended' event occurs in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The data is in JSON format.

instruction: What are some of the key properties included in the 'Chat Ended' event data for a visitor?
output: Some key properties include the visitor's browser, chat ID, city, country, email, first visit time, IP address, language, name, operating system, and visit time.

instruction: How long does a visitor stay on the visitor list after leaving the site?
output: A visitor stays on the visitor list for about 1 minute in 'Out of site' status before disappearing from the Agent Console.

instruction: What is the delay time for a visitor's status to change after leaving the site?
output: The delay time for a visitor's status to change from 'In site'/'Chat ended' to 'Out of site' is about 3 minutes.

instruction: How can you mark words as entities in chatbot intent questions?
output: To mark words as entities in chatbot intent questions, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Chatbot > Intents, go to an existing intent or create a new one, add questions in the Questions section, select the part of the question to mark as an entity, and choose or create an entity from the Select entity drop-down list.

instruction: Why is it important to use entities in chatbot intents?
output: Using entities in chatbot intents helps the chatbot identify keywords within a phrase and provide context-relevant and useful answers to the visitor. For example, in a travel information chatbot, entities like locations and dates can be used to collect specific information and provide accurate responses.

instruction: Who is the Getting Started Guide for Live Chat Agents designed for?
output: This guide is designed for Live Chat agents and all those who use Live Chat to interact with their visitors on a day-to-day basis.

instruction: What are some key features of the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: The Comm100 Agent Console allows agents to handle chats from visitors, set their status, customize shortcuts and greetings, and set up notifications. It can be accessed via a PC browser, desktop app, or mobile app.

instruction: How does Auto Distribution work in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Auto distribution happens only on newly created tickets. Tickets are auto distributed to agents who have logged in to the Comm100 Agent Console. By default, the system distributes tickets to online agents only, but settings can be changed to include agents in Away or custom away statuses. Each ticket can only be auto-distributed once.

instruction: What are the auto distribution rules in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging follow two types of auto distribution rules—Load Balancing and Round Robin. Load balancing distributes tickets to the least loaded agent with the lowest capacity utilization rate, while Round Robin allocates tickets to agents one after the other based on the order they get online.

instruction: What is the 'Chat Wrapped Up' event in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks?
output: The 'Chat Wrapped Up' event in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks is an event that triggers a callback with specific properties when a chat session is concluded. The data is provided in JSON format.

instruction: What are some of the key visitor properties captured during a 'Chat Wrapped Up' event?
output: Some of the key visitor properties captured during a 'Chat Wrapped Up' event include the visitor's ID, name, email, status, phone, company, first visit time, visit time, city, state, country, IP address, language, screen resolution, time zone, flash version, operating system, browser, custom fields, product/service, department, skill, custom variables, current browsing page, total visits, total chats, referrer URL, search engine, keywords, landing page, and page views.

instruction: How can I delete an existing agent from my Comm100 account?
output: If you are a Site Administrator or have permission to manage agents, you can delete an existing agent from your Comm100 account by logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, clicking the 'People' drop-down in the 'Global Settings', and clicking the delete icon under the 'Operations' bar in the agents list.

instruction: What is a JSON Web Token (JWT) and how is it used in secure messaging?
output: JSON Web Token (JWT) is an open standard used in sharing information securely between a client and a server as a JSON object. It is an encoded JSON composed of three string segments—Header, Payload, and Signature concatenated with periods. JWTs are generally signed with a private key when they are generated and then validated with a public key upon receipt to verify that the token hasn’t been modified in transit. To use Secure Messaging, you must authorize a contact by sharing a JWT with Comm100 and set up a validation method in the Secure Messaging Security configuration.

instruction: What are the validation methods supported by Comm100 for JWT?
output: Comm100 supports three validation methods for JWT: Public Key, JSON Web Key Set (JWKS), and Shared Token.

instruction: What is a campaign in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: A campaign is a set of configurations that define the style of your chat button and visitor side windows. One campaign has its specific live chat code.

instruction: How can you benefit from using multiple campaigns in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: With Comm100 Live Chat, you can put a chat button onto multiple webpages by installing the same live chat code onto all your webpages. If you want to put buttons of different looks onto different websites/webpages, you need to create multiple campaigns and then add different codes of the campaigns to the corresponding websites or webpages.

instruction: How can you add Comm100 Live Chat to a WordPress site using the Comm100 Live Chat WordPress plugin?
output: To add Comm100 Live Chat to a WordPress site using the Comm100 Live Chat WordPress plugin, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your WordPress account. 2. Go to the Plugins menu and click Add New. 3. Type 'Comm100' in the search bar to find the Comm100 Live Chat & Chatbot plugin. 4. Click 'Install Now' to install the plugin. 5. Click 'Activate' to activate the plugin. 6. Go to Plugins > Installed Plugins and search for the Comm100 Live Chat – Chat Plugin for WordPress plugin. 7. Click 'Settings' and follow the instructions to connect your Comm100 account to WordPress and activate Live Chat on your site.

instruction: How can you manually insert the Comm100 Live Chat code into a WordPress site?
output: To manually insert the Comm100 Live Chat code into a WordPress site, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your WordPress account. 2. In your WordPress admin area, go to the Plugins menu and click Add New. 3. In the Add Plugins page, type 'Insert Headers and Footers' in the search bar. 4. Click 'Install Now' next to the plugin and then click 'Activate'. 5. From the Settings menu, click 'Insert Headers and Footers'. 6. Paste the Comm100 Live Chat code into the 'Scripts in Footer' box. 7. Click 'Save'.

instruction: How can you insert an image into an email reply using Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To insert an image into an email reply using Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, follow these steps: 1. Go to the Ticketing & Messaging tab of the Agent Console. 2. Click the expand icon in your reply field. 3. Click the Image icon. 4. Choose the option to insert your image. You can either upload an image from your computer or insert an image from a URL. The image will appear in the replying area after being inserted successfully. Note that the size of an uploaded local image cannot be greater than 20 MB, and supported file formats include JPG, JPEG, BMP, PNG, GIF, WEBP, ICO. Optionally, you can add a hyperlink to the image by clicking the Insert/Edit Link icon.

instruction: What is the purpose of Voice Bot Sentiment Analysis?
output: Voice Bot Sentiment Analysis analyzes callers' emotions during the conversation with the Voice Bot, helping you to understand how your Voice Bot performs and where it can be improved to enhance customer satisfaction.

instruction: How can you enable and adjust Sentiment Analysis for a Voice Bot?
output: To use Sentiment Analysis, you need to enable this feature for your Voice Bot from the Advanced drop-down option on the Edit Voice Bot page. After enabling Sentiment Analysis, you can adjust the sentiment score settings.

instruction: What is an @mention in Comm100?
output: In Ticketing & Messaging, an @mention allows an agent to notify and involve another agent into a ticket. The @mentioned agent can view, edit, and reply to the ticket regardless of permissions.

instruction: What is the role of an administrator in Comm100?
output: An administrator has all permissions over the Comm100 system, including setting up different channels, creating agents, and assigning roles. The first user registered within a site is the site administrator by default.

instruction: How can I customize my chat button in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: With Comm100 Live Chat, you can customize the type, color, icon, text, and position of your chat button. Comm100 provides three types of chat buttons: Adaptive, Image, and Text Link. You can also hide or show your chat button based on conditions such as when your team is offline or on specified domains or URLs.

instruction: What are the steps to customize the chat button in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To customize your chat button, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Button. 3. Choose Adaptive, Image, or Text link as your button type. 4. Complete the color, position, and other settings for your chat button. 5. (Optional) To hide your chat button when your team is offline or on some of your webpages, expand the Advanced menu and complete your settings. 6. Click Save.

instruction: How can I check the audit log of my site?
output: To check the audit log of your site, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Global Settings > Security > Audit Log, adjust the time range, select the application and agent, or enter detailed keywords. The query result will then show in the list.

instruction: How can agents manage visitors on the Agent Console using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Agents can manage visitors on the Agent Console by monitoring visitors, filtering the visitor list, editing visitor information, inviting on-site visitors to chat, and banning visitors from initiating chats.

instruction: What are the different ways agents can filter the visitor list on the Agent Console?
output: Agents can filter the visitor list by choosing the All Visitors, All Chats, My Chats tabs, or using Custom Filter to create their own rules based on various visitor data such as Status, Segment, Campaign, Agents, Department, Product/Service, Auto Invitation, Country/Region, City, and State.

instruction: How can visitors search Knowledge Base articles within the chat window before chatting?
output: If you allow your visitors to search for knowledge base articles before chatting or submitting an offline message, a window with a search box will be displayed. Once visitors enter keywords in the search box and click the Search icon or press the Enter key, articles with highlighted keywords will be listed. After a visitor clicks on the article title, the article will be opened in a new extended window on the left-hand side of the chat window.

instruction: How can agents search Knowledge Base articles within the Agent Console during chats?
output: When the integration is enabled, a Knowledge Base tab appears under the Help Content tab. Agents can then search for articles using keywords. Agents can send URLs of knowledge base articles straight to visitors as messages, and they can also insert the URL to the text input area to edit it further. Agents can click on article titles to show the article details right under the KB tab. They can copy any sentences or images from the article, paste them into the text input box, and send them to visitors. Send URL and Insert URL is also available at the bottom of the article.

instruction: What are the advantages of the Comm100 Bot-to-Bot Transfer feature?
output: The Bot-to-Bot transfer feature allows you to transfer a chat from a Chatbot in one department to a Chatbot in another department, and it enables chat handling when no human agents are available. For example, if a chat lands with a sales Chatbot but is a support query, it can be transferred to a support Chatbot. Additionally, if agents log off after their shifts, the Chatbot can handle incoming chats.

instruction: How can you implement the Bot-to-Bot transfer feature in Comm100?
output: To implement the Bot-to-Bot transfer feature, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot (or Task Bot if using a Task Bot). 3. Select your Chatbot from the drop-down list. 4. Go to Bot > Chatbot > Intents and click New Intents (or edit existing Intents). 5. On the New Intent page, scroll down to the Answers section. 6. Expand the Action menu and drag the Transfer chat action card to the Answers flow builder area. 7. Select the 'to chatbot' option from the Transfer drop-down list and choose the Chatbot. 8. Click Save. The new Chatbot will launch with its Greetings Messages when a transfer happens.

instruction: How can I add my accounts to Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Comm100 allows you to connect with your email, SMS, and Social accounts. You can add your email, SMS, WhatsApp, Telegram, Signal, LINE, WeChat, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram channel accounts to Comm100. Comm100 also provides Messenger and Secure Messaging channels for asynchronous messaging services. You can choose to integrate your existing accounts with Comm100 or use services provided by Comm100.

instruction: What types of accounts can be integrated with Comm100?
output: You can integrate email, SMS, WhatsApp, Telegram, Signal, LINE, WeChat, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and Secure Messaging accounts with Comm100.

instruction: How can you track Live Chat events in Google Analytics 4 using Google Tag Manager?
output: To track Live Chat events in Google Analytics 4 using Google Tag Manager, you need to add the Live Chat event code to the Comm100 Live Chat Tag, create a trigger for the Live Chat event, and create a tag for the Google Analytics 4 event.

instruction: What are the steps to create a tag for the Google Analytics 4 event in Google Tag Manager?
output: To create a tag for the Google Analytics 4 event in Google Tag Manager, log in to your GTM account, navigate to Workspace > Tags, click New, give the tag a name, choose Google Analytics: GA4 Event as the type, complete the settings by entering the measurement ID and event name, choose the trigger you created, and then save and publish the changes.

instruction: How can I view my chat history in the Comm100 control panel?
output: All your chat conversations are stored in our database. You can check all the records or search for a particular chat record on your Comm100 account control panel. Log in to your Comm100 control panel, go to Live Chat > History > Chats. On the Chats page, you will see a list of records. To view the detailed chat transcript, choose a certain record and click the Details icon.

instruction: What options are available to filter or locate a specific chat transcript in Comm100?
output: You can filter or locate a specific chat transcript by selecting the date or duration of the chat and selecting the Department, Agent, Segment from their corresponding drop-down list. You can also enter specific keywords of the chat content in the Keywords search bar. Under the New Filter option, there are more filters to choose from.

instruction: What is NPS and how is it calculated?
output: NPS (Net Promoter Score) is an industry standard for measuring customer loyalty and indicates how likely your customers are to recommend your product or services to others. The score is calculated by taking the percentage of promoters and subtracting the percentage of detractors.

instruction: What are some strategies to improve NPS?
output: To improve NPS, consider creating a cross-departmental team, improving your products and services, creating a plan of action to address customer feedback, reaching out to specific customer lists, and regularly analyzing customer feedback to make continuous improvements.

instruction: What are the main steps to set up a WhatsApp Business Account on Comm100?
output: The setup consists of the following steps: 1. Create App on Meta for Developers, 2. Associate a Business Manager Account, 3. Generate a Permanent Token, 4. Set Up a Webhook.

instruction: How do you create an app on Meta for Developers?
output: To create an app, follow these steps: 1. Register as a Meta Developer, 2. (Optional) Enable two-factor authentication for your account, 3. Go to developers.facebook.com > Apps > Create App, 4. Choose an app type as Business, 5. Enter the name of your app and an email address for notifications, 6. Select or create a WhatsApp Business Manager account, 7. Click Create App.

instruction: What are the benefits of using entities in chatbots?
output: The prime benefits of using entities are: They provide more context to intents, help the bot to give the right actions or information to answer the visitor’s question, add synonyms to keywords, add business-specific jargon to the chatbot, and in some cases, the bot needs to know entity information to provide useful answers to the visitor.

instruction: How can you create a new entity in Comm100?
output: To create a new entity in Comm100, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Bot > Chatbot. 3. Select your chatbot from the drop-down list and click Entities. 4. On the Entities page, click New Entity. 5. On the New Chatbot Entity page, type a name of an entity (without spaces). 6. In the Keywords section, type a keyword and its synonym, then click Enter. 7. Click Save.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Password Policy feature in Comm100?
output: The Password Policy feature in Comm100 is designed to enhance account security by setting up password strength rules that all Comm100 accounts must conform to.

instruction: What are some of the default settings and requirements of the Comm100 Password Policy?
output: Some default settings and requirements include: passwords must have at least 8 characters, require three of the four types of characters (uppercase, lowercase, numeric, and special), prevent the use of agent names and commonly used password phrases, and lock accounts after 5 failed login attempts.

instruction: How can you configure the Agent Console settings?
output: To configure the Agent Console settings, log in to the Agent Console, hover over Preferences, and click Live Chat. From there, you can adjust shortcuts, notifications, automated greetings, auto-translation, and more.

instruction: What options are available under the Language tab in the Agent Console settings?
output: Under the Language tab, you can set the text direction, enable spell check, and configure auto-translation to translate chat messages in real-time.

instruction: Can I customize the look of my knowledge base?
output: Absolutely! Comm100 Knowledge Base allows you to completely customize the CSS code of your knowledge base and the designs of the following pages: Category Page, Article Page, Search Results Page, and 404 Page (Page Not Found).

instruction: What are the types of Views available in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: In Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, Views are categorized into two types: System Views and Custom Views. System Views are default Public Views available to all agents in a specific group, while Custom Views can be created by agents and organized into meaningful categories.

instruction: What actions can be performed on Views in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: In Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, you can manage Views by creating, sorting, editing, and deleting them. These actions can be performed from the Manage Views popup.

instruction: What are Smart Triggers in a chatbot?
output: Smart triggers are the instructions for the chatbot to perform certain actions based on pre-defined conditions. They allow you to define rules for specific actions to be executed automatically, such as forwarding the chat to a live agent when certain conditions are met.

instruction: How can you configure Smart Triggers in the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To configure Smart Triggers, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Chatbot > Smart Triggers, click on New Smart Trigger, enable the trigger, enter the trigger name, set conditions, choose actions, and then save the trigger.

instruction: How can you integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Google Analytics?
output: To integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Google Analytics, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Integrations & API, navigate to Google Analytics, and click Settings. Turn on the Google Analytics Integration toggle key, ensuring that both the Comm100 Live Chat code and Google Analytics tracking code are installed on your website, with the Google Analytics tracking code placed before the Live Chat code.

instruction: What types of live chat data can you track in Google Analytics with Comm100 integration?
output: With Comm100 Live Chat Google Analytics Integration, you can track events such as Pre-chat (number of times pre-chat forms are opened), Chat (number of times chat requests are initiated), Offline Message (number of times offline message forms are opened), Invitation (number of times chat invitations popped up), Online Button Click (number of times visitors click on the chat button when online), Offline Button Click (number of times visitors click on the chat button when offline), and Post-chat (number of times post-chat surveys are opened).

instruction: What is the format of the data received when a 'Chat Started' event occurs in Comm100 Live Chat Webhooks?
output: The data is in JSON format.

instruction: What are some of the key properties included in the 'Chat Started' event data for a visitor?
output: Some key properties include visitor's browser, chat_id, city, country, email, first_visit_time, ip, language, name, operating_system, page_views, state, status, time_zone, visit_time, visits, and more.

instruction: How can you block contact identities in the Comm100 Control Panel?
output: To block contact identities in the Comm100 Control Panel, log in to the Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Settings > Blocked Senders, and follow the instructions to add a new blocked sender by selecting the channel and providing the contact identity details. You can set the block level to either mark future messages as junk or reject all future messages.

instruction: What are the steps to block contact identities in the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: To block contact identities in the Comm100 Agent Console, log in to the Agent Console, navigate to the Ticketing & Messaging tab, select a ticket, click the drop-down list icon next to the Resolve/Close button, and select Block Sender. On the Block Sender pop-up, select the sender's contact identity, choose the block level, and click OK.

instruction: How can I customize my chat window?
output: To customize your chat window, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to the Live Chat tab, select a campaign from the Campaign drop-down list, and go to Chat Window. You can choose a color, set the chat window's Header, choose the chat window's Style (Classic, Circle, or Bubble), change window Type (Popup or Embedded Chat Window), change the chat window Background, and edit Window Title. You can also use your own CSS, adjust options for visitors, and set advanced options. Click Save to apply the changes.

instruction: What customization options are available for the chat window?
output: You can choose a color for the window, set the chat window's Header, choose the chat window's Style (Classic, Circle, or Bubble), change window Type (Popup or Embedded Chat Window), change the chat window Background, and edit Window Title. You can also use the Customize Style with Your Own CSS option, adjust options for visitors, and set advanced options such as ending the chat automatically when the visitor doesn't respond, sending the chat transcript over email, limiting the chat queue length, or adding custom Javascript to the chat window.

instruction: How can you install the Comm100 Live Chat extension on a Magento site?
output: You can install the Comm100 Live Chat extension on a Magento site by visiting the Comm100 Live Chat page on Magento Marketplace, purchasing the app, and then installing it using Composer commands in the Magento admin panel. After installation, activate the extension by navigating to System > Extension > Integrations and clicking Activate.

instruction: How do you connect an existing Comm100 Live Chat account to a Magento store?
output: To connect an existing Comm100 Live Chat account to a Magento store, navigate to STORES > Configuration > Comm100 Live Chat > Settings in the Magento admin panel. Enter your Comm100 Live Chat account email and password, click Connect, select a campaign from your Comm100 account, and click Get Online & Chat to start chatting with visitors.

instruction: What is a trigger in Comm100's Ticketing & Messaging platform?
output: A trigger is a feature within Comm100's Ticketing & Messaging platform that allows you to automatically update your tickets or send follow-up emails based on predefined conditions.

instruction: What actions can be set when creating triggers in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: When creating triggers in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, you can set actions such as setting a value, sending an email, or triggering a webhook.

instruction: How can you customize the Messenger Launcher?
