output: To customize the Messenger launcher, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Messenger, click the Messenger link or Edit icon, go to the Messenger Launcher tab, choose the color and position for Desktop and Mobile views, preview the changes, and click Save.

instruction: What types of actions can Comm100 Chatbot perform?
output: Comm100 Chatbot can perform actions such as sending content (messages, images, videos), collecting information (name, email, phone number), and performing flow operations (conditions, transferring chat, contacting an agent).

instruction: What are the main functionalities of Comm100 Voice Bot?
output: Comm100 Voice Bot can perform actions such as playing messages and audio, sending SMS, collecting information (DTMF digits, speech response), recording calls, and performing flow operations (conditions, transferring calls, ending calls).

instruction: How do you enable Co-browsing in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To enable Co-browsing, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to Live Chat > Settings > Co-browsing, turn ON the Co-browsing toggle key, customize system messages if needed, and click Save.

instruction: What are the steps to start a Co-browsing session in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To start a Co-browsing session, log in to your Agent Console, click the Co-browsing button in the Replying area of the Conversation pane, wait for the visitor to accept the request, and then you can view and interact with the visitor's web screen.

instruction: How can I monitor my visitors using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: With Comm100 Live Chat, you can have a 360-degree view of your on-site visitors by viewing their detailed information and tracking their activities. You can get visitors' information such as location and chat history even before chatting. The visitors' information shows on your agent console, and the Visitors tab shows a list of the visitors currently on your websites, and the total number of visitors and visitors waiting for a chat.

instruction: What kind of visitor information can be viewed in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The visitor information includes status, location info, identity info, visitor segment, agents involved in the chat, current page, referred URL, total number of visits, total number of chats, ticket ID, department, product/service, search engine used, keywords, landing page, auto invitation rule, campaign, visit time, current page browsing time, wait time, chat time, total time spent on the website, time zone, city, state, country/region, and the number of pages viewed.

instruction: How do I fix Network Errors with Comm100?
output: This question addresses common network issues that users may encounter with Comm100 and provides guidance on how to resolve them.

instruction: Why can't my visitors see the chat button on my website?
output: This question focuses on visibility issues of the chat button, which is crucial for user interaction on the website.

instruction: Why are chat transcripts not being delivered to my email inbox?
output: This question deals with the delivery of chat transcripts, which is important for record-keeping and follow-up.

instruction: Why aren't the changes I'm making in Comm100 reflected on my website?
output: This question addresses customization issues, ensuring that users can effectively implement changes on their website.

instruction: How can you add Comm100 Live Chat to an AmeriCommerce store?
output: To add Comm100 Live Chat to an AmeriCommerce store, follow these steps: 1. Log into your AmeriCommerce Admin page. 2. Click 'Themes' on the left menu bar, find 'Edit' on your page and click it. 3. Choose 'Footer' and then 'Widgets', find the 'Bottom' part on your page and click the editor icon. 4. Go to 'Widget Settings', click the '</>' icon and then paste the live chat code into the HTML source code panel. 5. Click 'Save'. After completing these steps, a live chat button will show on your website, allowing visitors to chat with you.

instruction: Where do you paste the live chat code in the AmeriCommerce store settings?
output: You paste the live chat code into the HTML source code panel in the 'Widget Settings' section.

instruction: What is the scope of the Trojan infection incident in the Comm100 Agent Console Windows Desktop App?
output: This vulnerability incident has limited scope to Agent Console Windows Desktop App users who used Comm100 Agent Console Windows Desktop App with version 10.0.8 from 11 PM PT, Sep 27th, 2022 to 8 AM PT, Sep 29th, 2022.

instruction: What are the steps to remove the Trojan from the Comm100 Agent Console Windows Desktop App version 10.0.8?
output: To remove the Trojan, follow these steps: 1. Upgrade to the latest version (10.0.9). 2. Close and end the notepad.exe process in Task Manager. 3. Purge specific folders from your system. 4. Check and delete a specific Windows registry entry. 5. Perform a full scan using antivirus software. 6. Restart your Windows. 7. Confirm no notepad.exe process is running. 8. Perform another full scan using antivirus software.

instruction: How do I set up SMS Integration using Twilio in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To set up SMS integration using Twilio in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Comm100 control panel. 2. From the left navigation menu, go to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > SMS. 3. Click Add Phone Number and choose Twilio from the drop-down list. 4. Turn on the Enable toggle key and enter the details in the Name field, Twilio account SID, Auth token, and Phone number SID. 5. Click Save. The phone number is added. You can continue to add more phone numbers if you have more than one you want to manage using Comm100.

instruction: How do I send and receive SMS messages using the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: Once you set up your SMS integration, log into the Comm100 Agent Console and navigate to the SMS view available under Ticketing & Messaging. Here you can find all SMS messages sent to your integrated phone numbers. Agents can respond to these messages in the same way as they do Social conversations. Just type out your responses in the typing field and hit send! These messages will send as SMS responses to your customers. All inbound SMS messages contain user information that allows you to view the phone number’s location and zip code.

instruction: What is a concierge bot?
output: A concierge bot is an artificial intelligence (AI)-based conversational interface that routes visitors' inquiries before a human agent is needed, allowing for round-the-clock engagement and faster, more personal support at scale.

instruction: What are the main functionalities of a concierge bot?
output: The main functionalities of a concierge bot include sending content (such as messages and quick replies), performing flow operations (like transferring chats to agents, departments, or other bots), and collecting visitor information (such as name, email, and comments) when no agent is available.

instruction: What are the advantages and disadvantages of using Agent SSO in Comm100?
output: Advantages of Agent SSO include improved agent work efficiency, enhanced security by minimizing points of attack, and simplified agent access control. Disadvantages include potential compatibility issues during implementation, the risk of a single point of failure, and inconvenience for agents using shared devices.

instruction: How does Visitor SSO enhance the user experience in Comm100?
output: Visitor SSO simplifies the visitor login experience by allowing shared login between Comm100 Live Chat and your system, provides a smoother and more personalized chat service by passing visitor data to agents, and routes visitors to the most appropriate agent based on their information.

instruction: How can I design my own ticket signature in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To design your own ticket signature in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, log in to your Agent Console, go to Preferences, click on Ticketing & Messaging, then click the Email Signature tab and edit the content of your signature. Click OK to save your signature. This signature will be automatically attached to each of your ticket messages.

instruction: How can I view a visitor's contact history in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: You can view a visitor's contact history in Comm100 Live Chat by using the Agent Console or the Live Chat Control Panel. In the Agent Console, you can select a visitor from the Visitor List, click Details, and then select History to see a list of records about each interaction of the selected visitor in every channel.

instruction: What are the steps to view a visitor's contact history in the Agent Console?
output: 1. Select a visitor in the Visitor List and click Details. 2. Select History to see a list of records about each interaction of the selected visitor in every channel. 3. Click the chat link to bring up the details. 4. You can also check the history of a chatting visitor from the History tab of the agent console.

instruction: What are the prerequisites for connecting an Instagram Professional account to a Facebook Page?
output: Connecting your Instagram Professional account to a Facebook Page is a prerequisite of the Instagram integration with Comm100. You need to have an Instagram Professional account set up.

instruction: How can you connect your Instagram Professional account to a Facebook Page?
output: To connect your Instagram Professional account to a Facebook Page, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your Facebook account. 2. Click the Nine Square icon and go to Pages. 3. Select a Facebook Page. 4. From the Manage Page navigation menu, select Settings. 5. On the Page settings menu, go to Instagram and click Connect Account. 6. On the pop-up, turn on the Allow access to Instagram messages in Inbox toggle key. 7. Click Continue. 8. Provide the Instagram login credentials and click Log In. Your Instagram account is successfully connected with your Facebook Page.

instruction: Why isn't my pre-chat survey displaying to my site visitors?
output: The pre-chat survey might not be displaying because it is not enabled for the campaign you are using on your website, or it is enabled for a different campaign. To resolve this, log in to the Comm100 account, go to Live Chat > Campaign, select your campaign, go to Pre-Chat, turn on the Pre-chat toggle key, select the fields you want your visitors to fill in, mark them visible and required, and then click Save.

instruction: What is Chatbot Sentiment Analysis?
output: Chatbot Sentiment Analysis analyzes every message your visitors send during the conversation with your Chatbot and provides you with a sentiment to understand how your Chatbot performs and where it can be improved. Sentiment scores range from -10 to 10 and can be manually adjusted. The sentiment types are Very positive, Positive, Neutral, Negative, and Very negative.

instruction: What are the benefits of Chatbot Sentiment Analysis?
output: The benefits of Chatbot Sentiment Analysis include making the Chatbot engage better with visitors and improving their experience with your brand, viewing the sentiment level for each visitor utterance to let the Chatbot drive the flow of conversation in tune with the visitor’s sentiment, and improving the Chatbot’s Intent library by checking chat transcripts if a Negative or Very negative sentiment is noticed.

instruction: What are some best practices for managing live chat queues?
output: Some best practices for managing live chat queues include striking a balance between customer wait time and internal resources, creating an effective balance between problem-solving and upselling, creating queues for different products and services, establishing queue priorities for different customers, keeping visitors informed about queue statuses, using canned messages to shorten queues, using expert agents effectively, and optimizing staff scheduling with reports and metrics.

instruction: How can you optimize staff scheduling for live chat queues?
output: To optimize staff scheduling for live chat queues, it is critical to keep track of relevant metrics. This helps create effective staffing schedules by understanding which agents perform best at which times and how many agents are needed to keep queue wait times low. By studying live chat metrics, you can identify patterns in chat volumes at different intervals and adjust staffing accordingly.

instruction: How do you create a conversion action in Comm100's Live Chat Conversion feature?
output: To create a conversion action, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, go to the Live Chat tab, navigate to Conversions in the Settings drop-down menu, and click New Conversion Action. Define a name for the conversion action, enable it, and set up the conversion actions by choosing from URL, Custom variable, and API. Optionally, assign a value to the conversion action and configure additional settings in the Advanced drop-down menu. Finally, click Save.

instruction: What metrics are included in the Comm100 Conversion Report?
output: The Conversion Report includes the following metrics: Conversions, Chats, Chatted Visitors, Converted Visitors, Converted Chatted Visitors, Conv. Rate of Chatted Visitors, and Value.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging Webhook?
output: The purpose of the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging Webhook is to check the message sent by an agent for compliance by sending the message body to an external API, which either approves or rejects the message. On approval, the message is sent to a contact or visitor, and on rejection, the message remains in the replying area with a rejection reason on the Comm100 Agent Console.

instruction: What are the two ways to send a Webhook Post Body request?
output: The two ways to send a Webhook Post Body request are: 1) Default Webhook Post Body, which sends the complete Webhook Post body including the additional post body JSON, and 2) Only Additional Post Body, which sends only the Additional Post Body JSON.

instruction: What are the main features of Comm100 Live Chat's advanced chat routing?
output: Comm100 Live Chat provides advanced chat routing features that allow you to efficiently route customers to designated departments or agents based on customer location, source, navigation history, and other system fields. You can also use data captured from Pre-Chat surveys or Custom Variables.

instruction: What are some scenarios where chat routing can be applied in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Chat routing in Comm100 Live Chat can be applied in scenarios such as routing chats to account managers, routing by support tiers, routing by geographic location, and routing by skill groups.

instruction: How can you remove the 'Powered by Comm100' text from the chat window?
output: To remove the 'Powered by Comm100' text from the chat window, log in to the Comm100 control panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window, expand the Options for Visitors area, select the 'Remove "Powered by Comm100" in Chat Window' checkbox, and click Save. Note that this option is not available in the Live Chat Startup plan.

instruction: Can I change the text font of my chat link?
output: Yes. To change the text font (for example, color, size, family, and more) of your chat link (a chat button with Text Link type), you need to manually modify your live chat code before you paste it onto your website. You only need to add the style attribute style="font-weight:bold; font-family:verdana; font-size:20px; color:#339999;" after.

instruction: What is the purpose of the webhook event 'When a Ticket Status Stays the Same for a Specified Period of Time'?
output: The webhook event 'When a Ticket Status Stays the Same for a Specified Period of Time' triggers a callback with specific properties when a ticket's status remains unchanged for a defined period.

instruction: What format is the data in when the 'When a Ticket Status Stays the Same for a Specified Period of Time' event occurs?
output: The data is in JSON format.

instruction: What is Cross-Site Chat Transfer in Comm100?
output: Cross-Site Chat Transfer ensures that chats can be transferred from one Comm100 site to another while keeping the data and configurations of each site separate. Agents can transfer the chat to agents from another site as long as the sites are in the same cross-site chat transfer group.

instruction: How can agents transfer a chat to another site in Comm100?
output: To transfer a chat to agents of another site, agents need to click the 'Transfer the chat to another agent or department' icon on the Conversation panel, choose the target site for the chat transfer from the drop-down list, select the appropriate department or agent, and click 'Transfer'. The chat is then successfully transferred to the target site agent.

instruction: What is Secure Messaging and how does it work?
output: Secure Messaging is a front-end and server-based approach to enable end-to-end secure communication with your clients and protect sensitive data. It allows clients to start confidential and authenticated exchanges from any part of the world. Once installed, it does not need any future code updates, and messages and attachments are not stored or cached on the compliant server.

instruction: How can you manage Secure Messenger in the Control Panel?
output: In the Control Panel, you can manage Secure Messenger by performing operations such as Edit, Install Code, Copy, Rename, and Delete. You can also enable or disable any Secure Messenger and configure Routing Rules, Triggers, and SLAs. Additionally, you can enable Credit Card Masking in Global Settings Security to mask credit card numbers in Secure Messaging tickets for agents.

instruction: How is the estimated wait time calculated for visitors in the chat queue?
output: The estimated wait time is calculated using the formula: Estimated Wait Time = ([(N-1)/X] +1) * Average Chat Time of Most Recent 100 Chats. Here, N is the position in the queue, and X is the max concurrent chat number.

instruction: What factors influence the estimated wait time in the chat queue?
output: The estimated wait time is influenced by the position in the queue (N), the max concurrent chat number (X), and the average chat time of the most recent 100 chats. The max concurrent chat number can vary based on site, department, or individual agent settings.

instruction: How can you obtain an OAuth Access Token using Postman?
output: To obtain an OAuth Access Token using Postman, follow these steps: 1. Log in to Postman. 2. Go to Home > Create New > HTTP Request. 3. Select the POST method and provide the URL, which should start with your platform domain followed by the curl command. 4. Go to Body > x-www-form-urlencoded tab. 5. Input the required Keys and their Values (email, password, grant_type, client_id). 6. Click Send. You will get the OAuth Access Token to call APIs.

instruction: How do you use an OAuth Access Token to call an API in Postman?
output: To use an OAuth Access Token to call an API in Postman, follow these steps: 1. Select the GET method and provide the API request URL. 2. Go to the Authorization tab and choose the authentication type as OAuth 2.0. 3. Paste the OAuth Access Token in the Access Token field. 4. Ensure that the Header Prefix field is Bearer. 5. Click Send. You will get the response data successfully.

instruction: What is the default behavior of inline images in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: By default, every inline image, including the ones in the quote of the email ticket message, appears as a link in the email body. If you trust the contact, you can choose to show the image inline.

instruction: How can an agent choose to show an inline image in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: An agent can choose to show the inline images within the message by selecting the Show Image icon against the image link. The image link is then removed and replaced with an inline image.

instruction: What are some best practices for naming a Task Bot?
output: When naming a Task Bot, ensure the name is short and simple, easy to pronounce and spell, creative and memorable, without negative connotations, in line with your brand, and culturally and politically acceptable.

instruction: How can Task Bots be used to enhance customer service?
output: Task Bots can enhance customer service by automating basic actions such as collecting leads, booking meetings, routing chats, and reducing wait times. They can also handle pre-chat and offline messages, provide personalized customer service, and trigger webhooks to interact with external servers or third-party services.

instruction: How do I set up SMS integration using Telnyx in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: To set up SMS integration using Telnyx in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging, log in to your Comm100 control panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > SMS, click 'Add Phone Number' and choose 'Telnyx' from the drop-down list. Enter the Telnyx account name, enable the toggle key, and enter the API Key and Phone number. Save the settings, then log in to your Telnyx account, go to Numbers, and select the messaging profile from the drop-down list against the given number.

instruction: How can I send and receive SMS messages using the Comm100 Agent Console?
output: Once SMS integration is set up, log into the Comm100 Agent Console and navigate to the Ticketing & Messaging tab. You can find all SMS messages sent to your integrated phone numbers and create views exclusively for SMS-related conversations. Agents can respond to these messages by typing responses in the Reply field and clicking Send. These messages are sent as SMS responses to customers.

instruction: How can agents set up Live Chat Wrap-Up in Comm100?
output: Agents can set up Live Chat Wrap-Up in Comm100 by logging into the Comm100 Control Panel, navigating to Live Chat > Campaign > Agent Wrap-up, and using the default system fields or adding new fields as needed. Each field can be set as Visible or Required or both.

instruction: How can the Category system field be edited in Comm100?
output: The Category system field can be edited in Comm100 by clicking the Pencil icon on the Agent Wrap-up page, then choosing either Basic mode or Advanced mode to provide field options. These options will appear on the Agent Console's Wrap-up tab as Category options or checkboxes.

instruction: Can I use Comm100 Live Chat on multiple websites with one account?
output: Yes, you can use Comm100 Live Chat on multiple websites simultaneously with one account. All you need to do is copy the code and then paste it onto the websites.

instruction: How can I customize chat buttons for different websites using Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To have different style chat buttons, you need to enable the Multiple Campaigns feature. You can customize each campaign according to your website's style.

instruction: What is the purpose of using third-party services by Comm100?
output: To provide secure and stable Live Chat service, prevent platforms from DDoS attacks, and process Personal Data to make these third-party services work.

instruction: Can you list some of the sub-processors used by Comm100 and their purposes?
output: Google (Android App Push Notification Service, Translate Service, Dialogflow - AI Engine), Apple (iOS App Push Notification Service), Xirsys (Audio/Video Chat), Glance (Co-Browsing), AWS (Data Hosting), Azure (Data Hosting), Twilio (Audio & Video Chat).

instruction: How do you integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Prestashop version 1.7 or above?
output: To integrate Comm100 Live Chat with Prestashop version 1.7 or above, follow these steps: 1. Log in to your PrestaShop admin dashboard. 2. Hover over Modules and click Modules and Services. 3. Click Upload a module to install the module you’ve downloaded. 4. Go to Shop Parameters, then General. 5. Turn off Use HTML Purifier Library, and Save changes. 6. Go back to the HTML box module you’ve installed, and click Configure. 7. Choose a footer from Where you want to display the content box. 8. Click Switch editor to use plain text format. 9. Paste Comm100 Live Chat JavaScript code, Save Settings. 10. The Chat Button now shows up on your website.

instruction: How do you integrate Comm100 Live Chat with an older version of Prestashop?
output: To integrate Comm100 Live Chat with an older version of Prestashop, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the site where your PrestaShop site is hosted using a standard FTP client or the Cpanel File manager. 2. Go to ROOT Directory of Prestashop. 3. Find footer.tpl under Prestashop\themes\default-bootstrap. 4. Open footer.tpl with an editor like Notepad. Copy and paste your Comm100 Live Chat Code before the tag at the bottom of the window. 5. Type {literal} before the first line and type {\literal} after the last line, to make sure the Prestashop template engine will not evaluate it. 6. Click Save as, input footer.tpl as the file name, and save it onto your PC. 7. Upload your newly created footer.tpl to your server and replace the old one. After that, you will see a chat button showing on your Prestashop site. If you still cannot see the chat button, you probably enabled PrestaShop’s Smarty Cache. Go to your Prestashop Control Panel, then Preferences, and then Performance. Set Force Compile to ‘Yes’ and ‘Cache’ to ‘No’. Save your settings, refresh your website, and the Comm100 Live Chat button should be there. Go back to your Preferences and turn Force Compile and Cache back to their former settings to keep your site loading fast.

instruction: How can you limit agents' access to a Comm100 account?
output: You can limit agents' access to a Comm100 account by using an IP allowlist. This restricts access to a set of trusted IP addresses, ensuring that only logins from these IPs are accepted, thus reducing the risk of information leaks.

instruction: What steps are involved in adding authorized IP addresses to the Comm100 IP allowlist?
output: To add authorized IP addresses to the Comm100 IP allowlist, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the Comm100 Control Panel with an account that has the Manage Security permission. 2. Go to Global Settings > Security > IP Allowlist. 3. Turn on the IP Allowlist toggle key. 4. Under the Allowed IP List tab, click New IP Range and input the Start IP and End IP. 5. Optionally, to enable IP allowlist for access from the Comm100 mobile app, turn on the IP Allowlist for mobile access toggle key under the Advanced tab.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Shift feature in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: The Shift feature in Comm100 Live Chat helps you stay online and on time for your customers by allowing you to build and maintain live chat agent schedules, create multiple shifts per agent and department, and manage your team's availability.

instruction: How can you manage notifications for shift changes in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To manage notifications for shift changes, go to Preferences > Live Chat > Notification in the Agent Console and enable the Shift Started and Shift Ended notifications. You will receive notifications based on your status when shifts start or end.

instruction: Can I automatically send a pre-defined message after a chat request is accepted?
output: Yes, you can set up a pre-defined and personalized message which is sent to the visitor once a chat is started. Each agent can customize their own auto greeting message.

instruction: What are canned messages and how are they used?
output: Canned Messages are pre-defined messages used for easy re-use and access in the future. They are usually created for greetings, frequently asked questions, and more. During a chat, an agent can send canned messages to visitors quickly by using shortcuts.

instruction: How can you create, import, and export canned messages in Comm100?
output: To create a canned message, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Global Settings > Canned Messages, and click New Canned Message. To import canned messages, download the template, edit it with your canned responses, and upload it. To export canned messages, navigate to Global Settings > Canned Messages, choose the file format, and click Export.

instruction: How do you use the @Mentions feature in the Comm100 Ticket system?
output: To use the @Mentions feature in the Comm100 Ticket system, follow these steps: 1. Go to the Ticket list in Agent Console. 2. Click on the ticket you want to add a note. 3. Switch to the Note field. 4. Type @ to bring up the list of agents in your account. 5. Select the agent name from the agent list. 6. Complete your message, then click the Add button. A note with @Mentions has been added.

instruction: How do you get notified when you have been @mentioned in the Comm100 Ticket system?
output: When you are @mentioned in a ticket note, an @ icon will be displayed in Filters List and Ticket List. This allows you to get notified and easily locate the ticket that requires your attention. Additionally, a default @Mentions Filter is created to display all the open tickets in which you have been mentioned, and you can customize this filter as needed.

instruction: What are the benefits of using canned messages in live chat support?
output: Canned messages can provide appropriate and well-vetted responses, reduce training time, increase agent confidence and efficiency, and enhance service quality and consistency.

instruction: How can you ensure the effectiveness of canned messages in live chat support?
output: To ensure the effectiveness of canned messages, involve the entire organization in their development, leverage the experience of senior support agents, organize messages for different purposes, personalize messages, make conversations natural, monitor canned message metrics, open a suggestion channel, and continuously improve the messages based on feedback and changes in products, policies, brand, company culture, target demographics, and live chat applications.

instruction: How can I hide the chat button when my team is offline in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To hide the chat button when your team is offline, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat button, expand the Advanced menu, select the 'Hide chat button when my team is offline' check box, and click Save. Note that you need the latest version of the Live Chat code with JavaScript for this feature.

instruction: Why can't I receive WhatsApp messages after integrating with Comm100?
output: There are two possible reasons: your Twilio number is not enabled for WhatsApp, or the Webhook URL you are using is not correct. To resolve this, log in to your Twilio account, check if your account has been approved under Twilio > Messaging > Senders > WhatsApp senders, and ensure the Webhook URL for incoming messages is correct. Modify the Webhook URL as 'https://messagingproxy.{company name}.io/{messaging proxy}/{unique key}/whatsapp/whatsapp:{phonenumber}', use your account number in place of {phonenumber}, and click Save.

instruction: What are the system fields in the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging system?
output: System fields in the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging system are predefined fields that capture and save information related to a ticket. These fields include Assignee, Assignee Type, @Mentioned Agent, Channel, Channel Account, Contact Identity, Contact Name, Created Time, Department Assignee, If Has Draft, Is Read By Agent, Last Message Channel, Last Message Channel Account, Last Replied By, Last Replied Time, Last Status Changed Time, Last Updated Time, Priority, Status, Subject, Tag, Ticket ID, and Total Replies.

instruction: What are custom fields in the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging system?
output: Custom fields in the Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging system are user-defined fields that capture and store additional information relevant to a business. Users can define the data type, name, and other details for a custom field. These fields appear on the Info tab of the Agent Console and can be used to map Live Chat and Offline Message fields for more effective follow-ups.

instruction: How can I change the default email account for ticket replying in Comm100?
output: To change the default email account for ticket replying in Comm100, log in to your Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Ticketing & Messaging > Channels > Email, select an email account from the drop-down list Default email account, and then click Set as Default.

instruction: What types of reports are available in Comm100's Task Bot reporting?
output: Comm100 provides Task Bot reporting for the following features: Triggered Times, Collected Leads, Task Bot Usage, and Booked Meetings.

instruction: How can you analyze and read the Task Bot reports in Comm100?
output: You can read and analyze each report separately from various perspectives using the available metrics. You can choose the Time Range for which you want to check the report and display it by Hour, Day, Week, Month, or 24*7, or Half Hour. You can analyze the report data By Time, By Task Bot, or By Trigger Type and filter the report by Site and Task Bot. The Download button allows you to download the report in a CSV file to share with others.

instruction: How can you set up automatic email chat transcripts in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up automatic email chat transcripts in Comm100 Live Chat, log in to your Comm100 account, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window, expand the Advanced menu, select the 'Automatically email chat transcripts for archiving or followup' check box, enter the email address(es) to receive the transcripts, enter the subject of the transcript email, and click Save.

instruction: What are the initial steps to set up a Comm100 Chatbot?
output: To set up the Comm100 Chatbot, log in to the Comm100 Control Panel, navigate to Bot > Chatbot, go to the Manage Chatbots section, click Manage, then click the New Chatbot button, type a name, select a language from the drop-down, and click Save.

instruction: What are Intents, Entities, and Quick Replies in the context of Comm100 Chatbot?
output: Intents are the purposes or goals that a user wants the Chatbot to understand, such as booking a flight or paying a bill. Entities contain detailed information relevant to a visitor’s purpose and help extract data types from the visitor’s questions. Quick Replies are clickable buttons with pre-defined answers that provide quick responses or connect the visitor to an online agent.

instruction: What are the three types of chat buttons provided by Comm100 Live Chat?
output: Comm100 Live Chat provides three types of chat buttons: Adaptive, Image, and Text Link.

instruction: What customizations are available for the Adaptive chat button?
output: For an adaptive chat button, you can customize its color, icon, and the position for its desktop and mobile view. The color and icon apply to both desktop and mobile view, while the position can be customized separately for desktop and mobile view.

instruction: Can I have a sound alert when new visitors come to my site?
output: Yes, you can get a sound alert when there are new visitors landing on your webpages pasted with the Comm100 Live Chat code. The sound alert can be customized in your Agent Console window.

instruction: What are the benefits of integrating Comm100 with Dynamics 365?
output: Comm100's integration with Dynamics 365 allows you to easily access customer information in the Comm100 Agent Console and synchronize data conveniently from Comm100 to Dynamics 365. The integration delivers a consistent customer information management experience and improves your agent efficiency.

instruction: What information is needed to connect Comm100 Live Chat with Dynamics 365?
output: To connect Comm100 Live Chat with Dynamics 365, you need the following connection details: Dynamics 365 Organization URL, Application (Client) ID, Directory (tenant) ID, and Application Secret.

instruction: What is the purpose of integrating Slate with Comm100?
output: The purpose of integrating Slate with Comm100 is to streamline operations by handling chats and messages in a unified manner, allowing Slate users to manage student relationships and communications more efficiently.

instruction: What are the main steps to set up the integration between Slate and Comm100?
output: The main steps to set up the integration between Slate and Comm100 include setting up Comm100 integration from Slate, setting up Slate integration from Comm100, and remapping Comm100 and Slate fields.

instruction: What are webhooks in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: Webhooks enable you to extend the capabilities of Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging by receiving notifications when a trigger happens on a ticketing & messaging event. It allows you to register an http:// or https:// URL where the event data can be stored in JSON format.

instruction: What events can trigger webhooks in Comm100 Ticketing & Messaging?
output: You can configure webhook as a trigger action for eight different ticketing & messaging events: when a ticket is created, when a ticket reply is received, when an agent replied, when the assignee of a ticket has changed, when the status of a ticket has changed, when a ticket status hasn’t changed for a specific time period, when a ticket is updated, and when a ticket is moved to recycle bin.

instruction: How can Comm100 Chatbot send data to your web application?
output: Comm100 Chatbot can send data to your web application using a Webhook. You need to supply the Chatbot with a URL of the web application to receive the Webhook data and return the relevant information to the Chatbot service.

instruction: What kind of data can be sent to your web application through the Comm100 Chatbot Webhook?
output: The data sent to your web application can include 'Fields' in the Pre-chat Window, Custom Variables, Variable of Visitors, Last Message from Visitors, and Matched Intents. This data is sent in JSON format.

instruction: How can you set up email addresses to receive offline messages in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To set up email addresses to receive offline messages in Comm100 Live Chat, log in to your Comm100 account, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign, select your campaign, go to Offline Message, and set up the email addresses under the Email Offline Message section. You can choose to send offline messages to all agents' email addresses, specified email addresses, or set up email addresses under Global Settings > People > Departments if using Routing Rules.

instruction: How can you change the email sender address for offline messages in Comm100 Live Chat?
output: To change the email sender address for offline messages in Comm100 Live Chat, navigate to Live Chat > Campaign > Chat Window > Options for Visitors menu, and change the SMTP server settings under the Allow visitors to email chat transcripts option.

instruction: How do you create an article in the Comm100 Knowledge Base?
output: To create an article in the Comm100 Knowledge Base, log in to your Comm100 account, navigate to Knowledge Base > Knowledge Bases > Articles, click 'New Article', input the article title, select a category, optionally add tags, optionally mark the article as Featured, draft the content in the HTML editor, preview the article, change the status to 'Published', and click 'Save'.

instruction: What are the optional steps when creating an article in the Comm100 Knowledge Base?
output: The optional steps when creating an article in the Comm100 Knowledge Base include adding tags to help identify articles from the backend, marking the article as Featured to appear above non-featured ones, and drafting the article content in the HTML editor or pasting the source code using the Code View button.
